text: Food at Chubby's was excellent we have table 5 and Deni was our waiter priced reasonable and the food was good

Heard about this place from friends and decided to stop by. The food was great and the environment was great. Good music playing was playing and that was a plus. The custom sauce bar was really cool. Deni was as great. He knew the menu well and provided a lot of options for our first time. 

We didn't get to try their conveyer belt options, just another reason to come again! 

You should come here!
i waited 2 hours only ate vegetables. Too slow. Spicy soup is not any spicy. I tried the most spicy that it cost $21. Too bad and too hot place.

Deni was our server, super good service, really good food (I came here two days in a row) and the broth is delicious. 
Way better hot pot than other places I've been to in the D.C. Area.

This place is bomb.  Food is amazing.  You have a conveyor belt system that rotates the small plates of seafood and veggies on,  so you can pick whatever it is that you want in your hot pot.    We also ordered some beef too.  We picked the spicy broth and house broth and both were tasty.  Nice clean atmosphere and the vibe is great.  Our server was so nice and was attentive to everything.  Highly recommend this place if your looking for a different hotpot experience.
Deni is our server.    Love this hot pot .   It's on jones and spring Mt.     If you like real Mongolian hot pot

Last night a group of friends and I came here for the first time. The food was good, we were all impressed with the setup of the conveyer belt, and I was excited to recommend this restaurant to my family who I thought would enjoy it. I really wish I got the name of our waitress because what she did completely turned me off from ever wanting to step foot in there again. We were thanking our waitress as we were walking out and I did not think much of it that she did not really acknowledge us. But she kept trying to look past me over towards our table and I had a feeling she was looking for tip money, which was placed under the receipt. My group of friends were saying our goodbyes outside when our waitress comes out and what she does just BLOWS. MY. MIND. She starts demanding more money because she is not satisfied with her tip. She just stood there holding up the receipts and did not want to leave until she revived more money. All of us were completely shocked that she had the nerve to chase us down and harass us about a tip. Tip is not mandatory, so where does one get the nerve to be that unappreciative and ask for more? And why would anyone even think they deserved or would get more after acting that way?! The tip amount was good and fair for the service provided. Our group was not skimping out on the money. Even if we left nothing it would not be okay for her to do that. Our group should have talked to a manager but we all just wanted to leave. This was not acceptable behavior and I hope this is not the standard for how their staff treats customers.

I really created this yelp account just to share this bad experience. That's how much it bugged me.

we went tonight for my wife's birthday... the ambience and the food was great. we ordered the house original soup base and its exceptional. as for those who crave spicy soup base, their hell soup base is right for you. the price is affordable... their combos and platters is a great add on. we would like to commend the staff especially our server, matthew for his exceptional knowledge about the menu and his outstanding customer service. i do recommend for you to try this. we will definitely going back and let friends know how great our experience had been. thank you!

If ever want to try hot pot, Chubby Cattle is a great place to start. Great selection of high quality meat , seafood and etc.. Service is always on point. Our servers name was Deni and he was great. He was very knowledgeable and suggested great items. The whole experience was great. We would definitely come back.
Deni is my server excellent food and services very accommodating and friendly.The portion of the serve is satisfying and filling.

First time here! My wife and I really enjoyed the hot pot here.  Deni our server was very friendly and was kind enough to walk us through the menu.  We ordered the ying yang pot, both sides were very flavorful. All other items ordered were very fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back, hopefully getting a table with the rotating dishes!!
Best place for Chinese hot pot in Vegas. Lots of selections of meat and seafood. Soup base is really tasty. I love their original soup base. Our server is Matthew. He is great.

I've never had hot pot before so I wasn't sure what to expect. It was a lovely experience though. Gilbert was excellent and he explained the menu thoroughly. I had the mushroom broth. It was tasty and the veggies we ordered were fresh and delicious. The brisket was my favorite of the meats. We ordered the noodle combo and that took the soup to a whole new level. Over all I enjoyed it but next time I'm definitely going to go with people that know their way around a hot pot so I can't get the best combinations.

First time here for my dad's birthday. The food was very good. We got the heaven n hell broth with the beef, veggie, seafood combo. The dark broth was spicy but bearable to not ruin the experience of food and it gave enough flavor that I didn't even need to use my sauces. The light broth was simple and good. The environment screams good vibes. And the staff gave us good service. We drop our chopsticks and they gave us another one in seconds when we didn't ask for it. Thumbs up to them. They also played Happy Birthday song for us when they put the cake out. Our server was Deni. He and all of the other staff gave us great attention.
What a great and fun concept for a hot pot restaurant.  The staff is great and the food is fresh.

We thought we'd get creative and dine off-strip for a change. The price was fine, and the sauces were on-point. Soup base was fine, a little oily. We ordered "vegetable platter" and got a basket of whole vegetables that was more like a bag of groceries than a platter. But fine, veggies are veggies. Meat was average quality -- the beef sampler platter was better than the house special. Didn't get anything from the conveyor belt.
Dani was a great server and explained everything very well. Would definitely come back to this place for some good hot pot.

The food was good, but portions were small for the price. The conveyor belt concept is cool but most people ordered a la carte (better portions this way); with a group of three or more, you get to sit at a table-the bar was a bit cramped so the people next to us kept bumping into us. Service was decent. Felt they could have checked up more often but overall, a chill vibe. They offer membership if you fill out a survey, and free ice cream if you give a Yelp review. (They request you give them five stars while standing over your shoulder so I don't know how legitimate all of these reviews are.) After all that, they'll also ask you to tag them on facebook. The free ice cream isn't worth it.

First time in, on a Saturday night, with a party of ten people.

I was excited to try this place. We were looking for some good hotpot, and this place lived up to even my unrealistic expectations.

Pretty straightforward. It is NOT "all you can eat" so you pay per item. This is fine though, because it seems that the quality of meat is usually better when it's not AYCE. With larger parties, they said they only had the option of individual hotpots, which worked out just fine. They also recommended that we get different meat and veggie combo platters to share with the table. This also turned out to be a great option for sharing so everyone could try something different.

Since I don't eat pork, I always tend to go for the vegetarian soup base option at places like this. Most of their soup bases are made from a beef & pork mixed broth, including their House and Hellishly Spicy. So I couldn't try those. But they did have an Oxtail base, which was all beef, and two vegetarian options (Mushroom and Tomato). I tried the mushroom pot and it was about as tasty as you could expect. I got great feedback from the table that all the different bases were spiced well and added good flavor. The Hellishly Spicy pot came in level 6, 12, and 18 (essentially mild, medium, and hot). To put it in perspective, my fiance is Vietnamese and can handle really spicy stuff (more than me), but the level 12 (medium) was a little much for her.

We shared the beef combo, which consisted of brisket, ribeye, and Japanese wagyu. This was a great option for two slightly hungry people to share, if you plan to add veggies.  If you're both pretty hungry, you may need a little more. We got the large udon noodles that were supposedly good for two people, but we found ourselves ordering a second one. Some of the table added lamb, shrimp, the veggie combo and mushroom basket. 

The sauce station was good, though they regularly ran out of the small bowls, and we had to ask for them a few times. I mixed the ponzu with some chili paste and fresh green onions, and this was a delicious addition to the dish. 

For everyone, the bill was about $350 after tax and tip. About $35 per person, which is comparable to AYCE anyway. Not bad. 

Service was decent. It was a very busy night, so I can't fault them completely, but it did seem like they were a little irritated when we asked questions or needed things.

As expected in most of the Chinatown plazas on a Friday or Saturday, parking was a nightmare. I would recommend getting here at least 10-15 minutes early to make your reservation. 

Overall four stars. It was definitely above average.

Love this place!
been here twice and gotten great food each time. we got the beef, seafood, fishbowl, and veggies combo for a table of 10. we had to sit separate tables but we were put next to each other and our server deni was a great help. 
would come here again with friends and family. 
p.s. they give out free ice cream

Very warm and friendly restaurant. I called in advance to check seating, and was greeted by a kind employee who assured me that my belly was not about to go hungry that night(hehe). Upon arriving there, she thanked us for calling in advance. How nice of her to remember! 

I was reccommended to this place by a friend, and I was no doubt satisfied. In Las Vegas there are basically no conveyor belt restaurants, but Chubby Cattle happened to be an exception! I still wish this included sushi as well though. Anyways, on to the good stuff. This restaurant is hot pot-based, with the side dishes rotating around on a motorized conveyor belt. I LOVE IT. Different dishes have different prices usually ranging from $1-$4 I believe, but its all pretty affordable. I ordered the house pot, which tasted like mushroom or chicken broth, which was delicious. From the conveyor belt, I decided to take sliced beef, tteokbokki(korean rice cakes), chopped spam, spinach, and what looked like buckwheat noodles. All of these made a delicious combination. The only thing to watch out for, is the temperature of the soup. When you aren't cooking the ingredients, make sure to deactivate the heater, or else you are in for quite the tongue-searing ride. 

Between this and Pho, I would definitely choose hotpot. Why so? Hot pot is customizable, and can be heated right from your table. This plus the conveyor belt truly ended off my shopping trip with a bang. If you are coming to eat here, make sure to bring some friends! If you don't, then have no fear; there is a bar-like seating area for those who are riding solo. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

I had a excellent experience at chubby cattle. Everything was delicious. My favorite was the lamb chop. It was the best. I also love the unlimited free sauces that you can mix on your own. The atmosphere was great and the servers especially Kwan and Gillbert were friendly and nice.
Super awesome! Demi was our server and he gave us a lot of great suggestions. It's fun to watch the conveyer belt go around with all the yummy dishes!

This place is great! Went with parents & hubby tonight. 

All the different broth were delicious & aunthentic & not 'white-washed' if u know what i mean . Be careful with the hot&spicy one, it was too spicy!!
The oxtail broth was the best i think, the original broth was pretty good. If you bring a non asian person like i did, they should stick with the safe tomato broth lol

The veggies were all fresh, the food was good quality over all. The condiment bar was excellent with green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt & pepper and alot other irrelevant ones that i didnt use lol i loved it tho, i kept going back to it. 

The service was surprisingly great! Our guy was Deni with the man-bun. He was friendly & very attentive to our every need, i mean every single one, i had kindda a dumb "accident" that shouldnt be mentioned here. Deni made sure my 'need' was satisfied. 
He was very patient with us first timer & explained it to us commoners lol it was a great experience, give them a try.

Came with the family to try this new hot pot experience. the soup bases were awesome. Each of us ordered a different soup and each thought it tasted great. Really cool conveyor belt with fresh additional items for the hot pot. I really liked the variety. My kids want to come back and each try another soup base. Our server Deni was awesome and made some great recommendations for a good first experience. Come early or put in a reservation bc it gets busy here.
Love here!!! The hot pot is very good. You can choose a small one personally, or a large one share with your friends. Gill is the best sever that we got!!!!

Awesome place for hotpot when it's cold. Our server was Xiao and she was very tentative to out table. Broth was great and since it was our first time she helped out with explaining the menu. The orders came out fast and the flavor was great.

This is the spot for hot pot.  Don't let the conveyor belt fool you.  It's great to select the veggies and pasta and single portions are perfect. The service was GREAT.  Kwan helped with suggestions on how spicy the pot was and was very friendly. 

I was going to order medium spicy pot but Kwan strongly suggested entry level instead and it was a great suggestion.  He even assisted with a dipping sauce.

The ribeye, chicken and pork were high quality and the sake was the perfect addition to the meal. The place was busy too, so that is further evidence of the quality. 

We will be back!

How do I even start? By far THE worst customer service I have ever experienced in Las Vegas! First let me start off that we had a party of 8, when we arrive they tell us they do not have a table to seat us together. We are disappointed but nonetheless we wanted to try it out so we agree. But we are at two separate tables. As our waiter keeps "asking and waiting" for people from the other table, and I ask him "why?" He's like you're on one check plus 20% gratuity for 6 or more people. I explain that I understand but we are not even sitting together, why would be getting charged together, then I explicitly state TWO checks. His manager, says thats fine. Well our food came our delayed, he never came to check on us, and never refilled our water. He was too busy caring for his two large parties who came after we did and left before us. We FINALLY get the check and guess what?! Wow one bill, then obviously irritated and upset with the poor service we received we did not tip him well, he actually has the nerve to make comment about it!!! Apparently he didn't keep track of who ordered what, of course.

Lastly I will say this, the food isn't that great. Conveyor belt is a fun idea, small portions and expensive. I will not return and my net promoter score would be negative!

I'm from China and this hotpot is just as good as what I had in my hometown. Everything is fresh. Try the fresh fish balls and the potato noodle. Deni was our server and he was very helpful and nice! Try this restaurant, you won't regret it.

First time here and I am very impressed! The food is excellent! Me and my friend got the beef combo and it was a huge portion! Everything was wonderful and our server Kwan was fantastic! He kept checking on us to make sure we had everything we needed. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy an excellent hot pot meal!
We got pretty good service from our server Dani, the food was good and it came coming. We liked the experience.

This restaurant is too deceive people, 8 people actually eat hot pot can we eat to $1000, and also don't tell us the price of food, we still live in Las Vegas, if visitors are more expensive, I hope you don't come to this restaurant again, don't be fooled

Coming from the Bay Area where hot pot is abundant, Chubby Cattle is a great find in Las Vegas! The concept is simple that you basically order what you want. The broth is flavorful, the cut of ribeye and angus were of good quality and the vegetables combo was perfect for two. They also have their own sauce bar where you can create your own concoctions based on your personal flavor. Deni was very helpful in helping us decide what menu items to order and it was a great portion size for us. Would definitely come back again!
First time having a hotspot experience. Mixed reviews from the table but luckily I found a sauce that I added to my broth to elevate the flavors. Definitely returning.

If you love hotspots, def should check this place out! Portion and quality is good and the food and service was amazing! Our waiter Kwan and other staff members made sure we were doing great the entire time, and always checked on us to see if we needed anything else. Spicy broth and fish balls were delicious.

Mongolian hotpot where you can have individual pots of broth (kids can have original and adults can order spicy).  Ask your servee for help with the sauce mixes.  Our server Deni helped us figure it out (peanut sauce, sesame based, chili garlic).

Good service good food good environment good location! Pretty good! Especially Matthew, an most excellent server!
Good good good good!
Overpriced for the amount and quality of food. Service was OK but the waiter should do a better job explaining.

Good food. Shout out to Deni for being a great server. He was able to give us what we wanted when we needed it.

Restaurant itself is pretty cool. I like how the food circles around the contraption that is next to the tables.

5/5

This is my most favorite hot pot place here in Vegas. The flavors are amazing and unique! My server Zoe and the manager Joyce were extremely hospitable. 

I definitely recommend the tomato soup base and the Heavenly pot. The soups had earthy essences and the atmosphere was chill and classy.

They recently renovated the place, and they now have complimentary side dishes!

The place is upscale, but very family oriented.

Soup is great and price is affordable!!
Always order the beef and lamb combo.
The veggie n mushroom basket is awesome
Great for cold days in LV.
Matthew our server is nice.

Awesome experience ! We honestly didn't know what we were doing within the first 20 minutes lol ! Our server (Matthew) explained how it works and was also super nice. Fun experience & the food was very yummy, would definitely recommend it
Great service, great quality food, overall very satisfied!!!!  Recommended must try!!!  Gillbert is a excellent server with excellent service at the restaurant!

Wow. Delicious soup, fun conveyer belt options, and excellent service from Xiao Xiao, this restaurant is top notch. What a great restaurant for a date night or night with friends! We will definitely be back!
Amazing. Best in town. Superb food. Superb service. Great experience all around. Can't wait to go back.

First time here and is not going to be the last one . Very nice experience, excellent food and service.
Special Thank you to Deni are serve for all your help and info.

I got the spicy broth and I felt that it was too salty. I also felt that I didn't get as much for the money, since you have to pay separately for each ingredient you want in your hotpot. Overall, I felt like I didn't have as much "fun" as I thought it was going to be. I did like our server, who smiled and was polite. 

Pros: Customer service, ambiance
Cons: You do not get as many things for your money
First time at Chubby Cattle wasn't sure I would like it. Deni was an excellent server and took his time to explain step by step. I enjoyed the experience. Thanks Deni

First time here.  Food and service were both top notch.  Our server Deni was very polite and helpful.  The meat combos (beef and beef/lamb) were our favorites.  The seafood platter was big, but I felt not as fresh as some that I had elsewhere.
Server Kevin was awesome. I love his service. He's been so friendly all the time during the dinner. Definitely will come back again.

First time here and it was great. The place is clean and the servers are really attentive. Matthew was a great host. He explained how to cook hot pot and friendly.  The place is busy but it can accommodate a lot of walk in customers. Overall, it's a great place. I would come back here.
Amazing place! Got the beef and veggie combo and it was mouth watering! Deni was our server and he was very attentive!
The best Hot pot in Las Vegas hands down!!!! The service and food quality were amazing. Def coming back to bring my friends and family. Thank you again Gillbert for the amazing service!!!
Came here 6 times in last two months, food is good but just a little pricey, ribeye is the best I ever had in a hot pot place, service is top notch kevin, mei and kwan always friendly.
One of the best hot pot places in Vegas. Great service from Deni. Highly recommend this place!

We had a great time last night and our server was really accommodating. The food, atmosphere and the cleanliness from this place was excellent. I enjoyed the condiment station, wish someone could take a photo of the list so I can enjoy incorporating the sauces  at home lol. Our server was probably tired that he had a blooper by himself. We ask for a fork and he discussed the pork meat so we gave him a sign of fork so he smiled and came back with chopstick lol. It's even more funnier when he himself realized he grabbed the wrong one and kept on apologizing to us. He was such a good hardworking server though. I will come back in the future.

Awesome veggie and mushroom baskets. Had the seafood and mushroom broths and enjoyed everything. Was able to bring less adventurous family and still give them a great experience. Ordered half off menu and half off conveyor belt. Everyone enjoyed and we were able to customize a bit with sauces etc. Definitely recommend

This has got to be the best hot pot place I've been to...  Xiao Xiao our waitress was awesome, giving us a run down how it works... there is a conveyor belt of dishes that you pick the dishes from... Yummy and fun... must for anyone looking for a different place to eat...

Great hotpot dining experience. 6 kinds of soup base.  I especially like the seafood soup base.  Happy hour after 9:30pm is a great deal-  buy one get one free for side dishes.  If u are a member, u get 50% off the soup base. Will definitely be back again, especially when the weather gets colder.  Our waitress, Mei, was great with her recommendations.

I just ate so much my stomach hurts.  Given the meal I just inhaled, I really don't mind.
Chubby Cattle is my new favorite hot pot spot.  Everything was fabulous, and I wish I could give it 4.5 stars, because there are only a few opportunities for improvements.  
The mushroom basket, sea bass special, and Beef & Lamb plate were totally worth it.  I did find bones in the sea bass, though.  I don't recommend the Veggie Plate unless you really like lettuce and cabbage; you're better off picking up greens from the conveyor belt.  
Deni, our Server, was really communicative and great at walking us through the menu.
They have a conveyor belt that circles the entire restaurant that is really awesome.  It is hard to keep your hands off it while waiting for your soup.
We each tried a different soup base, & all were very tasty.  We will be back again!

On a whim my wife and I went to Chinatown in Vegas to experience where locals eat. We don't like to do the things on the beaten path. I was in the mood for hot pot so we found a shabu shabu place and we took a chance. Chubby cattle had great reviews and it did not disappoint. We ate until we were so stuffed and just kept cooking vegetables in the broth. My wife had the tomato soup broth which was phenomenal, and I have their normal broth which came with Chinese spice. The sauce bar was interesting treat, as we were able to make our own sauces and experiment with our hot pots.

I would definitely recommend this for a date night, or a small group.
Food is great, staff are courteus and nice. Great place to eat. The conveyer with food is great. Nice experience. I would recommend this place to my friends.
There's mini pots in the dinning table. That's pretty cool. Sauce is pretty good. If you stay in the lower tables, you'll find yourself surrounded by food on an conveyor belt. Deni was our waiter.

chubby cattle is awesome!!! we came here for the first time because of a friend's recommendation. everything was great... from the food to the service & all the crew. coming back again for sure & we'll brinh more friends.
My friend and I had dinner of hotspot. We really had a good time here ! Awesome time!!! The food here is so fresh and the service was really friendly :) We ate more than usually:( We will come back.
Yummy!!! Excellent service from Deni! Reasonably priced and quality is good. Would recommend to anyone looking for hot pot in the area.

A hip and new trendy take on a traditional staple! 
Our server, Deni, was a great help to us newcomers and overall food was really good!

Just ate here for my birthday. It was a great experience to eat great food with great presentation. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Servers are very friendly and especially Joyce she's really nice. We will be coming back here again soon!
Gillbert has so good service! And the hot pot is really good! Fresh everything! Come try!

I'm a fan of hot pot / shabu shabu. I am so  happy I finally found a very good one here in Vegas. Wide variety of meats, seafood, vegetables to choose from in a moving refrigerated conveyor. To top it all my server Queeny is very pleasant and helpful with all my questions. Thank you Chubby Cattle for the awesome meal.

I heard this place from my friends and went to give a try with my wife two weeks ago. After first try my wife and I both love this place. There are many choice to put in the broth and you have many different broth to choose also. All kinds of dipping sauces you can have. Both food quality and service quality are very nice. Very very satisfied  with our food adventure here and will come back a lot for sure! Thanks!
Hands down the best hot pot in Vegas. The tomato soup was incredible! Can't wait to come here again!

Wow, from beginning to end, this place is top-notch! The food is extremely fresh and delicious. Our server, Kwan, made food recommendations, answered all of our questions, and truly made our experience one to remember. Kwan deserves a commendation for a job well done! We will be sure to visit the Chubby Cattle every time we visit Las Vegas!

It's everything you'd expect in a hot pot restaurant. All the ingredients (vegetables, meat, and conveyor belt items) were top notch and service was great. The seafood combo platter was a little on the expensive side given the quantity ($20, which came with 3-4 pieces each of mussels, scallops, shrimp, and crab sticks). The soup comes with free refills though! I ordered their oxtail soup, which is now mixed with their tomato base, and found that the tomato flavor was a little overpowering (good for people who like their soups sour I guess). The mushroom and original soups, on the other hand, were perfect and had the right depth of flavor. Our server, Deni, was very accommodating and constantly checked up on us for our party of 5, despite it being a busy Friday evening. Overall, I would recommend this place if you want to sit down and enjoy some soup!
I came here on the recommendation of a friend for the oxtail soup. Food is great, staff is terrible and is always trying to solicit drugs from me. Never again.

This restaurant looks nice and clean, but the waitress inside really worth negative star if there is one.  The food in the restaurant is fair, meat and veggies are fresh, credit to the kitchen.  BUT the service in the front is slow, we have to call the waitress a couple of time to make additional order and our soup in the pot never get refilled.  Eventually, we have to wait over 15 mins before the check arrives to our table.  THE WORST THING IS, the waitress watch me when I writing the tip amount on the check and suggest me not to give her less than 15%.  "The minimum for the tip is 15%, we have to share with others, many of our customers give up 30% tips"  WTH?  30%? are you serious? for a HOT POT?   I got really pissed.  I end up gave her 15%.  I felt very uncomfortable to having this kind of service.  
Food is decent, but expect they ask you for 30% tips, it will show on the bill even with a grand total calculated out for you.

Came here for my anniversary and I love his place.  Love the line of food and the meat is great quality. They often have specials for certain occasions. We just happened to some here on Valentine's Day. They had a special for two which included your whole meal with a bottle of champagne.  Or meat was draped around a Barbie doll almost in lady Gaga fashion of a meat dress.  Absolutely great ambiance and environment, family friendly and very interactive.

Chubby Cattle is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. I try to go once a week if I can. Deni is my favorite server. Everyone is super nice and helpful. I really enjoy the sauce bar & conveyor belt with so many options. I've been to Hot Pot places that don't have those options. I leave with a full belly every time. I can't imagine ever liking a Hot Pot restaurant more than I do Chubby Cattle!

Good service good food 
This is the third time I have to try every time new food dumplings are very delicious
deni Is my service is good service
Happy hour buy one get one free conveyer belt specials, great selections and authentic broth flavors! Open late, great service from Queeny.

Omg, what a concept!  So easy to order, meat was fresh.  And you could order 2 different broths for different tastes, especially when your eating with multiple people.  Just have to be careful, it's so easy to just pull played off the conveyor belt that you don't realize how much it all comes out to.  Otherwise it's pretty decently priced.  

Definitely going back!

I brought my husband here for his birthday, and I'm not adventurous with food, but I was pleasantly surprised! The broths were awesome and the variety of meats was perfect! We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals and all of the options! Queeny was amazing as well! She took great care of us both! I would highly recommend this place to everyone!

Awesome flavor...broth is exceptional...all the sides you desire...Matthew was a great server!!  Have returned several times always friendly staff good quality food...Angela has been quite helpful and friendly

This restaurant really was an experience. It was unique from other hot pot restaurants. I will definitely return to bring my friends and family!

TABLES: You have the option to sit at a table with one large pot for everyone to share or you can sit at a table with many small pots for each individual to have their own (you'll have to let the host know before you sit down so they can give you the right table). Private rooms are also available. Make reservations or come after 9pm because this place gets packed!

ASSEMBLY LINE: In the center tables, there is a refrigerated assembly line of food the goes around a large portion of the restaurant. Customers have the options to open the refrigerator sliding doors to get the food right at their table. The food items are priced based on the plate color. My advice, stick to the menu, nothing from the assembly line is good.

SAUCE STATION: In the center of the restaurant, there is a sauce station for you to create your own sauce. I was amazed by the variety of their sauces. The peanut butter sauce is my favorite!

HOT POT/FONDUE: For hot pot, you have many options from the menu. It first we though it was going to be over priced, but after looking at the menu and seeing the portions they gave us, it was actually a pretty decent price for the food and experience. SOUP BASE: For the soup based, choose the tomato soup or the spicy soup. Avoid the mushroom soup! MEAT OPTIONS: For meats, you have to try the mouthwatering brisket. They recommended the rib eye, but it's no where near as good. For the meats, they are freshly slice to order. SEAFOOD OPTIONS: Now the seafood, if you want to try it, go for it, but my opinion, stay away from ordering seafood, it's not that good. I had the seafood special, it was very pretty in presentation, but nothing was good on it. You can also order the seafood individually. SPOON OPTIONS: They have various, meats and seafoods served on a spoon that you'll cook in your hot pot. It looks pretty, but it's a waste of money. VEGGIE OPTION: We got a veggie basket that included all the different veggies and it was really good. You can also order the veggies seperately.

DRINKS: They have a full bar if you want something to pair with your hot pot. The hot tea is served in a genie like pot. They offer various fresh juice. The mango juice was really good!

SKEWERS: They really advertise the skewers, but it's not that special. I'd advise just sticking to the hot pot.

DESSERT: THEIR ICE CREAMS ARE SO GOOD AND THERE ARE REALLY GOOD FLAVORS.

SERVICE: The host/manager Alex is extremely friendly, very organized, and hard working. He really makes his customers' dining experience a great one. Our waiter Kevin, was very diligent and he really knew the menu well. However, Kevin has the tendency to talk to you while you're eating and sometimes, he needs to give his customers the opportunity to eat. Everything was organized and it was a fun and relaxing experience. After coming back to this place, I have to say Matthew is my favorite server:)
Very unique place to dine. The broths and meat were on point.  Kwan was very helpful and informative.

We passed by this place and were curious about the name. Needless to say we were pleasantly surprised, what a fun dinner experience! This is definitely a must try if you are in the city. The service is excellent, our waiter guided us through the whole process and we found it easy and fun to cook our own food from our own table!
Don't come here!  Food was not good.  Soup bad was ok,  but you have to pay separately for everything.  Even the rice!  Don't wast your time or money. Go to the Red Pot instead!
Delicious, clean invironment-- Good for the Family bonding!! Definitely will come back!!

Great selection. Service was spot on, super clean, and packed. Great add to Vegas. Having been to Chengdu this is the closest thing to come to Vegas. The spicy broth is warm but comes in three levels. We tried the entry level and didn't have a ton of Szechuan peppercorns but the hotter versions might. The mushroom broth is awesome as is the mushroom basket. All the noodles are fantastic. 
No alcohol license yet but they let you byo.  We will be back.

Came with with a friend for girls dinner. We were seated promptly and told how the conveyor and hot pot works from the most helpful waiter. I even dropped my chopstick at one point and he saw it and promptly swooped in with a fresh set before I could pick mine up! Food was fresh and delicious and the sauce bar is fully equipped with many tasty sauces and condiments. They even gave us Java ice cream at the end which was a perfect sweet ending. Exceptional customer service and overall experience, start to finish. I will absolutely be returning.

It was my first time at chubby cattle and I'd definitely come back! Food was great and service was even better. Staff is super helpful in explaining the entire process and are very attentive. We ordered the house special broth and the beef combo which were both very good. The broth was mild and the meats were very good quality. Don't forget to add the spices and sauces they have in the center to your broth to really amplify the flavors! Shout out to our server Xao Xao who was very sweet!

Good for the first time but you may get tired with their choice of broth base when you are the 2nd visit. The material they used to make the broth are unhealthy and questionable. If you are health conscious peeps, this place is not for you.
Getting ready to eat some delicious food here with Deni our server.  Deliciouse food & delicious company here & great ambient & best of all affordable fresh food.
This place is great. We came here back to back. Deni is our server for the second night and he was good.  Food presentation is awesome. The food quality is awesome. Love this place
Had a great experience! Fun environment with great people. Kwan took great care of us! Reasonably priced for a cool experience. Will definitely be back

Chubby Cattle located in Chinatown is a great experience at a great price.  Your selections are abundant and the servers are extremely helpful in your adventure.  Your experience starts out with the selection of the base pot liquid.  We elected the mild and a modified extra spicy pot.  They were capable of providing two liquids in one pot.

Once you select your base, you can visit the sauce bar to make up your own blends for enhancing your finished cooked items.  We selected thinly sliced lamb, beef short ribs, beef rib eye, mushrooms, seafood (Clams, Mussels, Tilapia and Scallops), noodles and veggies.  You place your foods in the hot pots and then strain them out for consumption.  When you attack your noodles, you place your noodles in a cup and ladle in the liquid from the hot pot.

Venture out from the strip this is a fun time with great food, presentation and all at a very good price.

The ingredients are definitely fresh. The service is good. We had Dani as our server and he is excellent. The only thing is that the soup in the hot pot is not that flavored. But overall, a good hot pot place.

Always wanted to try a Hot Pot and this place was really good. I loved the style of it and how they brought everything out. I really liked the tomato soup. Had so many yummy flavors! Mushroom one was good because it had tons of mushrooms in it but wasn't very flavorful. 
Definitely will be returning!
Food was great here. They have the best lamb skewer. Service here was very good too. Our server Deni was very attentive! Everything's awesome!

I've been here three times now and I can consider myself a regular. My first experience made me want to come back a week later! Sadly, the second time was horrible - no sliced meats, poor service, and not accepting credit cards. I was randomly craving hot pot so I decided to give it another chance. I'm happy I came back though! Xiao was our server and she constantly made sure to check on us to see how everything was. Quality meats and a lively atmosphere makes for a great conversational meal.

Wow, this place is amazing all around.  I'm not a die hard hot pot fan like some people, but this place will have me coming back again and again and again.  The quality and variety of food will meet most people's cravings.  The conveyor belt of food is fun, you never know what's coming up next (yes!  They have blood, tendon and tripe) The service is incredible-thank you Kwan for always checking in with us throughout our meal.  You really made the experience 5*****.  The free make your own sauce bar is brilliant-suits even the pickiest of tastebuds.  I'll be back soon now that winter is approaching...

Love hot pot.  Brings back so many memories. I love the idea of the conveyor belt hot pot.  Last time I saw something similar was in mainland China.  Food quality was good and the plates on the conveyor seemed to be rotated fairly regularly.  

their "original" broth is flavorful and their "hell" broths are great!

All in all, a great restaurant in terms of the food.  Minus the one star because the server we had spoke too quickly, mumbled a lot, and called us (4 guys in the party), all "bro".  A lot.  like every few words.  Listen, I'm not your "bro".  Until I spoke Chinese to the waiter (towards the end of the meal), he did not seem too keen on offering good service.  I hope they address this training issue.

Food food, it's 5 stars. For service, it's a 4.  I'd definitely go back again.

I didn't get the chance to eat here but we wasted more than an hour in this establishment. I called the restaurant asking how long the wait was for four people and David replied 40 minutes. I asked if I could put my name down as we were coming from the hotel, and he happily noted yes and I got a text confirmation. When we got to the restaurant about 20 minutes later, we checked in and he noted that the wait was about 40 minutes... I didn't understand how the wait did not go down since it had already been 20 minutes. We waited for another 20 minutes and he was not able to give us a time estimate. He noted 40 minutes.. I may not be a mathematician but 20 plus 20 plus 40 minutes is not close to the original wait time of 40 minutes...

The staff is a joke. There were 3 girls there trying to help and all they decided to do was look at their system and then give an extremely random time estimate. There were multiple parties ahead of us- one party waited for almost two hours when the original wait time was an hour. A few other parties had reservations and were still waiting. David was too busy fixing his Santa hat and taking selfies and snaps of himself in the restaurant instead of helping the guests that were there.

We were a party of four and there were two sets of tables with four openings and no one decided to seat any parties. We let them know and then they went back to their computer system to see if it would magically tell them what to do. It obviously didn't. 

Please figure out how to service your customers as currently, it's a disaster.

Probably one of the best and most favorite hot pot experiences I've ever had! The sauce bar is spectacular, and has everything you need to make a to-die-for sauce (make sure to add fried garlic!) 

My favorite part was the beef wrapped enoki mushrooms from the conveyer belt! Also tried the charcoal lamb racks, which was great but could be a little more flavorful. The service was awesome too!! Our server named Gia was one of the sweetest and most helpful people ever. Would come back just for her!!

I have been here a total of two times and I am always impressed. Although there exists quite a wait for individual pot tables at night, it's definitely worth it. I typically order beef rib eye as well as the raw pork dumplings, glass noodles, and any extra vegetables. The conveyer belt around the restaurant is a cool addition to the ambiance as well as a great way to choose any extra add ons. Just beware of the sizing of the portions because my friend and I ordered 2 small sizes of bok choy and enoki mushrooms when in fact we probably could have shared one small of each between us. I typically order the spicy broth at mid level hell and it's the perfect amount of spice for me. I always look forward to eating here with friends with the fun communal environment, but your order can quickly become pricey if you're not keeping tabs of how many add ons you want.
The first HotPot I found in Las Vegas that was good. The spicy broth was great. The traditional broth seemed bland. I will def be coming back

Delicious hot pot and fun times! We went late and held up the staff after closing it everyone was very gracious about it.  Our waitress, Queenie, was very sweet and attentive to all our needs.  
Half of our table was brand new to hot pot and this was a good place to try everything out.  Highlights are the beef brisket, original house broth, lotus root, noodle combo, and lobster ball.
I absolutely love this place. Every other hot pot place I've been to in Las Vegas pales in comparison. It the the only legit Chinese hot pot place. Also the server James always really great as well.

We came here on 4th of July. We ordered lamb & beef combo, seafood combo,and mushroom combo, we also got noodles. They brought our noodles and then they didn't bring anything until we asked them so then they brought our seafood combo ( nothing like the photos posted on yelp or on Instagram). Then a few minutes later they brought out a beef combo but we didn't order beef combo we ordered a beef and lamb so they fixed that and we where going to wait for the mushroom combo but it took forever so we started to eat and we finished the meat and seafood and we asked about our mushrooms then they brought it out.( I feel like if we hadn't said anything we wouldn't have even gotten our food) We're pretty disappointed ....
Clean restaurant with good foods. Price is okay. The heaven/hell soup combo is my favorite. Legit asian spicy level.
So delicious!!!..... Great service, great food and on Sunday night... Happy hour is such a great treat!!  Run to the chubby!!!

Went here yesterday with my family while they were in town (Party of 5).   None of us had ever been here or anywhere like it.  Deni explained the whole process including how to order and gave us recommendations.  We ended up getting the Lamb, Kobe, Seafood platter, Veggies and all three noodles.   WOW couldn't have had a better experience or been happier with the meal.    Def give it a try. Their homemade noodles included green tea, tomato and a purple sweet potato.   These seemed a little weird but we liked them so much we ended up getting another order of the green tea noodles.   We were all full but decided to share a slice of the green tea crepe cake.  20 layers of delicious.   Not only are the noodles homemade but they also cut their own meat in shop as well.    Def worth a visit.

Cool atmosphere and great service. Deni was friendly and on top of making sure we were well attended. Definitely going to take my visiting out-of-town friends here when theyre looking for some unique dining experiences.
Spicy soup was good and mushrooms soup was great with noodles. The meats was fresh and the waitresses we're friendly
We absolutely loved this hot pot restaurant!! The bases soups were flavorful and the meats worked well in the soup! Our waiter was very helpful and helped us order!

Apparently, owners do oversee reviews and responded to my review left in regards, hopefully they reorganize there better way of booking reservations and also offered us to come back so they could make better of the situation and bump our 3stars rating up to 5stars. All I can say is, first and foremost, I'm happy to whoever responded to my review, yet, that will not change my first time appearance review experience that's honestly true. 

I will try your place again in due course time!

OMG!!  I've been dying to try this place out. I've been leaning back and forth as to when to go and decided to stop by today after visiting the Clark County shooting range on my way home. 

I really wanted to kick myself for not coming sooner!

Everything we tried was delicious.  Very flavorful and completely filling. Definitely recommend coming here. I forgot to shoot some photos but will next time I stop by. Won't be that long from now I'm sure of it.

I enjoyed the dining experience with making your own sauces and choosing your food off of the convayer belt. The soup was good. Not a lot of vegetable varieties. The small dishes add up to a very expensive meal.
Great place for families with kids. Great soup base! I recommend the House original pot.
Best place ever. It is a very high quality place with amazing food. I just love the way you get to dip your food in special sauce. Amazing waiter,Deni.

This is our second time at Chubby Cattle within a week! Our server tonight was Deni. He took great care of us!!! The food here is awesome! The first time I had the mushroom broth.  Tonight I ordered the tomato broth. Order that one! The tomato broth is definitely worth five stars! This is somewhere I'd bring our out of town visitors!

The best hotpot place in town. They have the best wide potato noodle, beef brisket, and beef tongue. Always order tomato soup, which matches well the all noodle :) thank u Deni for ur great service :)

If you have not been here I highly recommend you try it out.  You can make an online reservation here on Yelp, I recommend you do that they do get busy.  The spicy soup is so good I got medium level 12 lowest is 8 my husband got that.  Stick with 8 that is spicy enough.  The Oxtail with tomato soup mixed in is delicious.  We got beef and thin cut chicken breast, next time we will stick with just beef but it was all good.  The mushroom basket was one of the best parts for me there were about 4 or 5 different mushrooms in the basket all tasted great in my spicy soup. The mango and green tea desert cakes are really good too,mango was my favorite.  The waiter was awesome great service from the minute you walk in to the minute you leave.  I also noticed they have private rooms availbe for private parties.

Good hot pot. Can get it very spicy. Comes in three spicy levels. The quality of the meat is excellent. The beef combo is a huge plate. The veggies are always fresh. The conveyor belt is so cool. You can get either individual hot pots or huge family style. The watermelon juice is great also. They make it fresh.

Pick a soup base ranging from $4-$7  but seafood is more. then you can order ur choice of meat with the waiter, and lastly pick your choice of small plates on the conveyer belts (color coding plates) and enjoy.

We were sated at the bar which I felt was a bit tight in space, can't move around too much. We decided to order soup base of ying yang but was told can't do it at the bar, so we asked to be moved to bigger table but will be charged 3 times the amount listed in the menu. Ridiculous! We weren't even told there were dipping sauce for us to chose from the sauce station, even the person next to us didn't know about it. First time here, gotta inform us of such! Felt that the conveyer belt is lacking green veggies. Was told that Soup base was cooked for hours with chicken bones and other bones with no MSG and has  lots of Chinese herbs. The host girl went around and asked if the soup has any flavors and  I told her it was bland, but I drink the soup at the end of my meal, it has better flavor and sweet too , good!. So taste the soup at the end not beginning. Price was a bit steep for the pocket on a regular bases . I will only come on special occasions and they need to work out all the kinks as mentioned.

Updated: this is the 3nd time we came back. Every time the meat quality went lower and lower. The 1st time, meat was fresh and served with a good amount and quality. 2nd it was a little less and this time, the meat portion was very small and wasn't that fresh ( see the photos). Sorry but wont be a next time.

Excellent broth and great quality meat.

I recommend getting the spicy broth and eating the chilis along with your meat/veg. It creates this amazing numbing feeling on your tongue that nothing else I've ever eaten does.

The food is interactive and there is a lot to try. Try it for date night!!

Been there twice now just to reaffirm my so so experience. It was again average and not something I would repeat. We did the heaven and hell broth and it was really a let down. The he'll broth wasn't spicy and was really oily. Foodnwuskity was great and everything seems fresh, the overall just wasn't my my taste. Way better soup places in town so I won't waste time in this one.

Good place for Hot Pot. It wasn't the all you can eat variety I am used to in Washington but good just the same. They did have buy one get one free for some of the side dishes. No military discounts but they do offer school discount with ID.

This place is very delicious! First time was a little overwhelming as there are so many options to chose from. Have gone back a couple times since and couldn't be more happy. The service is quick and if you need any recommendations or questions the servers are always on top of it. Awesome date night or even a group of people would be fun.

Decided to eat at the Chubby Cattle on a whim and was pleasantly surprised by how much I loved it there! I've been to a couple hot pot places--both ayce and not--and was happy with the variety of selections and quality of meat. The service was absolutely amazing from the host to the server and anyone else who came to help us. On a Sunday afternoon, my boyfriend and I got seated right away though I can definitely see this place filling up! We got a family pot so we could choose three flavors of broth (I would recommend house and oxtail broth because the spicy one was a little too much for me to handle) and chose the beef combo. Everything brought out was in perfect portions and even if you ask for more, it came out quickly. Plus there is a sauce bar where you can concoct your own dips or follow simple recipes to bring out the best in your food. Definitely one of my new favorite spots to eat in Vegas! Coming back again next time! 

The only thing I would warn customers about is the parking lot. It fills up real quick but with so many great food spots in one plaza, that's bound to happen.

My friends and i had decided to come here on a Thursday evening to try it out since it has been highly anticipated for a long while. We had heard rumors of Little Sheep styled Hot Pot would come to vegas and this was supposed to be it.

My friends had arrived earlier and had been told that it will be about an hour wait for the tables next to the conveyor belt because it is almost purely reservations ONLY and there was an opening in an hour. My friend had put her phone number down and we went to District One for a snack. About 1 hour later, we returned. The hostess states she tried calling and the phone number did not work. Another friend looked at the number and tried calling. Worked perfectly fine. Does the hostess know how to call out of state numbers on a land-line? Does she know how to use a phone? She doesnt seem to be much experienced on customer service as her attitude towards customers is very poor. No apology or excuse. Just chugged along like a headless chicken. 

We waited another 10 minutes in the cramped space by the entrance with others coming in through the door squeezing behind and in front of us before we were taken to our table, which was still incompletely set up. The person setting up apologized for the incomplete setup, which was appreciated as it was not his fault we were taken to an incomplete table. 

We sat around for 10 minutes before our server came up, asked for our drink orders, and brought us 1 menu. The menu's are designed non-traditionally and mounted to a paddle. So holding it is a bit weird. 

While deciding on what to order, the waiter had asked us what soup bases we would like. But he said the house original and house spicy were out and only mushroom, seafood, and tomato were available. We had almost got up and walked out. The manager had came  up and said it would be ready in 10 minutes, if we were willing to wait. So we did. We had asked the server what the difference in size was between what was going around the conveyor belt, the combos in the menu, and the separate orders. He had to go get the manager to help us. The manager told us the difference was 5 oz and 10 oz for combo. The asian in us were highly confused as the math totally did not add up. It was about $11 for the lamb shoulder and beef brisket, as told to us by the waiter which the combo consisted, but it was about $17 for the combo. HUH!? An order had came to the "window" and he had showed us the size. It was a large plate with lamb shoulder piled high and he said it was a single lamb shoulder order. We thought, oh wao... Single order lamb shoulder is actually pretty decent sized at $5. Assuming beef brisket is about the same at $6. Manager seemed quite clueless too

We ordered 1 order of each, along with 2 large orders of watercress and napa cabbage, and a large order of fresh thick noodles. 

When the soup bases had arrived, they had looked a bit "clear" to me and my friend. As we were quite used to the white herb-y broth from little sheep, this had surprised us. It had a slight transparency to it and not fully white. When i tasted it, it felt watered down and tasted more salt/msg-like. Thats disappointing. Smelled great ! tasted meh

We had got some oyster mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, glass noodles from the conveyor belt but nothing else looked good. One of my friends said some of the oysters look like they are going bad, as some were turning yellow. Selection-wise in the conveyor belt is quite minimal and seemed to repeat quite often, nor seem like many people are going for it either. 

When the meats arrived. Give or take maybe 12 slices of meat per order and was NOTHING compared to the plate he had shown us earlier. The one he had shown us was on a round white plate, meat "rolls" piled high. Ours were on a long rectangular plate, with meat flat and layered. what the hell? we had asked about the size and the waiter said it is dependent on the slicer/worker in the back. I joked with one of my friends that we could tip the meat slicer and get quite a bit more. lol of cos we didnt do it but it was quite tempting. 

The veggies did not look that fresh. Especially the watercress. Bunched together in a "cup", it was quite hard to "separate" to share and some parts were turning yellow. Napa cabbage was in a bowl, cut. Kind of hard to screw that one up. 

Most disappointing was the "fresh thick noodles". definitely not fresh. nor were they thick. We LOVE the fresh thick noodles at Little Sheep. this is incomparable. in a large order, it was 3 "bundles" of noodles. all dried. and they had the thickness of maybe somewhere between angel hair and spaghetti. definitely not thick. Fresh? uhhhhh

In the end, our waiter had apologized to us as well for the confusion and minimal amount of info and knowledge he had. He stated he only started working there 3 days ago so his apology and willingness to help us was much appreciated. 

Definitely wont be coming back any time soon, if ever again. Won't recommend anyone to try

Craving some hot pot, friends and I came through but, didn't know how this hot pot place worked. The waiter Deni was the best, he took his time explaining how to order, recommendations, and also brought some extra special dishes which were his favorite. I don't write reviews but our waiter Deni was too awesome not to acknowledge, taking his time helping us and being very attentive.

Bad service

Orders arrive a lot faster when you speak Chinese. 

Spicy soup base is 75% oil contained.

The resto is good. Have wide selection of soup base for your hot pot. Other than having a hard time to park, and sometimes it gets really busy so u have to wait, the food is amazing, meats and veggies are fresh....
Amazing! Great food, service was great, Deni was really friendly. BYOB. Highly recommend!!!!!

I love this place but really wish the prices where a little better. Even for happy hour our bill ends up to $30 a person. Everything is really yummy especially the soup bases but much too pricey to eat as often as I would like.

This is the best hotpot in town! Natural broths and wide selection of meats and seafood plus other side items like Taro, rice cakes, mushrooms, pumpkin, veggies! Broths are very flavourful, my favorite is tomato then mushroom. If you think you have passed judgement on hotpot from trying other places... You have to go here and give it another try.   Make sure you tell them if it's your first time!
The food was good and it was a lot of fun to eat there.  I took my kids.  However, I would say it should not be your first hot pot experience.

A friend of mine brought me here for the first time, and I am hooked! It starts off with picking your soup base which range from mushroom to their house special. You then get to pick the items of your choice off the conveyor belt. This place is also vegetarian friendly! Your hot pot is set in front of you, and then you throw in your items. Their mushroom soup is my absolute favorite. I will be back here soon! Kwan was extremely helpful with explaining how the process works, attentive on making sure our needs were met, and overall a sweet person! 

happy hour: Sunday-Thursday (9:30-12:30) BOGO free

We were treated with one of the nicest staff I had ever met. A younger guy but I can't remember his name. I do remember the staff there overall being super friendly and nice enough to smile at pretty much all times. Chubby Cattle is extremely welcoming and has really fast service. Sadly my concerns are definitely with some of the food. The spicy soup base had way too much peppers or chili-the floating ingredients already in the base. It was quite the hassle when with a mild spicy dish, I had spent a long time fishing so much of it out of the soup. The inconvenience affected how much time I spent actually eating and boiling noodles and meat in the broth. I'd hate to say it but this negatively impacted my overall experience. The meat, if you get the lamb, comes in such thin slices that it near dissolved overtime on the place and worse was not something I thoroughly enjoyed after cooking in the broth. I think that a better combination of food would have made for a better time, so this understanding and the thoughtful/quick service is what saves my thoughts on the Chubby Cattle.

This hot pot is pretty authentic if you ask me! I grew up eating traditional Chinese hot pot at home and this place hits the spot for me! I like the individual pot you can order and put whatever you like in there! The conveyor belt was a cool idea but I didn't get anything from it, since everything looked pretty old on there. 

Service was awesome, our waitress was very accommodating and explained the menu to us since it was our first time. The sauce area was very convenient and lots of choices. I enjoyed the quality of the food and I especially loved their handmade meatballs! 

I believe they also have regular hot pot style where there is one big bowl in the middle for everyone to share! I am definitely coming back to try out more of their meats!
First time being in the restaurant with friends, the experience is great and the quality is excellent. The mushroom soup and ox tail is great, I highly recommend to those who enjoy food.

Food WAS DA BOMB!  HO
other and tasty... soups were excellent... the mushroom and original was GREAT! Waiter Deni was so nice...

We called & made a reservation, but they couldn't find it when we arrived.  After a bit of a challenge from the hostess we were sat. Our server was helpful & a second server James was too. We ordered the beef combo,  mushroom combo basket, and  house meatballs with the house broth. Food was delicious & would highly recommend this place.
Exceptional service and great concept for Las Vegas. We had two kids under 3 and it was great. Exceptional value for price.

Disappointing first-time experience with concept.  Conveyor belt food items were all vegetables.  Only one time did a plate of shrimp pass us by in 45 mins. Majority of items on conveyor belt plates were unrecognizable, at least to my husband and I   Broths were not as flavorful as you would expect from a restaurant focusing on "hot pot" cooking. Soda Beverages come in a can with a glass of ice.  No free refills here. Hostess was very abrupt and not friendly. Server was very kind and genuinely took interest in serving us.  Total for 2 came to a little over $75 with no alcohol.  I can say we will not be back a second time.
Back again at this place. It's cold so it hot pot time!!! Sauce bar is up graded and it looks cleaner. Expect me every week! Awesome place will definitely recoommend!

Our first time in the place and it didn't disappoint. The soup was very good and the price was reasonable. 
They have a different way of ordering but our waitress Xiao Xiao was very helpful!

I liked it the first time I came, but the second time (last night) not so much. My bf and I ordered the spicy broth and mine was pure grease. You know when you put oil in water? Yea, it looked just like that. It tasted just like it too. It was terrible. When trying to tell the server I didn't like it she just kept insisting it I was too spicy for me. Maybe a language barrier? She even scooped the peppers out even though I kept saying "it's just too greasy." I really think she just didn't want to get me a different soup because once I made it clear I wouldn't eat it and wanted a different broth she seemed bothered. After that she didn't really come to our table nor seem too happy when she did. But back to the food, the original broth I got instead was really great with seafood sauce and cilantro. It tasted VERY similar to Pho (my fave) but when the bill came it was nearly $20 per person. I could've bought actual Pho for 1/2 the price. Overall I just didn't find the food or service to be worth a $20 meal.

Great selection, nice sauce section, and everything was great the only downside was that the meal was just a tad overpriced.

I definitely liked the mushroom soup base but it does need a little more flavour.

All in all was a great experience because our server Matt was the man! He was humorous, friendly, and quick!

What a great new sort of DIY restaurant. Instead of a grill at a BBQ joint, you get your own pot of delicious broth of your choice. Build with meats, veggies, noodles etc. There is a table where you can share one pot family style which is pretty popular and we weren't able to get it. So plan ahead or reserve for that.

We've been wanting to try this place. Its a chinese style hotpot that has a rotating bar much like that of a sushi spot that has extra ingredients you can add to your hot pot. 
Theres a sauce bar that has all kinds of yummy sauces to add to your soup as well. They also have bottomless edamame and congee- although at night when we were there the porridge was out.
You get your own little soup burner and they bring the additional meats or items on menu out to you. 
We got the spicy soup base which was a szechuan style mixture and the oxtail soup base which was also very good. 
The ingredients were fresh.
The servers were very nice and helpful.

If you don't like close quarters do not sit at bar. Its a very asian style dining and youre just there to eat and leave.  It reminded me of the food stalls in Korea. Sit at a table if you really want to enjoy the experience.

Its a little more expensive than most places in chinatown about 30 per person. Cheaper than the strip though and the food is good! 

Happy souping!

Had a craving for hotpot and decided to try Chubby Cattle. The restaurant was packed but we were able to get seating by calling ahead to guage how long it would take. We were seated within 2 minutes to a larger table, and our waiter was very helpful with all of the different options. He recommended we do a split pot, which gave us the choice of two different broths. Everything came out promptly, and having the conveyor made it easy to add our ingredients. One of the most interesting dining experiences we've had here in Vegas, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Def plan on bringing friends and family here next time.

Finally came by, because of all the good hype! Unfortunately I wasn't able to sit by the conveyer belt of food. We got sat at a high table which was a tad uncomfortable as there wasn't much room for my legs. I HIGHLY suggest requesting to sit by the food conveyer  belt , as you can pick out the food/sides you want in your hotpot. And come on, so intresting!

They have an excellent variety of sides from meat, vegetables, and seafood. There is even a "bar" for sauces and small appetizers made available for you. It is self serve! 
There is also an actual bar inside too.
You get your own mini hotpot to yourself, and can choose from their chicken, oxtail, spicy, or a half spicy and half chicken broth. We did order a veggie combo, and wow. Its literally a basket of veggies! If you order it, its enough for 4+ people.

Service was a little slow, and our hotpot broth  took some time to come out. But they are more than happy to help you once you flag them down. I'll definitely come back again another time!

So. So. So. So. SOOOOOO GOOOD :)

I didn't really know what hot pot was until I came here and I'm such a fan!

First, the conveyor belt is just too cute. Very IG worthy. I was quietly grabbing plates of salmon sashimi as they would come by, unbeknownst to my fellow table partners lol I didn't want to share...

The heaven and hell pot is fun to share with a group. I like to get noodles from the conveyor belt and add broth to it from the shared pot. I'm definitely a meat lover, but the mushrooms are a must here too.

Service is good, even when it's very busy, and make sure you take advantage of the cold station they have set up with all the dipping sauces. YUM!
Love this place!! Best Hot Pot in town. Super clean, great food and our server Deni was really helpful and attentive.
Angela was our server and she was amazing!  She had excellent suggestions and brought us a delicious sauce to try!  The food is excellent and they are very friendly

I love this hot pot place! there are several hot pot based that i get to pick. i got entry level to hell and my husband got original one. we all got individual pot and the awesome part about this place is its sauce bar and its ergonomic sauce tray. it made the dipping sauce part interesting and its great variety of sauce option made the good even more delicious.

All the ingredients are really fresh, i love its lamb shoulder especially. it is so tender and fresh. tried it black cod it is extremely fresh. i am usually super picky when it comes to seafood bc i care so much about its freshness. i gave five star for its freshness. it has great variety menu items to choose from. i love its entry level to hell soup base, it is actually really spicy already not sure if i would be able to handle the regular spicy level.  this place soup place is similar to little lamb magnolia but better.  


I would definitely come back again! and the price is reasonable considering it is in Vegas

Been here 3 times. Here's my favorites:
Broth: mushrooms
Beef combo for $20- thinly sliced and juicy! 
I'm seriously satisfied with just that but you can grab whatever else from the conveyor belt.
Here's other items I've tried: 
oysters: fresh and yummy
seafood combo: great presentation, but I didn't think it was worth the price. I didn't like the octopus, super chewy to me.
mushroom combo: not worth the price, I would just stick with choosing the mushrooms I like from the conveyor belt (my favorite is the enoki).
meatball sampler: the presentation was beautiful, but didn't taste all that great, we liked the meatballs from the conveyor belt better. 
Also learned that you can only make reservations for parties of 4 or more. 
Parking is always terrible so we usually park on the other side of the strip mall pass Snow White.

The tomato soup is so delicious with veggies and meats. Alex was such a good server made my sister's birthday really fun for our first time there. We also got some watermelon juice that was delicious and my sister got a lychee mojito it's definitely worth getting it! Will definitely come back.

This place is good!  You pick food off a rotating conveyer belt and put it in the soup you order.  Sunday- Thurs is happy hour from 9:30pm - midnight.  The rotating plates are buy one get one free.  The house special soup is the best.  I come here weekly.
Delicious food with a huge selection.  Our server Deni was extremely helpful in explaining to us noobs how to order and use hot pots and conveyer.  We will be back many times.

Food are good, but service are really bad. We have waited for more than 40 minutes. No respect for Veterans even on Veterans Day! I could understand that no military discount on a regular basis. However, "NO!" With an ATTITUDE was not acceptable for a group of military personnel on Veterans Day!!! At least go and ask your manager!
Hot Pot! This is MY go to spot in Vegas. I won't even give any other place a try because I'm honestly satisfied .

???????????????? ?????? First thing first, the service here is just amazingly fantastic, even when my mother and I just dropped in on a busy memorial weekend the staff here didn't give us that "you should leave so we can get more customers" feeling. And as a Chinese person who had hotspots at numerous places this is surely one of the best places I've been to. The food here is also pretty fresh comparing to other hot pot places. The only thing is that the soup is a bit more saltier than other places so watch out for that.

Wow! I have been to many hot pot places. This place is definitely the best! The soup was amazingly tasty! The variety of items is unreal!! They give you a huge variety of dipping sauce for free! The price was awesome! I am a customer for life!! My waitress Xiao Xiao was also super super cool and on point with service!!

The place was awesome. Lots of great food and the service was superb. I recommend this place to everyone. Great for dates, family and friends. If you have the time and money, pig out on all the delicious foods here.

Chubby Cattle is one of my favorite hot pot place. Its very unique with its conveyor belt style. Ive heard of sushi being on a conveyor belt but to do it with hot pot is one of a kind.  Deni our server was very helpful on introducing us with the style and what to do

This was a different experience than the normal hot pot experience. Gf and I are big fans of hot pot so we decided to give this place a try. The hot pots are personal sized and are ordered individually along with the meats, while the sides and veggies are rotating around in a conveyor belt, which was a first for me. 

We both got the original soup base, which was hearty and filling. For the meats we had hand cut angus and ribeye, both of which were super soft and yummy. Selection of sides are a little on the limited side, but prices were reasonable, especially if you come during happy hour (buy one get one free sides). The meal comes with free ice cream. Get the chocolate. That stuff is bomb. 

All in all, a good hot pot experience. Would recommend.
This is just straight disgusting. Found a roach disintegrated in our broth tonight. Stay away from this place!!!
Great atmosphere and friendly staff! Matthew was awesome and very helpful explaining the menu. Will definitely be back!

I'm a huge fan of hot pots but this place fell short for me. We got the seafood and the beef platters. The presentation of the seafood was great but I will say that this place is overpriced for hot pot. They charge for EVERYTHING including sauces. You pay per plate including small items like lettuce, mushrooms, you name it. Our bill for two people was $80+ which is quite pricey just for hot pots. I personally think there are better places to eat for that price. It was decent but wasn't amazing. It's good to try but we wouldn't come back for it.

If you tried this place prior to their remodel and wasn't a fan, I'd give it another chance. Since the renovations, the place definitely smells better when you initially walk in and the sauce bar makes better use of the space now. 

You get to choose your soup base and the cost of the meal will depend on how much you decide to add. Brisket is always a go to for us. And no pressure to order everything at once, they have a conveyor belt with add ons depending on the place color, they'll charge. 
No matter which soup base you go with, you'll end up adding things to make it tastier unfortunately. The broth is super bland. 

Can't really expect too much service since it's kind of a self serve place...if there's more than a 30 minute wait to eat at this place, I'd honestly pick to eat somewhere else. 
Don't get me wrong, this isn't a bad place to eat, I just wish I didn't have to customize my food so much and end up with a bit of a pricy bill :(

First time here with my family and friends. Once we entered we got greeted by their very friendly staff immediately. Our server was Deni and that man i tell you he is the best. Recommended thing that would make more sense and save us money. Also pours our soju in our glass when we were low or empty. Always there when we needed something and gave us 5 star service for sure!!!! We are definitely coming back to see you DENI thank you!!!!

Wonderful experience, servers were professional and quick to assist. The food was outstanding, and the price was also fair. Ask for the watermelon juice tho. That was a goer. Can't wait til this place sells alcohol!

This place is so cute and one of a kind! Great service with slight wait when we got here at 730 on a Friday night  the broth is amazing and there's so many lamb choices. I'm so happy and will be sure to be back. 

Xiao Xiao and the team were great!

Although we were quick to be seated and was waited on by a very attentive waiter, the ala carte pricing of this establishment prevents me from awarding more stars, especially when there are AYCE Korean BBQ restaurants of similar standing available around the city.

The menu should be simplified.  It's much too daunting to have to read through.

If a customer requests a Diet Coke, do not bring a Coke Zero to the table and insist it's much better tasting.

There is a great Chinese restaurant. Customers can taste a traditional Chinese style food. Xiao xiao is a good server. She helps us to get discounts!!! My friend and I always come here, hope you like here too.

First time coming to chubby cattle and they did an amazing job at helping with understanding the menu.
Deni was our server and he told us what to try! I order the beef tongue, shoulder and lamb which was great. The vegetables tasted great also and there were many things to choose from. 
I will definitely be back to try the other items on the menu. 
The service was great! Good job
Great atmosphere great food great service..Thanks to our server Deni..love the food I can eat this every day we took out parents here twice now ..

The food was hot and excellent. There are a variety of spices, vegetables, and meats you can select from the conveyor belt, small spices buffet and menu. I highly recommend on trying it. Xiao Xiao is a good waitress. I recommend asking for her if you plan to come here.

Wowwww. This has got to be one of my favorite hot pot place. My family and I came here on a Friday night and got the yin and yang hit pot with the original house soup and the tomato broth. The tomato broth was my favorite! We also ordered the veggie platter, the rib eye, the wagyu beef, the pork belly, and the green tea noodles. The rib eye was to die for!!! The meat nearly fell apart while cooking! Definitely will be back!

Had dinner here and was a good spot for hot pot. Most of the small dishes came through on a conveyer belt. Order your soup base, and different proteins. Then go to station to create your own sauces.
