Also have "free appetizers" which was just pickled iceberg lettuce and edamame. Soup base was good, and the meats were very good. The beef combo is definitely the thing to get and not the seafood combo. That was very overpriced. Overall decent+ food and a fun experience but a little over priced. Small portions on a tiny dishes for avg of $3-$5 Good place but due to the reviews and hype, didn't live up to high expectations.
I am a hot pot noob. Deni was the most helpful server ever! He taught me what to do and made great suggestions. Loved all the combos that we ordered

love the atmosphere here, for it is casual but  everything is clean and fresh. The soup base was good and honesty speaking it is better than most hotpot restaurant like little sheep or others. The servants were all nice. The only complain that I had was there was sligh limitation of choices of sources. I would love to have more choices. Overall it was good and worthy of trying.

Delicious dinner and great service and recommendations from Deni. Definitely try the oxtail soup base and meat sampler! You can make your own sauce to dip the meat. The conveyor belt of food can add a special kick to your meal thought you may not always know what you are getting.

Great Food, awesome experience. Very clean nice wait staff especially Deni.  Good price for the quality, quantity and atmosphere.  It's not a quite romantic place but it's a great date night place for adventurous couples who like a good vibe. Would go back with and try some of their other offerings.

My new favorite hot pot place in Las Vegas! I think this is my 4th time here in the past month. Chubby Cattle has both delicious food and good service. The conveyer belt is a great idea. James was our server twice and is super nice.

When I was in Vegas back in April, I was looking for a good dinner option - preferably away from the strip. I had planned most of the meals during the trip but came up short one evening. Of course, I yelped and found this place. Fast forward to today and I still think of this place from time to time. After my meal, I remember telling my parents that this was the best restaurant that I have ever eaten at. I still stand by that statement today. The servers were great and explained in great detail on how to order and the customization that is left to each person since you can get your own hot pot! This worked out perfectly since my parents and I are like the three bears - my dad likes super spicy, my mom likes a little spicy, and I prefer mild. Overall, I had a fantastic dining experience. I have been to resolving sushi bars before so I loved seeing a conveyer belt used for hot pot ingredients. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who visits Vegas.

This place truly exceeded my standards. I thought it was a typical hot pot restaurant that just opened up. I mean they do open at 5 pm everyday which is kinda late and they have happy hour from 9-12 
They have a bunch of frozen dishes you can grab off the conveyor belt kinda like genki sushi in Hawaii! But basically you choose a broth (which they have like 5 types) and you choose your meat dish (beef combo) and you can choose your noodles (noodle combo) and you veggies. 
My server was deni and he was SUPER helpful with explaining to us how to order and what is most popular and he was a very good server! He made our experience more enjoyable! 
There's also a whole area JUST for sauces! You can go and pick all your sauces and they don't charge so you can try all of them if you want. 
Half way through eating I thought I wouldn't be able to finish!!! There was so much food and it was so filling. I thought the bill would be over $100 since there was so much to eat. 
Surprisingly the bill came out to $60 and for the amount we ate it was DEFINITELY WORTH EVERY DOLLAR. This place is of course just another hot pot spot that just opened but it really beats all the other hot pots in town. This place has VARIETY, and not Just variety it has great workers, good atmosphere, good price point, and the food has NO MSG! Tastes fresh made straight from the kitchen. Definitely coming back for more! 5 stars!

I was so excited to try this place but was sorely let down. The quality of the seafood was "fishy" and the meat was "gamey." For the price we paid for the proteins, I expected more. The experience was unique and the server was attentive, however; the process wasn't explained well to us and we were left scratching our heads and had to "figure" out what to do with the food and guess at what we were taking on the conveyor belt. It was an interesting experience, but one time is all we needed.  We likely won't go back :(

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I feel like I'm in a different city when I'm inside. Their set up is very nice. Clean. The soup, seafood platter, shumai balls and meat are all delicious! Plus, the service is great particularly from our server, Matthew! Will definitely come back.

Wow! This place is amazing. Let me start out with the awesome conveyor belt of food! It's so cool! Actually, let's start with the how. You start by ordering your base. There are lots of flavors, I would recommend asking your server. Then, you get to choose your meat. We did the beef combo and it was plenty of food for 2. We also picked some veggies and noodles from the conveyor belt. I did green tea noodles. Boy...they were delicious! I also added some mushrooms in and made sure to make a special sauce from the sauce bar in the middle. I read so many reviews saying how expensive this was. I'm unsure how anyone spent $80 here for 2 people! The prices are amazing. I could see how getting different foods from the conveyor belt could be expensive (they are charged by plate color) but overall, for 2 of us it was $35 which I thought was amazing! I can't WAIT to come back here and try so much more off of the menu. 

I also wanted to give a HUGE shoutout to Sylvia who was extremely helpful and walked us through everything. She mixed special sauce for us and explained what everything on the conveyor belt was. The service is so amazing. There is not 1 negative thing I have to say about Chubby Cattl

Once we finally received our food it was great.  The staff was nice but HIGHLY disorganized.  This was on a Tuesday night.  It took nearly an hour after ordering to receive our cold soup base and raw foods.  This could be a great social place to dine if they become more efficient.

If you're a fan of hot pot, you need to moove on over to Chubby Cattle! I've been by a couple of times now, most recently for their reopening with their expanded menu featuring more meats. Not that they needed any, but it's definitely a place to take your favorite carnivore. Note that they also have extensive seafood and veggie options, too.

PICK YOUR BROTH: The tomato is a go-to, but if you like spice opt for the medium, which completely cleared out my sinuses. They are not kidding. I wouldn't go hotter than this. Props for having individual broth bowls as well as half-and-half options.
MAKE YOUR SAUCE: The station in the dining room has several sauces, herbs, and add-ins to make a dipping sauce for your meat. I like combining all the garlic and chili options, then topping with cilantro, green onion, and fried garlic. There are mouthwash stations in the bathrooms so your garlic-heavy food won't ruin your post-dinner date night plans.
EAT YOUR MEAT (and veggies): The bounty of hot pot add ins here is insane, from baskets of veggies and platters of protein, all photogenically presented for your  pleasure. The combo plates are your best bet, allowing you to mix and match. Check for specials, like Dorper sheep and crawfish. Some of my favorites have been the wagyu, brisket, quail eggs, and shrimp paste. Don't forget the enoki!

Reasonable prices and attentive service are just bonuses here. If you're coming in solo or as a couple, sit by the conveyor belt. Consider a late-night visit for their half price happy hour. Families and groups can request a private room for celebrations.  Hot pot isn't something I have often but Chubby Cattle has definitely raised the bar for my expectations when I do.

Bin, our server, was amazing! He presented the menu to us and answered any questions we had. My family & I truly appreciated his customer service. The food was yummy as well and I loved the overall experience.
Great service, friendly people. We've got Denis as our server; Very humble. Fresh meat and veggies as well

Favorite hotpot place in Vegas. Really creative idea. 
Gillbert was an exceptional server~ and the bus person was also really nice.

First time trying this place and it was an interesting experience. Don't know if it is a weird night, or  just my bad luck or if this has happened before but the whole night was just interesting. 

Walking in the door I noticed that they do not accept credit or debit card for the night because their machine is down, not a problem, between my friends and I we have enough cash for the meal. 

We started off sharing two soups: the original and tomato - I thought the original soup was delicious, very sweet and savory, also very healthy. Not a fan of tomato so did not care for that. We got a vegetable combination; came in a little basket which is really cute, good variety of veggies too. Got a beef combo which came with brisket, rib-eye and something else. And a noodle combination which came with 4 different types of noodles. 

Here is where it gets a interesting:
-They informed us that they will be substituting one of the noodle in the combination with something else because they are out with the one that was supposed to be included in the combination
-We ordered chicken breast and was told their machine is down so no chicken, then we asked for free range chicken and was told they did not have that either 
-Then we wanted more meat and same story - meat cutting machine is down so no other meat besides the hand-cut angus beef - they took $2 off the angus beef because we had no other choice but to order it
-My friend wanted the taro knots...they also did not have that
-After the meal we wanted to try the fondu for dessert.... and you guessed it - they did not have that either - our server told us that they only had the fondu for the first few days of opening and they stopped it after that because it took too long to prepare and it wasn't profitable... they should take this off the menu then!! They only offer 3 desserts and the picture of the fondu takes up half the page...heavily promoted for an item they no longer offer 

So that is that... our meal was not 100% enjoyable because they did not have anything we wanted to order...I will say that the soup was really good, the items that they did have tasted very fresh and delicious, service was also great. All the staff were very friendly, attentive. Shout out to Brandon who was very funny and friendly!
Long wait not what i was expected no return for me. Had better experiences at other similar places
Great place!!! Love hot pot!!! All the broths were delicious.  Meat and seafood are fresh.  Conveyer belt food is awesome.  Matthew our server was attentive and helpful- gave great recommendations!!!

I've been to Chubby Cattle quite a few times now. It's my go-to spot for hot pot. They used to have a casino and student discount on Sundays and Wednesdays where it's BOGO free. However, they have now changed that. Instead of BOGO free, you sign up for a pre-paid card (much like a gift card) and you get an additional amount of $$$ (I've attached a pic). So if you place $100 on the card, you get an extra $18; purchase $200 and you get additional $38, and so on. 

The broth is what keeps me coming back. I've had the tomato, original, oxtail, and spicy pot. Only one I haven't tried is the mushroom. My top 2 is the tomato and original. I also recommend the beef combo, and the juicy beef balls. The beef balls are filled with soup in the middle so be careful and make sure you don't chomp down on the whole thing! It burns! I speak from experience. 

They also have a wonderful sauce bar where you can make your own sauce for you to dip your food in. If you look at the top of the sauce bar, there are signs that'll give you samples of what sauces to mix to go with whatever meat you're having (great for people who are kitchen-challenged, such as myself).

I do enjoy the conveyor belt and it's fun to pick the food you want from it. If you're at a table that isn't connected to the conveyor belt, you can always order from the menu bc it's the same items. 

The only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars for me is the service. I always have to ask for a water refill and that's a pet peeve of mine. Or there will be silverware missing and it takes them forever and a half years to get the items to you. 

Even with that said, I will still go back to Chubby because I truly do enjoy the food.

1st time tonight at Chubby Cattle. Been wanting to try and it definitely exceeded my expectations. Our server Deni was very helpful going through the menu and recommendations. Dinner was very tasty and I can't stop eating. We will definitely come back. Thanks Deni.

A few different reviews here. The House broth.... delicious! The choice of noodles that I went with was the green tea noodle. Was it tasty? Yes it was tasty but the serving amount was enough for my 2 year grand daughter. I like the the concept of picking my own ingredients, which there was quite a selection to chose from. My husband wasn't too thrilled with the idea to begin with and he's still not thrilled with this place. Then we had to go pick our own condiments and appetizers from the bar. Let's just say they need to keep that area a little bit more tidier than it was. Choice of appetizers were limited to 2. They do have a conveyor belt around the general sitting area but since we were in a large group we were sat in a private room. They take your broth order first and once that arrives, the waiter comes in and takes the rest of your order. He takes everyone's order except for one of my friends. We had to go and find the waiter to finish hers. Then we asked for forks for a couple people and took me asking twice before we even got it. After all
the orders arrived, we realized everyone got theirs except for my husband and my friend, who's order they originally forgot to take. This wasn't a good experience and the questions still remains... we me liking the food and the bad experiences we had, would i go back? Let's just say it'll be a while before I even consider this.

I brought my parents here to try it out with my husband and I really wanted to like this place. I was excited about trying it but, unfortunately it was a let down. Our first mistake was not making a reservation, when we got there I really wanted to try the conveyor belt but they had no room. The biggest complaint about this place is their customer service. The ladies at the front had difficulty communicating in English. I asked them if we could still get our own soup broths at the table and they said no we could only have 3. I figured that would be good enough since there is only 4 of us, but when we got to the table, you could only have 2 soup broths at most. The ladies are just speaking in Mandarin at this point, which annoyed me because my husband does not speak Mandarin so I had to translate everything for him. I also felt like the ladies out front had an attitude and just didn't really care.

They brought us a menu. Yes, just one for 4 people. I don't understand why. It should at least be one menu per couple? We went with the mushroom broth and the house hellishly spicy broth. We ended up ordering 2 orders of the beef combo, 1 vegetable combo, 1 seafood combo, 1 assorted noodles, and mongolian lamb skewers. So here is the weird part when we ask what is in the combo the server lists out some stuff and says if you are lucky there will be a, b, or c in it, for every combo. Isn't it kind of weird to have a combo be some kind of lottery system hoping you get lucky? Of course we just got the standard for all the combos. The service was just okay, they didn't really take away the plates we were done with.

I think the food was definitely tasty and fresh, with a reasonable price. I checked my credit card and we paid 127.49 for four people which I think is a decent price. I did leave 18% tip even though I felt like the service was lacking. My husband wanted to try to order the meats in the combo separately to see if there was a difference and made it a point to do so by ordering them separately by name, but our server just ended up bringing another combo, we didn't complain about it, just let it go and ate the combo. Our server came by and told us that if we give them a yelp review that we would get free ice cream. I declined, he seemed pretty shocked, but I am not about selling my reviews for rewards. He left quickly without asking us if we would like to buy any desserts. We waited for awhile, over 15 minutes and he never came back, not even to ask if we wanted our check. We ended up just walking up to the front desk to get our check.

The food was good and they had a pretty good variety of side dishes you can pick from. My reasoning for giving two stars is because of the staff. When we were done paying and leaving our waiter stopped us because apparently we didn't tip him high enough... he asked us if there was anything wrong with his service and that he was confused with the amount that we tipped him with. I was shocked because we did give him a good tip and I've never had a waiter do that to us. I'm not sure if we will ever go back to place again, because I really don't want to be harassed by the staff over a tip.

Everything in tonight's experience was spot on from start to finish.
We had a work party of 8, upon getting on the Yelp page to check their great reviews, it actually let's you set an appointment. On top of that, they actually message you back to confirm the reservation! Much more than most of vegas area where there no service and communication, this place is spot on! 

As for the food was amazing! When we sat down a server explained the menu, process and everything we should know very well. Again these days it's very hard to find this type of place to eat where they are so service oriented!

The quality of food was fresh and great!!
Bin was our server and was super helpful and informative for my cousin and I's first hot pot experience! Great food, great service, and at a reasonable price...highly recommend.
I do not understand what the big deal is about this place. It was just okay. There are WAY better hot pot places in Vegas. A bit overpriced too.
Was in Vegas for a convention, food was delicious. Servers were extremely nice and very courteous, definitely on their A game, even their buss staff.

It was the first time I've ever had "Hot Pot" and it was such a great experience! We had a table to 6 adults and 2 children and they first had us placed at a tall bar type of table but since the kids could not reach they moved us over to a booth, then after that they said that we could not have a high chair on the sides because someone has to run food through there. We had no problem in making it work and then the manager gave us a small room free of charge and gave us a great experience. Thank you so much Chubby Cattle staff!! Will be back!!! Amazing food and service!!!

Great food and service. Matthew was our server tonight. He explained the menu to us in detail because we had forgotten from the first time we ate here. Atmosphere is bright and fun. A lot of room for a party of 4 to sit in a table. Recommend checking out the sauce bar to compliment your meals. Also recommend sitting close to the conveyor belt for a fun dining experience. Lastly, I really liked the chill music that they were playing

I am normally not the type of person that likes to spend my own time writing a review as you can probably tell since this is my first review on this account. However, I just feel the need to express my concerns this time due to the way my incident was handled during my dining experience...

First off, this wasn't the first time I came to Chubby Cattle, I had no prior unsatisfactory experience here before until today. My girlfriend was craving hotpot so our first natural choice was Chubby Cattle since we both really enjoyed it previously. Our server Matthew had us seated and we began ordering like usual...

We normally never order any items from the seafood menu as we prefer their meat selection more but this time we decided to give their seafood combo platter a try since the guests next to us ordered one and the presentation was really beautiful. Along with that we also ordered some beef briskets, veggies and bunch of assorted items from their conveyor belt...

The dining experience was going nice and smoothly with service and most of the food being on point like usual. This took a dramatic downturn when the supposedly "beautifully-presented seafood platter" was brought to our table...

It had a assortment of shrimp, clam, scallop, crab leg, fish, and mussel. Anticipating the taste of this dish, we put a little of each into our broth and let it simmer for a good couple minutes. The shrimps and scallops was amazing but the RED FLAG comes when we go for the mussels...

I put a little of our sauce on top of the mussel and attempt to scoop the whole thing into my mouth as if it was a oyster. As I try to separate the meat from the shell using my mouth, I noticed a weird texture when I chew down on it, something I wasn't familiar with as I had plenty of mussels in the past. It felt really hairy and crunchy at the same time, so I immediately spit the whole thing back on the shell to see what it was that I bit into. I was thoroughly disgusted when I saw a bunch of black hairy leg-like thing protruding from the flesh of the mussel. I wasn't able to identify what that thing was. And from another piece I took out from the broth, I saw a random whole-small crab inside the mussel itself. Without further or due, I ended my meal there without finishing anything else from the seafood platter as well as what is in my broth. 

I informed my server of the situation and all he came back with is that the manager said it was a natural occurrence as they are the things they eat...seriously? So I had to personally request to have the manager come over and told her that explanation was unacceptable. I mean come on, If I were to order pork intestine from a restaurant, I expected it to be thoroughly clean despite knowing what is consider as a "natural occurrence" that takes place in it.  

She told me that the mussels are from a supplier at New Zealand and they were the one who supposedly cleaned and cooked it before shipping it to Chubby Cattle...but hey, how about doing some inspection on it yourself before serving it to your customers? It is only a standard process for the price you guys charge. Not to mention she also told me this type of incident also happened previously to other customers as well so all in all, this should bring a RED FLAG to you guys to either switch suppliers or have a thorough cleaning of such products when you receive them. 

The manager kept trying to push the responsibility to other things instead of owning the experience. She did however apologize and say she will reflect my concerns to the team and said she will see if she can do anything for me. When my bill came nothing was altered, and I can see from a distance she just kept talking with her co-workers, laughing and chatting along. This just makes me feel like she wasn't sincere at all and that your management just doesn't care anymore. It wasn't until we told the server Matthew that your management said she will do something in regards to the bill that they then finally went ahead and removed the seafood platter (we only partially consumed the shrimp and scallop, everything else was discarded because we were disgusted) from the bill.  

I work in the hotel industry in a 5 star luxury resort setting and I understand how important customer service is to maintain and generate loyal guests. With all due respect, I don't expect the same level of service standards from Chubby Cattle, but come on, your server itself saw those disgusting hairy legs coming from the flesh, it could be potentially hazardous as it is something unidentifiable. Trying to brush off and escape the situation instead of proactively dealing with it just tells me a lot about your company. 

I had always suggested Chubby Cattle to my friends, family and numerous guests that come to our hotel when they ask if I know a spot for delicious and unconventional Asian cuisine. This is such a big disappointment...I don't think I am able to recommend this place anymore or even come back at all

Love this place, the waitress was very helpful in recommending us their menu. We ordered 4 different soup. 1)- house original 2)- sea food 3)- mushroom 4)- tomato. Our favorite are tomato, mushroom and house original. We also ordered the beef combo, sea bass fish, lamb racks, and some other items from the conveyor belt are wontons, green tea noodles, taro, fried tofu, shrimp, sashimi salmon. Everything were very delicious.

In LOVEEEE with this place!  We had a weekend trip to Vegas during Lunar New Year, made reservations on OpenTablet.com, but somehow our reservations were lost.  LUCKY for us, we came at the right time and they had a few tables open.  We got some side room, so we were in there ourselves.  I was pretty happy with that since it was fairly loud outside.  It was a "build your own sauce" place, with a whole table with probably around 20 items to put in your sauce.  Options for hotpot broth is traditional or spicy, the ingredients had a HUGE selection of meats, vegetables, non-meat proteins, homemade meatballs, noodles, plus some!  We had only so much room to fit in our belly, therefore we chose the "interesting" noodles, basket of vegetables, homemade meatballs, and choices of meat.  We each had our own pot due to the tablet set-up.  I would LOVE to come back!!

Went with my mom and sister, had so much fun for our first time at this kind of restaurant. Deni, our server, guided us through our night great. The food was so good, definitely want to come back. And we got free ice cream for a yelp review so overall pretty great.

Angela is her name, hot pot is her game!  She balled out with the service and food, lets get real here, this place "chubbed" out bruh!

Pretty new place and deserves a look for casual hot pot dinner.  Its best to go with a few people, the meat, waygu beef is off the chain, you'll hear that!

I am outa here homies, lets give this chubby cattle a round of applause!!!  Ball is life.

I would recommend people trying this location , the food was really good. Customer service was really good and food came fast. I liked how they model the place , top best place for hot pot in Vegas hands down.
First time here! Kevin is really nice! Definitely a fun place to eat and looking forward to coming again !

FINALLY!!!! Some Chinese hot pot in Vegas! 

The meats are great here and are reasonably priced. I love how many broth options they have. My favorite is honestly the tomato one. If you want it spicy just add chilly oil! 

The have a great variety of veggies and sides to cook.  The fish balls are a must and I'm talking about the fresh ones and not the frozen rubbery ones! 

The conveyor belt idea is pretty cool but the prices on the belt do not match the price in the menu. So I wonder which is better to grab off of? 

The only downside about here is portions of their sides. For a large noodle, they told me it's good for 2 people. When I saw it, I thought this isn't even enough for me. Even when I ordered a large enoki mushroom, I was very very small and it made me wonder how much they would give in the small size? 

The service is okay when they are busy. But they were good when it was slow. 

What I didn't really like was they were haggling for a review in return for ice cream. Kind of annoying to some customers...
Came for dinner on Christmas Day, the food is good, but the female manager is so rude. She should be ashamed of  her bad manners.
Vegas finally have a nice hotspot place to go. Server is nice and our server deni is great. Very friendly. Enjoyable experience must go
The food is great. Our server James was wonderful. We made reservations for the ying yang hot pot and was seated in a timely fashion. I will be returning!

Decent hot pot place but not worth coming back. 

I was drawn to this place on Yelp from seeing the rotating belt and it's great that you can make a reservation on Yelp too!

What impressed me was the good selection of lamb and the good service.

Everything else was mediocre. The soup base (original) is similar to the little sheep Mongolian hot pot soup. It was good but nothing spectacular. 
I was disappointed at the beef rib eye which was super dry. 

Also annoyed how they only put one small pot in the middle of a booth meant to sit 6 people. It was kinda hard to reach the pot if you are sitting on the edge. 

I guess I just feel there are more comfortable and tasty hot pot I've tried before.

Absolutely worth the price! Make sure you get a reservation. During happy hour you can get one plate, one plate free off the conveyor belt. The sauce bar is fantastic and they offer some recipes to create if you are lost. Hopefully you get Matthew, he's attentive!

Chubby Cattle, overall, was a moo-ving and exciting Hot Pot experience because of the conveyor belts!! Rolling down the belt were fresh ingredients with varying prices. Our waitress, Xiao Xiao, was very welcoming and kind.

Four friends and I had shared a pot of the original soup and mushroom soup. Both soups were flavorful and definitely warmed us up. We also ordered the beef special and sliced lamb; both were delicious! 

SUN-THURS 9:30P-12:30A offer a BOGO Happy Hour. Our total ended up ranging around $80 for five people. 

I look forward on coming again with my family. It's debatable whether I'd go on a regular pricing because it's pretty pricey!

I'm a huge fan of hot pot especially the ying yang style. I was a little disappointed when they didn't offer the ying yang at that time but my wife got the spicy soup and I got the regular one so I guessed it worked out fine. Our server Dani? and Kevin were both amazing. Our server explained the menu very thoroughly. He recommended the beef combo for our meat and it was definitely a good choice! He also recommended we get the noodles combo and I can't be happier with it. 

The food and soup came and I must say their broth is not as savory as other places I've been too, but, as the meat and side dishes started cooking in the soup the broth got a little better. The meat was definitely high quality and the noodles are made fresh daily so I'm really impressed with the noodles. The prices were pushing it a little but it was nice to try fresh noodles and the good quality meat.

This place is a wonderful and intriguing experience that will challenge your taste buds. The environmental is something to take in but when you do, you will really enjoy what comes next. The conveyor is great and had so many good options. Would recommend this place to anyone that wants a fun and tasty food experience here in Vegas. I'll be back for the Kobe Fried Rice!

service was great. Our waiter James is very nice and attentive. However the meat seems to fall apart as soon as it goes into the pot. After dinner my whole family all had upset stomach. Otherwise the free appetizer ( edamame and wood ear )were great. Overall food was delicious

My family and I had never been to a hot pot restaurant before and our server, Angela made the experience so easy and enjoyable. Very clean and the vegetables, meats and spices were all fresh and delicious. If you're willing to try something new, visit Chubby Cattle!!

Good Food .. Good Services... great people! Food is fresh and presented beautifully! I should have know this restaurant long time ago because I went to Vegas many times every year! Strongly recommended!

Hot pot places isn't usually the first thing I crave but we have heard and read so many good things about that my boyfriend and I thought to give it a try. What really caught my attention was the conveyor belt feature they have because there is no place in vegas that does it. Unfortunately it's too bad it's not a sushi place.
We expected it to be busy since it was a Saturday but the wait wasn't too bad. About 25 min wait to sit for 2 near the conveyor belt. So there is a few different areas, there is a bar style, booth or like big family round tables.
Service was great as soon as we sat down. The waiter was super nice and explained everything we needed to know. First you order the broth. They have a few choices to choose from. We decided to get 1 house special and 1 house special spicy. By far, the spicy broth was way more flavorable and you can decide how spicy you want it. The house special was alright if you simple taste. Then u order the type of meat. On yelp I saw the cool seafood platter so that's what I got (which was a mistake) and my boyfriend ordered the lamb and beef combo (good choice). Those 2 orders alone had me really full. Unfortunately, I didn't have the energy or space to pick something out of the conveyor belt but it was nice for pics. The dishes inside vary from meat to seafood to veggies to noodles. The reason why the seafood was a mistake was cause most of it was on the conveyor belt like the shrimp, scallops, and mussels. It was the display of the seafood platter that really only caught my attention. 
The other cool part about this place was that you could create your own dipping sauce at the sauce station!
The 2 things that really stood out in this place was the broth and sauce station hands down. Oh, I believe rice is also free because my boyfriend ordered a side of it. 
Cons about this place is the limited space u have if u eat at the bar area where the conveyor is. It's pretty tight when u have people on both sides of you. 
The meat was alright. The seafood was alright. Nothing special. Fresh though. But what really gives it it's taste is the broth and the sauce u create with it. 
Overall the bill was about $50. But only because I think we mistakenly ordered the seafood platter which was about $20. The lamb and beef combo was about $16.99 and I believe the brother is $3-6 bucks. My boyfriend said he wasn't full but just about right. However for me, I felt super full. Definitely worth a try! It's also fun to take pics on your experience. :)

Wow came back here and it was a very good experience! The waitress who was serving my boyfriend and I was awesome! She was very helpful with all our questions and very attentive. The food was great! They have a lot of choices and the soup base has plenty of flavor. Will definitely come back again and again and again haha. They also have ice cream on the house when you're done eating ! What a plus lol
Super good!!! Nice hot pot restaurant, good environment, fresh foods, and great serve. The waiter Gill is very friendly and gave us a excellent service!!!

This place is a must visit...I don't know how to explain the pleasure I had while eating at this place
My wife enjoyed the hand made noodles as well as the seafood combo
I always like the red meat...meat combo for sure
Soup base...depending on what you like


Note: Service is a little bit slow...had ask twice to for anything
They need more manpower

Terrific that it was open on Christmas Day, but I wish the cold appetizers were restocked at 8pm for a 12 am closing time. Love the plating and quality of hot pot ingredients! Mala broth was truly spicy and flavorful, no sauce necessary. The tables were a bit tight with little room for hot pot ingredients. I enjoyed witnessing the noodles freshly cut. Reservation recommended. Didn't utilize the conveyor belt. Children 12 and under are included as adults for ying yang pots (2+ broths).

i am definitely a fan!  
i absolutely love hot pot.
chubby cattle does everything that's great about chinese style hot pot and then added a conveyor belt for that little extra fun.
they provide all of the different sauces that i grew up loving in a chinese home.
they give you all the different selections of meat and seafood and veggies.
the broth is something you won't find easily elsewhere in vegas.
it's a very herby broth with delicious flavors.
growing up, i hated the stuff but now i just love it!

they are busy!
i would highly recommend making a reservation, even though sometimes the hostesses mess those up too, it's still much better than standing around waiting for a table.  
before the weather starts getting too warm for hot pot again, check this place out.
you won't be disappointed.

DELICIOUS HOTPOT and great service!
I had to call twice to change our reservation time because my friends and I were having trouble getting an Uber. But the reception lady was super nice about and saved us a table despite being late to our third change of time. 

We ordered a large pot to share the soup bases. You can order up to 3 bases for one large pot and we got the spicy one, seafood, and original.  And for the meat, we got beef, lamb, fish balls, and sliced fish.   As for vegetables, we got napa cabbage and enoki mushrooms. And a side of glass noodles. 

The soup bases are everything I love in hotpot! Lots of chili oil and spice in the spicy base and lots of sea flavor in the seafood base. They were all thick in flavor but light in consistency. Overall great broth! 

Besides having tasty soup bases, when you ask for a refill on soup, they actually give you soup instead of like other places where they usually refill with water instead.
First time here and the meal was great. Our server Deni was very helpful and aided me and my wife all the way til the end. Will definitely visit again next time we are in Vegas.
First time here for my cousin's bachelorette. Our server James was amazing and attentive. The food was great as well!

Best Hot Pot in Las Vegas!  Great food
and service by James... Recommend all the combination ( beef, seafood, vegetable) in a half/half soup base. The house  fish balls were deilcious. Will return soon with family and friends.  The only recommendation is to put the chili in a  bouquet garni, to make eating the noodles easier.
Good food. The conveyor system is neat and I like my food fast. I'd recommend it to friends.

The place is new. Very hip. Food is good but the portion is really small and quote pricey. The bowl is so small and quite  difficult to use also. I especially enjoy the grilled lamb. The mid level spicy soup broth is good except it was top oily with to much chili oil. Deni was the or server.

Sorry Chubby Cattle I am not a fan  I really wanted to love you and have you become one of my go to spots. I wanted to share you with my friends and family and sadly this will not be happening. 

Coming from Boston where I feel our shabu shabu is the .com I was really hoping this could be the spot .. Wahh 

Ok on to my review 

It was a Friday night around 10pm. I know late night dinner. I was feeling great. I just got out of a massage ( super popular here) Time for some yummy hot pot.

I had book mark this place and love the concept of the restaurant with the conveyer belt as there is nothing like it in Vegas. 

We got seated pretty quickly. I was excited as we got seated at the conveyer belt. It was fogged up and you couldn't really see inside but you could open the lid and check out the selection. The plate color indicated the pricing. 
The waiter we had kept trying to tell us you are new here so get like everything combo. The combo veggie and mushroom came in these wooden like basket. The combo beef plate were huge not ideal for a small tables. He seem to discourage us from the items in the conveyer belt. Why ?? 
We ended up getting the mushroom combo, watercress and meat combo. They did not have a liquor license so BYOB. I tried their watermelon juice ( this seemed water down ) everything else seem fine and fresh. 
BF got the tomato base soup and I got the mid level spicy broth. The broth were nothing to blow you out the water . 

Now here is where it turns 
So when we were waiting on our items we headed over to the sauce station no bowls so we sat back down since none of the staff standing around acknowledge us looking around for bowls and say oh do you need anything( we figure oh maybe they bring you the bowl) 
The waiter goes oh go grab your sauce guys. We head over along with all the other newbies and crowded around the station. No bowls Wth ! I look at this guy and said where are the bowls and he comes back with tea cups  ok so I take it. We sit back in out seat ready to go no bowls for our soup ( is this not a hot pot soup spot ? ) or soup spoons . I ask for these items 5 times from 5 different people. Finally I gave up on the bowls just give me soup spoons . This guy says oh let me go wash you some ( why did he feel the need to tell me this ) I wanted to say do you want a cookie !!! 
In the middle of eating in our tight cramp area with all our items the waiter comes and ask would you like to do a survey for special on your birthday !! I was like seriously right now I'm not even done eating. My answer was NO. 
Than the waiter comes back and interrupts us Again about they are sending him home early and if he could get us our check. Of course we were done and over this place so we said that was fine. 
He than comes back to tell us he is giving us free ice cream and to show some support on Yelp. At this point I was at boiling point ! What turn to be a nice night ! They killed my vibe

My husband and I travel to China for business and discovered Hot Pot's there..... then we found Chubby Cattle and needless to say it's just like being in China. The Beef is the best in Las Vegas and honestly, it's the best hot pot in town. We come to Vegas for a week every year to exhibit at a trade show and we eat at Chubby Cattle 5 times in 7 days. So what does that tell you. It's freakin phenomenal and the bartender is super awesome. We  Chubby Cattle and we're headed there tonight for our last meal before we fly out tomorrow.

Best hot pot I had in recent years. Must try their shrimp paste, super fresh and absolutely amazing. The hand made noodle and hand made meat balls are pretty good as well. I'd also recommend their fresh cut lamb and overall the quality of meat is good. Deni was our waiter, super friendly and has some great recommendations.

Came here to meet up with a group of friends after work. We were all really excited to come try it out after hearing about it in the news and just wanting to try out a conveyor belt concept for hot pot. It was still relatively early in the night (close to 7pm), so parking was not too bad. Upon getting to the front of the establishment, they still had a red carpet laid out and the cut ribbon from their Grand Opening was still hanging out. There are two sets of glass doors you need to get through to get into the restaurant. Upon opening the first set, you are blasted with nice cold AC and the fragrant smell of hot pot. My stomach immediately grumbled. With an amazing welcoming smell like that, what could go wrong, right?..

Well, once we entered through the second set of doors, we were 'greeted' by the hostess with "How many?" and "Do you have a reservation?". We proceeded to tell her there were four in our party, and no, we do not have a reservation. She then says "Well, I can seat you at a shared pot, away from the conveyor belt." otherwise, it would be impossible to seat us because there was "a reservation at 7:15, another at 7:15, and one at 7:30." Then she walks off and it seems like she went to talk to some people at another table? I'm not sure what she asked them, but she came back and said "It will be a 45 minute to an hr wait before I can seat you." Did she just go ask that table when they would be finished eating? I will never know. We gave her a name and cell phone number of a friend in our party, and the hostess told us to come back at 7:44. If a table opens up earlier, she will give us a call.

Fast forward to 7:44 we walk in through the double set of doors (blasted again with the nice aroma of hot pot. Stomach again, grumbles). There are a few parties standing around the crowded entrance waiting at this point. She looks at us, and asks if we are ____. We said yes, and she says "I tried calling you, but it didn't work." and walks off. I looked on the podium where she had her reservation sheet, double checked the number, and manually dialed it on my cell phone. What do you know? My friend's phone immediately wrung. She then sat a party before us, and then brought us to our tables. After we got seated, a bus person came over and said, "Sorry, I'm not done setting the table," and proceeded to finish setting it up. We received one menu with our party of four people. I looked around, and I see another party of five also only had one menu. Sure, we can share two to a menu, but four people on opposite sides of the table looking off of one menu? Nope.

We've had quite a few questions on the menu. What specific meats are in the beef and lamb combo? (lamb shoulder/beef brisket) What is the difference in weight between ordering a combo vs each item individually? (combo was $16.99, lamb shoulder was $4.99, and beef brisket was $5.99) Our server did not know the answer to the weight question and had to ask the manager, who responded with "10 oz for the combo, 5 oz for the rest"... Wait, what? That doesn't add up. Why would I pay $16.99 for a combo with 10oz of meat vs $9.98 for 10 oz of meat when ordered individually? Our party opted with the individual orders of meat, along with some napa cabbage, watercress, and 'fresh thick noodles'. The veggies were also confusing to order, as the menu listed 'small' and 'large' prices, which differed from the conveyor belt prices for the same veggie. Soup bases: We wanted to order their 'House Original' soup base and their 'House Hellish Spicy Pot' with Mid Level Hell 12 spicy. We were told by the server that they were sold out of the House Original as well as the Spicy soup bases. How can you be out of the original soup base? We almost got up and left then and there, but the manager came by and told us there will be a 10 minute wait if we wanted to get those soup bases. What's 10 minutes compared to the wait we've already had, right?

The soup bases came out first. I was surprised at how clear it was. It was a bit bland, but I added some garlic to it, so all was good. Can't go wrong with garlic! Next, the meats and veggies came out. For $4.99 and $5.99, I believe they give you a decent sized portion. Of course it will always be cheaper at a supermarket, but at a restaurant, the price wasn't bad. The quality of the meats were just average. I could get better quality elsewhere. The veggies were a bit on the not-s-fresh side, as some leaves were starting to yellow and brown. Also, when the 'fresh thick noodles' came out, they were dry and thin. I don't know about you, but 'dried' noodles does NOT mean fresh in my vocabulary. Items we saw on the conveyor belt when we entered were nowhere to be found once we got our soup base. Keep an eye and restock it please!

When we asked for our bill, the server apologized for his lack of knowledge, as he started working three days ago. All in all, it was an interesting concept to try, but I probably will not be returning any time soon.

Since opening the quality of their beef has gone way down, along with their service. This used to be a favorite of mine but after leaving this evening I was very very disappointed. I asked for the beef brisket-it came-it was basically all fat. Upon asking for our check the server noticed I didn't touch the brisket and asked if I liked it, to which I replied no it was too fatty, but I was still charged. Very unhappy and won't be returning.

Have to be honest the conveyor belt part of this restaurant is what drew my attention. I was completely curious so I had to check it out. With all the hot pot places around the area now I was looking for something different. 

I like the individuality of the meal, you can pick between two soup bases. One is not spicy and looks milky while the other is spicy and spicy is not an understatement. I love spice but ieven had to take out  a heaping amount of the chili peppers and various spices put into the broth. They even warn you that you shouldn't drink the soup, which was a bit of a bummer for me BC I like to enjoy my soup broth at the end. I just took out about a cup full of the peppers and spices and I was able to drink some of the broth.  The servings of meat is small in my opinion. The seafood presentation is beautiful however. They do have many choices of meats, vegetables, noodles, etc. And what you don't order you can take off the conveyor belt. Unfortunately not everyone in the restaurant can enjoy this conveyor belt feature, so if you are going strictly to experience that make a reservation or don't go during peak times. 

This place can become quite pricey for what it is. Especially since there is another hot pot place down the road which offers more food for less the price and is jist as good. I will say the experience here is unique so check it out at least once.

For me, one of the most important part for the perfect hot pot meal is the soup base. So although I do enjoy a bit of spice in my dish, I usually start with the restaurant's original soup base for my first visits so I can taste their flavor without any other ingredients shadowing it. The broth was very flavorful with the right amount of seasoning and a nice herbal kick. Absolutely delicious! I'll have to try my luck with the spicy soup next time I come back. 

As for the menu items, the restaurant offered a good selection of quality meat and seafood. My friends and I ordered a whole array of dishes ranging from beef brisket to crab and everything was fresh and presented beautifully. My favorite would have to be the Kobe beef and oysters. Highly recommend both!

I'm so glad my friend brought me to Chubby Cattle before I left Las Vegas! I'll be returning next time i return for sure. It's about a 10 minute drive from the Strip, so take a cab, Uber, or drive there yourself because it's definitely the place to visit for a good hot pot experience.

Good place. Food is good.
Great service. The beef plate was super good. And the lamb one was good as well. Vip loungr was very very accomdating
I liked the Chubby Cattle. The atmosphere was fun, variety of food items was good, everything was clean, the presentation was nice and the service was awesome!!

I would have given this place atleast a 4. But the soup base I had was good but the herbs were to much that it took over pot. The small items are over priced and instead trying market wagau beef they should just do that  as a special request.

The service was amazing this time! Hands down the best experience because of our server DENI. He wasn't too pushy always coming over asking us questions, he just made it super simple to order and let us enjoy our meal and would come in the perfect time to check on us. Love this guy! And the tofu was great! Definitely recommend it!!

Awesome!! First time? Ask for Kwan to be your server, he's very informative and makes sure you have an amazing experience. Food is delish, love the conveyor, pick only the ingredients you want! Happy hour 9:30pm to 12:00am buy one get one conveyor plates. Sauce bar allows you to be creative and make your own dipping sauce. Everyone was very friendly. Loved it!

By the way, the two star review from Sasha couldn't be more false. I sat at one of the smallest tables in the restaurant, using two pots of broth, the largest meat combo plate, 10 conveyor plates, 6 sauce plates, 4 bowls, 4 drinks, 2 plates and plenary of room. Restaurant smells like curry and traditional Chinese herbs, and I was never pressured to write a review at any point (no free dessert offered either). I wonder if she reviewed the correct place...
We are celebrating birthdays and it was a great experience! Fresh seafoods, meats and veggies! Deni is our server and his service is 5 stars! Very recommended!

From a Chinese's perspective, this hot pot place is So So. Food is not fresh and the portion for the price is really poor. The dinning environment and service quality are definitely better than most of the Chinese restaurants but I'm not really came here for that. Now I feel the Red Pot is the best hot pot in Las Vegas now. Don't think will come back here again.

This place is awesome! I ordered the meat platter with the mushroom hot pot. Oh my gosh! Sooooo tasty. The vegetable medley was presented beautifully and they were fresh.  I will definitely return here! DENI, my wait or was fantastic!
Super cool experience. The food is great and the service is just as good. I would highly recommend this place!

Your modern day hot pot! 
Revolving belt full of variety of vegetables and meat. 
A bar full of different choices of sauces. 
Good broth. 
Priceless

I don't critique many restaurants unless I am compelled to do so. Five stars really does not do this place justice as the quality of the food, the quality of the service is AWESOME! All you have to do is make a reservation first because it is a busy and popular place. The level of cleanliness of the condiment bar is fantastic. I travel the entire country every week and feel like I found gold in Denver.

Would've given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for our horrible experience with the hostess. (Skip this paragraph if you don't wanna hear my complaining) I came here with my parents & was told on the phone that 3 people could just walk in without a reservation. When we arrived, the hostess told us there were only 2 groups ahead of us. I assumed the wait would be around 25 min max. After 40 minutes, we still weren't seated. All these tables were opening up and I was pissed why we weren't being assigned to any of them. Another couple started yelling at the hostess because apparently their reservation wasn't even honored. After also complaining to the hostess and manager about the open tables & our hour long wait, we finally sat down at a table around 9:00pm. Don't make the wait seem so short just to have us wait an entire hour and eat such a late dinner. We would've gone somewhere else if we had known beforehand.

The conveyer belt is a cool idea. Kinda like Kula revolving sushi or sushi boats. After ordering meat and a veggie basket from the menu, I honestly didn't need much from the conveyer belt though. They had so many options like green tea noodles, beef dumplings, fish balls, barley noodles, etc. Then on the menu, they had so many different options of meat (even fresh dungeness crab). The broth was delicious!! I got the entry level spicy broth and it was plenty spicy enough. There's also a sauce station with a bunch of options and omg....everything was amazing. Love the fried garlic. 

Our waitress was amazing - she was friendly, knowledgable, and efficient unlike the hostess. The manager was also really sweet and came by our table to personally apologize for our experience earlier. Overall, food is delicious and I'm excited for them to open up a location in SF next!

PS. Your clothes will STINK after eating here, so wear something you don't really care about!
Great food and service in chinatown  las vegas we will come back  hot pot from a menu and the side dishes on a conveyor thinks Deni.

Went for dinner for the first time last night as we were looking for hotpot and wanted to go venture off the strip.  Service was awful despite us giving 20% gratuity- we had to ask for items multiple times and had to check on our meat order several times as well. Not impressed with service, but food was probably 3.5 stars

The food quality is amazing, everything super fresh and tasty. I ordered the beef and veggie combos and the portions are pretty large. I've never had a basket of veggies before! Also ordered a watermelon juice--amazing! Deni was super attentive!

Our first time and I'm really impressed. The place is open and airy, clean... Staff was very friendly and accommodating.... You make your own dipping sauce.... 
Food was awesome... Got medium spicy broth and it was awesome...... I love spicy food and this hit the spot.... They have other broths for people who don't like spicy food...
The idea of a conveyor with color-coded plates with ingredients for pricing is also smart...
Don't be afraid to try stuff as they ave vegetables, fish, tendon, noodles, and duck feet too.
Just like the terminator.... I'll be back !!!

I'm not one to write reviews, but this place is so delicious.   The broth is flavorful and the conveyor belt with all the condiments was a brilliant idea. And not to mention our server, Xiao was very attentive and so kind! Definitely recommend this place.

This was my first time ever trying hot pot, and I'm glad this is the place I did it! The staff was incredibly helpful in explaining the process, and the food was great. I had the wagyu beef, purple yam noodles, and pork dumplings. Will definitely visit again next time I'm in Vegas!

This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. I lived in China for a year and fell in love with hot pot. I am so happy to have a wonderful hot pot restaurant so close. The BBQ dishes are also fantastic. I took my son tonight to try hot pot for the first time. He could not eat enough. It is now his favorite thing to eat. I highly recommend chubby cattle to everyone. You won't be disappointed
The options can be overwhelming so take your time looking at the menu. Good food! Good service. I'd recommend the seafood soup

A friend and I were in town for work and heard this place was highly recommended.  The conveyor belts are fun and the original soup base was delicious!  Deni- our server- was super helpful and walked us through the process, making great recommendations for us.

Had to wait a few minutes after we arrived to sit at the conveyor bar. Hostess took the time to go over setup and menu. Immediately met our fantastic waiter, Kwan. He explained the process and got us started. The sauces are great and the beef combo was perfect for two people to share. The rest of the items we just pulled from the conveyor belt as it went around. We thought this system actually was very smart as other hot pot places your table becomes inundated with items since they bring everything out at once. Here, you can have a pretty organized eating space as you take and eat at your place. The conveyor belt is not just a gimmick. Everything tasted fresh and the broth was delicious. Look for Kwan as he is super friendly and made the experience at Chubby Cattle over the top. Will definitely be back.

This was a yummy place. Lots of choices and sauce choices. Mixing the sauces was a lot of fun

I got the midlevel hell and it wasn't spicy enough with the mala (numb spice) so if you are an avid hot pot water, go for the spiciest level of hell 

The meat was very good. We got the beef and lamb combo and it was very good. For the two of us, we could have gotten two orders. 

We also got the large fish ball order. It tasted like the regular fish balls you would find but they were 4x the size so I recommend you just getting the small. If we hadn't ordered the large, it wouldn't have been too much food. The large comes with 8 and the small comes with 4. 

  Very busy but service was great with our waitress Angela.  Very attentive and if you sit on the high top with other guests, there is no wait. 

It is BYOB and there is a Walgreens around the corner no cork fee and they give you wine glasses :) service was great

Chubby Cattle is my go to Hot Pot place in ALL of Vegas. The atmosphere and staff are so kind and genuinely want you to have the best eating experience possible.
My mom came in for the first time (my 2nd time) and we were ecstatic that not only is the price very reasonable, but the food is great quality for that price. Our server, Deni, was so sweet and very attentive to our questions and needs. We're definitely coming back again soon!

one of the best hidden restaurants in Las Vegas off the strip. My server was James and he was awesome and so observant to our needs.  This has got to be the best hot pot there is in Vegas and I am a well traveled foodie. Come and hang out with these friendly folksI am one satisfied customer
Great service! Deni was our server and he gave us free icecream. 10/10 would come again

They changed the format of the sauce bar which I like a lot more. Food options stays the same and besides the conveyor belt there's really no other wow factor that stood out to me. Food is average and the meat quality is good. 

I always get the same Asian gentleman as my server and he is just so pleasant. All the staff in there is polite and attentive (hostess, buster, etc).

We do hot pot at home, but not so much in restaurants.  So, we weren't really sure what to expect.  This place is new and had lots of positive reviews, but I can't say that I'm a fan of this place...  Fellow Yelpers have disappointed on this one, which makes me wonder if all the reviews are real.

Everything here adds an extra costs to your meal.  Soup base = minimum $4.  Want noodles in your soup?  Another $3-4.  Meat?  Anywhere from $5 and up.  Each little plate that rotates around = additional cost (from $1-4).  Some plates are reasonable, but others are just ridiculous.  I think we paid like $3 for a couple pieces of lettuce, because it's considered a "daily special".  Perhaps there's some better way of ordering, but it was not explained to us very well.  For two people (that just drank water), the bill ended up over $50 for some noodle soup that wasn't impressive at all.

Service for us wasn't too great either.  Seats were available, but the hostess told us to sit in the corner only to come over less than a minute later and tell us our seats were ready.  We weren't given a menu, but there was one nearby.  Turns out, it was originally given to the people next to us.  But, the hostess pointed out for us to use it when we were sat down.  We ordered noodles, but those didn't come until long after we started.  And, I paid the tab with a $100 bill and the women who took the money asked if I needed change...  Really?  I'm not poor, but I'm not wealthy enough to be tipping the same amount as my bill.  Especially when I'm cooking my own food.

Fun dinning experience that tastes as good as it looks.  Staff could be nicer when you attempt to make reservation.  Pots built into table. Ask for table with individual pots.  They have tables where you share a pot or each gets there own.

Exceptional customer service, our waiter is so friendly, nice, and very attentive. We ordered beef/lamb combo, seafood combo and veggie combo. They're all very fresh. The tomato soup is definitely a must-have.

Amazing explosion of your taste buds First timers, not knowing what to expect... Deni took us on a culinary tour through Asia...WOW We can't hardly wait to return and make this our usual Friday Date night go to. Be sure to ask for Deni and let him take you on an adventure like no other!!!

I would recommend Chubby Cattle any day! We originally saw this featured on Zimmerlist and had had a successful go with another restaurant he profiled. We came in around 5 on Memorial Day and were immediately seated. Our table ended up trying the ox tail tomato soup, and the entry level spicy soup- both were delicious! FYI on the entry level spicy soup, it packed a moderate amount of heat.


We tried three combos: beef, beef & lamb, and seafood. All were great, and our server Deni was very attentive. We never had to ask for any napkins or refills. The sauce bar also had a wide variety, and our favorites came to be the spicy mushroom and the ponzu sauce. I also tried the coconut milk mojito which was amazing. This was a fantastic dinner, and I only wish the east coast had more restaurants like this!

Let me start by saying I came here for the novelty of the conveyor belt, but I'm leaving as a certified fan.  We had several plates of meat, seafood platter, three different broths and about five items from the belt... And it was awesome and flavorful!. We'll be back sooner than later, especially now that we've refined our hot pot technique.

By the way... Don't forget to ask for the free dessert.

The broth was good. The conveyer belt thing was so fun. They have so many quality options for meat and seafood. They had weird stuff like brains and feet too. They also have a sauce bar with some sides. I don't know if it's because Ive been craving hotpot for a good five days or what but we came here because we had a long ass day and had a layover in Vegas and everything was delicious! The broth especially was soooooo good. I loved the Chinese/Szechuan numbing spice flavor. I usually eat Shabs with ponzu and raw garlic but they only had fried garlic which was a tasty alternative. I actually like that combo better now. I would definitely come back. No complaints whatsoever

I tried there twice.  The 1st time with individual hot pot and the 2nd time with the big pot for sharing.  You can pick up to 3 soup base for the big pot so you can try different flavor.  I like the oxtail soup the best.  The soup base is so rich.  The kids had so much fun to pick what they like from the belt.  The beef combo is so good and their noodle is so fresh.  I will go again for sure.
Meat quality was good but I didnt care for the soup. The portions are kind of small for the price.
Fantastic quality and flavor. Our server Dani was very friendly and patient even when we were taking time to decide.
Really cool experience and delicious! Make your own Sauce bar is amazing and if your not sure what to get, try a combo platter.

Great food and 5 star service! Finally Vegas has a good hot pot place that I can go to! Seafood is really fresh. We ordered a live fish and the presentation is stunning! Highly recommend this place, will definitely come back! 

Came back again multiple times and Matthew always takes care of us. He's very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Five star for him too!!!

We really enjoyed our vegan-friendly hotpot.

We have never done the hotpot/shabu-shabu thing, so it was a new experience from a-z, but we will definitely be doing it again.

VEGAN SURVIVAL GUIDE:
- Try to block out the name of this place from your mind.
- Get a table in the back away from the live seafood butchering area.
- Ask for a two broth combo: half Tomato broth, half Mushroom broth. These are completely vegan.
- Get a veggie basket, a mushroom basket, some tofu (soft or fried) or tofu skins.
- We tried the green tea noodles & they were bomb. A+
- At the sauce station, stick to a mix of soy sauce, green onions, and garlic. Optionally, add chile. Dunno if other sauces were veg.
- Since you are preparing your own food from baskets, you can control a lot & rid your mind of the dreaded meat cross contamination worries.
- Get the hot jasmine green tea.
 It comes in an adorable serving pot. Sooo warming.

All in all, it was a fun, yummy, toasty way to spend an evening.
You had me at conveyer belt. This Mongolian style shabu is top notch, with soup base delightfully flavored with dates and currants. Highly recommended

This place is very different but very good. The soup is amazing and our waiter Deni was amazing!! Highly recommend this place a very different experience the tomato base was good stick to items you know if you are new to this and make sure you get noodles.
Amazing place! Gilbert is our server and he is awesome! This place has great service and great food!

This place is delicious.  I get the house special soup and just get the small dishes that goes around the tables.  It is a new kind of shabu shabu.  I would not hesitate to come here on a weekly basis.  The service was excellent as well.  Only thing is that it can get very cold in here only because we are eating hot food.

Our server Deni was great!  The food was fabulous definitely recommended!  The service was quick and Deni recommended a lot of good items that I didn't initially think of ordering... Definitely coming back!

We have never had a hot pot experience before and this was a great first time. We were seated quickly. Our server, Matt, was able to answer all our beginner questions. The broths were amazing, the cuts of meat we had were delicious, and it was fun being able to make our own meal. I would highly recommend checking this place out; we will definitely be coming back!

Such a fun environment! Very friendly staff and they were extremely knowledgable about the menu which helped in my decision making with what to order. Everything was very fresh, especially the veggies. I had the spicy soup base with a spice level of 5, it was very very spicy but so tasty. We had the variety of meatballs, pretty much tasted all the beef options as well. You HAVE to have their sparkling sake too! Will definitely be back soon!
This was an amazing and unique experience! Xiau xiau was an excellent server! I loved to concept of having my own hot pot. The variety of meat was outstanding.

This place very different! I like the conveyor belt idea and the a ton of options. The meat is tender and the choices are endless! Definitely recommend for to people who's like to try something different!
Hot pot meets conveyor belt. We went for happy hour. Make sure you try the meatballs. They were amazing.

I went here last night with my husband and I must say the service exceeded my expectations...I called ahead for a reservation for 2 and the lady who answered the phone was happy to put us on the list. They have a system that notifies their guests via SMS regarding how long the wait time is. After we waited, we were seated and our server, Matthew, greeted us right away. Throughout our experience, Matthew was courteous and attentive. In fact, everyone on staff was hospitable. The dining experience, overall, was fun and the food was pretty good. I loved their array of veggies and sides on the conveyor belt. I can't wait to come back. :)
Is delicious and the staff very helpful through our first experience... the broth is yum yum ....

I've been to a few hot pot/shabu-shabu style places before, but what makes this place stand out is the server's commitment to a table. As this place uses conveyors to distribute food, service can focus on the people and their needs. Our server was Matthew and he was awesome! Be aware, this is not a laid back place, but a high energy restaurant, that has a focus on an upbeat dinner attitude.

I would totally come back! If you're here, try the House Broth!

Chubby Cattle might be the new "Hot Spot for Hot Pot" and rightfully so.  The new restaurant is beautifully designed and offers aesthetically pleasing dishes ready to be cooked table-side.  
After choosing up to three different broths along with your meat or seafood selections, a create-your-own sauce station provides a multitude of flavors to mingle with your tastebuds.
If that isn't enough, a conveyor belt full of variously priced items may tickle your fancy.

My fellow diners and I chose two broths:  "House Original" and "Heaven and Hell".  I thought their House Original (beef/chicken stock) had a light, subtle flavor but perfect for sipping on.  The spicy broth was was actually a bit too spicy even for me and also a bit too salty for one of our friends dining with us.   

The meats we cooked were delicious and the many dipping sauces elevated the taste.   My wife ordered some scallops which pretty much got lost in the mix of broth, noodles, veggies and meat; probably a first and last time to order those.  

Similarly, we felt like the conveyor belt items were lackluster.  Assorted vegetables and tofu looked unexciting and didn't seem necessary to enjoy the meal or make it better.  Beyond that, our only wish is for them to serve some nice beer to go with the food!

Our servers were very helpful and did explain their restaurant concept fairly well.   Waters were filled promptly and the food came fairly quickly after ordering.  If you're craving Chinese hotpot in the Chinatown area, you can't go wrong by checking this place out soon!
Best hot pot place ever.... meat is really fresh and I take my boyfriend there and he loved it. Good food and customer services!!!

We were welcome right away and seated within minutes. We choice to have single hot pot. I got the house both. It was spicy and good. The fresh ingredients in the both made a big difference. We ordered the beef combo which was sliced right in the back. The meat was not frozen like most places in back ( Boston.) They have a sauce bar where you can mix and match different ingredients to your taste. The conveyor belt had different color plates for different prices. The staff explained everything to us. The service was good and price was pricy because we had alot of color plates. I would come back here and suggested anyone in town to come here.

Kwan was an amazing server. I've been a few times and it never disappoints. If your food isn't good it's your fault! 
The spicy levels are no joke I always get mid and enjoy the fire but secretly wish to dilute it! Shhhh. Don't tell anyone. I love the goodies floating in the broth. There green onion, clove, Chinese peppercorn and a bunch of other unidentifiable pods and spices. Get the fish ball with filling (roe) always a must with hot put. Kwan was friendly and made the perfect beef suggestion.

Saw a recommendation by Andrew Zimmerman for this place and had to check it out while I was in the area. The food was great and the seafood was fresh. Deni who was our waiter helped us make a good choice on meats and beat my expectations. Would come again to this place.

I suggested this place since I had came here before and enjoyed it 

Sadly I was EXTREMELY disappointed this time..... 

We ordered the half and half pot half original and half spicy..... they started bringing out our food before we even got our broth so we just sitting there staring at our food!!!!  

Our waitress had suggested we get the Kobe fried rice..... which we NEVER received .... when we asked about it they told us we had sold out.... why would you SUGGEST it but not have it and 2nd why would you not come back and let us know ?????? 

I also ordered a kabob which I NEVER received either .... when I asked about my kabob the lady told me I didn't order it even though EVERYONE at the table told her I did .... but she CONTINUED TO TELL ME I DIDN'T!!! 

Had to also ask for my mushrooms I ordered!!!

Asking for water???? Lol good luck.... when someone did come fill our water it was filled HALF WAY!!! 

I'm not sure what happened from the first time to the next time I went but I was embarrassed to suggest a place to have such a shitty experience I WILL NEVER RETURN

Very unique and fun restaurant. Takes hot pot meals to another level. There is a conveyor belt of refrigerated dishes you can choose from to add to your hot pot (just like sushi conveyor belt, you pay based on the color of the plate). The servers are extremely helpful and attentive. You start off by picking the base broth (original was very good). The you can add the protein/veggies as desired. Can order what is on the menu or pick from the conveyor belt. My daughter and I started with the combo beef plate $13 and raw pork pot stickers which was  perfect for our two personal pots. After you order the broth, head on over to the sauce station and prepare your dipping sauce. Lots of choices so can get overwhelming. I choose the ponzu, garlic, green onion, and a bit of chili paste. Came out perfect. Also ordered hand-made noodles and bowls of rice. Once the pot was boiling, started adding the ingredients and then the thin sliced beef one slice at a time since they cooked very quickly. Then added fresh shrimp, tofu, rice cakes, sausages, mussels (all from the conveyor belt). Made the soup very tasty but be cautious with the soup though, it's boiling hot...literally. We enjoyed our meal and will return next time in Las Vegas!

I must say that this place is definitely poppin' once it opens. Call ahead to see if you can make reservations if you do not want to wait long! This place is fun, crowded, and unique but still very pricey for hot pot! I do like their spicy hot pot soup, it isn't too spicy for me, but I am a spicy lover after all! They even have a soup selection for vegetarian and they have different flavored noodles bringing more uniqueness! There's also a little area to make your own dipping sauce, which is always a plus. They have a lot of variety and the conveyor built adds a nice touch. I didn't know, but there is happy hour that is buy one plate get one free. So make sure to see into that if you do go and want to save even a few bucks! The experience was good overall, but nothing overly amazing!

Very good. First time trying the hot pot technique and our waiter Deni was extremely helpful showing us the way. Food was fresh and delicious and filled me up perfectly so I was still able to go dance afterward.

I was sooooo excited to try the Chubby Cattle - and it was AMAZING. I loved watching all the different food options traveling along the conveyor belt. Way more fun than just reading things in a menu. The staff was so nice and helpful. When we got there , I was actually asked if I minding waiting ten minutes for happy hour - OF COURSE NOT- I LOVE DISCOUNTS! and their happy hour is great- most everything was two for one! They also have a dipping sauce bar where you can make your own sauce by adding all sorts of ingredients. They will help you if you don't know what you are doing- don't worry. There is a large variety of yummy things and it's great for vegetarians too. 
I will be back!

I don't even think I can write a long enough review for them haha. Everything was great, my waitress was amazing. We ended up spending $300 at dinner here, tried a bunch of meats, had a fresh lobster, had wine/beer/cocktails. We enjoyed everything immensely. This place will be here for a long time. The ONLY complaint is the parking but I've been in this lot many times. It shares the lot with Cue D's and karaoke bar. 
We will always be coming back to this place! Everything is so fresh.

This is probably my worst experience. Waited forever to get a waiter, again forever for just water. We were starving when the food was finally brought to our table. Meat was not fresh, all I ate was the veggies. After all, food is overpriced, very disappointed.

The place is good fancy very energetic 
Staff members are very friendly
My homie Harry works there

Awesome super cool experience! 
Excellent fresh food, served by awesome people! 
Great vegetables and interesting herbs everywhere!
Ask for Kevin to serve you..super funny.
Can't wait to go back again!!!!

First off, I'm super impressed by this entire Asian food plaza. It has all the popular restaurants on Mountain Spring Road. From fancy Vietnamese food to sushi, and now Mongolian Hot Pot, Vegas' Asian food scene is so hot RIGHT NOW.

I came to Chubby Cattle right at noon on Sunday morning and people were waiting to be seated. I had no idea this restaurant was featured on the Food Network, so I noticed the TV hype as patrons mentioned they wanted to try this place due to ZimmernList. 

We wanted to order the Wagyu (which they advertised on Yelp too), but they were sold out. So we ordered the Beef combo with a veggie platter.
