The veggie platter came out in 30 minutes (it's raw veggies, we cook it ourselves, c'mon) and our beef came out 1 hour later (again, it's raw. we would have to cook it ourselves). 

The veggie platter came in a large wooden basket with a variety of vegetables but what I didn't understand was the romaine lettuce. I get bok choy and cabbage, but I don't get why you would cook lettuce in broth. It's just weird. 

The beef combo was actually pretty decent once it came out and the meat was nicely marbled.

There is a rotating conveyor belt (like a sushi belt) of toppings that you can choose from for your hot pot. All the toppings were not labeled nor did the ingredients looked very appetizing. The rotating plates were color coordinated to different pricing, so we got the price but the frosty covers don't reveal much.

At the sauce station, the variety of sauces was nice, but there are a million signs of how to develop "recommended" sauce combinations. 

All in all.. there is WAYYY too much going on here. The gimmick of these random features fall short. 
I think Chubby Cattle should just concentrate on executing good quality meats/veggies in a timely manner. The entire restaurant was not pleased with the slow pacing of the food coming out (our server was pleasant, at least!).

Interesting experience but probably never would be back.

This was such a fun dining experience! I got the original broth and was surprised by how much flavor it had. They have a great selection of veggies and meats and the make your own sauce station is great! The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star rating is because our server was slacking a bit. It wasn't busy when we came in, yet it took him awhile to get our order and he forgot to bring us a dish. Overall, I really enjoyed dining here and can't wait to go back!

I ate too much, but it's hard not to when every morsel of food gets soaked in fiery flavour. Deni was the server, and he was very accommodating and made sure the hot pot base was full and spicy enough.

Where else in the city can you get authentic Mongolian hot pot. Pretty damn good price too. My lady and I sat down quickly -- we came at 6:30 on a Sunday night.  Xiao was our waitress and she was very attentive. She guided us through the menu and made sure we had drinks and that we ordered just enough food. She was fast and friendly. The menu is sizeable and caters to every palate including vegans (funny to think about a Mongolian vegan -- he probably rode a rainbow unicorn). The meat was good portion and great quality. The broths were flavorful, we tried the half and half. If you needed more flavor, the dipping sauce bar was a nice touch.  We sat at a separate booth but the conveyor is also a interesting feature. We stuffed ourselves for $66.42 before tip.  Not a bad night!

This is a GRRRREAT spot. Found on a post by @eatervegas we tried @chubbycattle. You get your own hot pot and ingredients come to you on a conveyor belt. So yummmm! Restaurant was cute, clean and the staff was super nice. Fun eating!! Oh PS... I'm a finicky eater, don't like onions and certain spices and I did fine. I had the mushroom broth (not spicy at all) and they have a sauce bar so you can add flavors as you wish. Also, they have little signs telling you how long to cook certain foods (e.g. chicken 30 seconds)... so smart!!

I love the bartender Brandon, he makes yummy drinks, works fast, the owner is cute and cool he went to EDC the food is delicious and oh so yummy! I loved the way everything is laid out and set up to enjoy, I think I'll bring my mom here when she visits. But she doesn't like spicy, I LOVE spicy! I can't wait to come back, it's plenty of topping choices and flavors...mmmm

This was our first time eating here and we definitely will be back. Our server, Deni, was helpful in explaining the menu and helped us decide what to order.  We started off with the soup bases- ordered the entry spicy, original and oxtail tomato. Then we had the meat platter, seafood platter and assorted mushroom basket. My daughter really enjoyed their meats which included wagyu beef. They have a conveyor belt if you'd like to add a little extra fillings to your soup. Overall this place is pretty awesome. Atmosphere and service were really good! Everyone was so nice and attentive. I can see what this place has top reviews.

Excellent customer service from the second we stepped foot in the door. Definitely recommend the spicy broth(level hell) with the mixed mushroom basket. The beef and lamb combo was perfect for sharing. Also recommend the noodle combo. Only downside was that the restaurant doesn't have their liquor license but our server Kwan suggested we bring our own alcohol for the next visit at no charge.
This was our first Hot Pot experience and it was amazing! Our waiter Deni guided us through this extravaganza and we will definitely be back

Been here many times and my review here has been long overdue. NOTE: If you work at a casino you get a buy one get one free on the meats you order, and you're not limited to just one order so feel free to order away if you're starving (though the portions are big) or if you have a big group. This is a hotpot place and is very clean. What I really love is that there is a conveyer belt with side dishes going around that you can grab and add to your hotpot. What's always amazing is that there is a sauce bar and you can make your very own sauce to dip your food in. If you like spicy like me, here's my signature sauce creation. 2 scoops of spicy garlic hot oil, 1 scoop of soy sauce, half a scoop of bean paste to round out the flavors, and a small amount of green onion and cilantro. The food is great, the service is great, I always come here when my family and I decide to go out to eat.

Update: There is no longer a buy one get one free anymore but rather a gift card of where you spend X amount and get a portion off your next meal.

Deni a real one and the food bomb. I like the soup. I like the sauce. There fast despite of how busy it is. The reassurance has a cool convertor belt for additional stuff for the soup. It all around has a great atmosphere too.

Having seen and heard many positive reviews on Chubby Cattle, we decided to eat here for Valentine's Day. Despite coming on a holiday, the host was very responsive and the wait was only 20 minutes without a reservation. After the short wait, we were promptly seated and provided with the holiday special; however, we decide not to drink so we ordered off the regular menu instead. Our server, Deni, was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions about the hot pot process. 

We got the original and mushroom broths, beef brisket, rib eye, and premium lamb. We also got additional items off the conveyer belt. Everything we got was tasteful and fresh. The atmosphere was very social and contemporary with a hint of traditional Mongolian culture. 

After being seated, we noticed that the restaurant soon got more packed, leaving multiple customers waiting. We were lucky to only have to wait 20 min but other people had to wait much longer and it took a while for us to get our check at the end of our meal. Other than that, we had a splendid experience and will definitely visit again.

Great new spot if you're in the area.  Similar to a shabu type restaurant but with more variety and options. My group needed up going a little close to close so the full menu wasn't available but the broth choices we had were great and the items coming out on the track were still fresh and tasty. A little overpriced for what you get but definitely a unique and worthwhile choice.

First time trying out the Chubby Cattle and the experience and service was fantastic! I got the Original House Pot and added in all my favorite meats and seafood. Xiao Xiao was super attentive as well as all of the other servers present. The conveyor belt was pretty cool too!

A good business would NOT have seated us without telling that HALF OF THE MENU was "out" and allowed an entire table to dine on just vegetables (the meat cutter was down so we were told 30-40 mins into dinner that we would not get any meat!!!). Our check was $73!!! We were still starving and had to stop by McDonalds on the way home. WTF!

First and foremost, this review is due to the fact that almost everything I wanted on the menu was met with a "we don't have it right now." So they didn't have any of the ramen on the menu or any fried tofu, etc. So we were left with getting a vegetable variety and beef brisket. We were starving so we ate the vegetables and other random items that was rolling around the restaurant. 20 mins later, when we still haven't gotten our beef brisket, we asked for it. Our waiter came back and said that the machine was down. Mind you, we have been asking for everything at least twice before receiving it (including our water and our broth). Needless to say, our table of five had VEGETABLES for dinner, no meat! We asked for our check and was extremely upset.

The two stars I left is for our waiter. Though we had to continually ask for water and broth, we did eventually get it. He was extremely busy. I feel bad for him because he had to be the bearer of  bad news about the meat cutter being down.

Needless to say, I will never be going back here.
Good menu variety. Fresh vegetables and meat.

My first hotpot experience, and I wish I had been able to try the conveyor belt items except my friend and I had plenty of food from ordering the meat and seafood platter (recommended by the waiter).  The quality of the menu was impressive, and the servers were all very helpful and friendly.  I thought the prices were reasonable though a little on the higher end, but it's not like I was expecting cheap soup here.  Next time, I need to just focus on that conveyor belt because that was supposed to be what I came in there to try!  The free scoop of green tea ice cream for dessert was a nice courtesy too.  :)
First time trying Chinese hotpot and it was delicious! It was a great experience. Good music, food, and service. Xiao was wonderful!
Their customer service is great and food is awesome, good for spending time with family. Nice decoration and warm atmosphere. I would like to come back again whenever i want hotpot.

I was browsing on yelp and came across this restaurant. There's a tons of selections in their conveyor belt! I got the tomato sauce soup base that kind of reminds me of Tom yum soup! Must get the beef combo! Awesome place to go

Started with the original base soup and got a vegetable and beef combo plate. Everything tasted great and the portions were perfect. Our server deni attended to us and made the experience even better. Will come back again for my birthday.

After living in Vegas for 7 years, i was yearning to find a great hotpot place. I finally found it!  It is hard to find very spicy broth serve in these places. BUT chubby cattle doesn't disappoint! They have different types of table set ups: bar style, individual hot pot stoves and group stoves for those who like to share. I love that they take care of casino employees by offerring buy 1 meat get 1 free on sundays and wednesdays!! I am definitely coming back and bring my friends!

This place is AMAZING! I've tried the original broth, entry level hell and the mushroom broth, they all taste great but the original is my favorite! The broth can also be flavored with a wide variety of sauces and spices they have available (for free!).  You can grab however many sauces and seasonings you want, which includes soy sauce, chili sauce, oyster sayce, ponzu sauce, green onion, garlic, peanut butter, and a LOT more.  I highly recommend trying them all out!

They have a wide variety of small dishes you can pick off a conveyor belt to cook and eat in your hot pot, as well as a menu you can order off of which includes meat, noodles, and other dishes.  All of the ingredients on the conveyor belt taste very fresh, and range from a measy 99 cents to $3.99.  My personal favorites are the crab, fish cakes, and fried tofu! The meat is really tender and delicious as well and makes a perfect complement to the noodles and broth.  

You can get full for a VERY reasonable price here, since the original soup base itself costs only $3.99.  The servers are attentive and explain how it works to newcomers, as well as giving you a run down of the daily specials.  They also refill your soup when it gets low, which is a nice bonus.  After your meal they even offer you a free popsicle! 

I highly recommend this place for anyone who loves hot pot or is just looking to try something new.  The first of it's kind in Vegas and it sets the bar high!

Went to this place last night. Ordered an appetizer beef skewer. After 35 min I asked server about it and said that I don't want it anymore. She insisted that it was ready. I kept saying I didn't want it. 10-15 min later it arrived. It was not beef. This was lamb and I told her I don't want it. She said too bad we already cooked it. The manager came over and pretty much didn't care either and kept trying to convince me that it was beef. After that, the waitress never came around anymore.  When we got our check, the skewer was still on there. Very disappointing. I would of expected more from a manager then trying to convince me of something that wasn't true plus I waited almost 50 minutes for it. First Time there last time there
This is my go to spot for hotpot. Quality of meat is good, broth is good, service and presentation is great. Our server Deni really helped us out when we were clueless on what to order.
Great hotpot for this weather!!!! Love the mushroom soup. Must try. Go on their happy hour 930pm and up. Parking is a little challenge but worth the wait.
Too expensive it's not worth it to spend that much here plus the service was pretty inattentive and rude

I don't want to be mean, but... the fact is we checked in by 10.15pm one day after Christmas and we headed our trip  from Los Angeles. The service is fast an d good, but the food is way much expensive than LA even SF Bay Area. I ordered the original soup, and The taste was much less than Little Sheep Mongolian or Haidilao Hotpot. Also, the food caused me sick after while, and I have to stayed in the hotel toilet at 1am. Will never come back.
Friendly staff Deni helped us as it was our first time here. Food was better than I expected. I will be back and I will spread the word.

The meal was great, and our server Deni, was on point with his recommendations. The combo platters were plenty for our part of four, and the conveyor belt had lots of cool options for additional food. No complaints.

It's a colorful upbeat Hot Pot restaurant with an active conveyor belt filled with different meats.  We ended up here based on the great reviews and we're not disappointed. The conveyor belt looks like so much fun, but very intimidating, if you're a beginner just like us, I suggest you take recommendations from the waiters and let them walk you through the order.  They have a wide variety of condiments from soy sauce, minced garlic, teriyaki sauce to spicy special chef sauce.  You have to pick your meat, veggies and noodles.  

We also ordered a Large Kolbe Rice Beef that was so tasty deeelish, every bite was filled with Kolbe beef. Highly recommended.

We came on a Friday night, and after reading other Yelp reviews, we did make a reservation ahead of time.  Our table was ready within 10 minutes of our reservation time.  The broths and meats were all very tasty.  We especially liked the fresh noodle combo, although next time we would probably order 2 orders of noodles since they went fast.

On our Las Vegas vacation we were looking for some great food off of the strip. We found Chubby Cattle. This was our first time trying an Asian hot pot restaurant.  For the first timers, you should try the yin yang broth. We tried the original and the entry level spicy broth. They were delicious. We were seated quickly and the servers were very friendly and helpful and walked us through our first time at Chubby Cattle.  Definitely will come back on our next trip.

It is a new and exciting place to eat here in Las Vegas, N.V.! I like that we can definitely have a real hot pot experience now. The lamb sliced and the Hot and Spicy levels being just the right touch for me to feel like I am back in Beijing enjoying my Favorite Hot Pot spot. 

The prices are a bit high for just vegetables but it's ok because the meat selection and all you can get sauces make it all the more worth it. 

Table settings are a bit tight for the space, I would say they are utilizing the square footage but the space is still small and tight. This makes me feel Claustrophobic which usually makes me not want to stay in these types of restaurants, the food and service make up for it. 

Recommend for a try and also know they have Veggies for all my Veggie people.

So delicious! And what a great concept. The meat was high quality, all the soup bases we tried were good, however the ox tail one had a little too much tomato flavor in it. But still very good, however if you really want the true meat taste I'd just go with the original broth. They brought in geo duck (giant clam) for Mother's Day and it was amazing, so fresh  and such a good price as well! Will always come back here!

Having lived in Taiwan, I can tell you that the food is like the hot pot (huo guo) I had there! Outstanding service from Angela and the conveyer belt delivery system reminiscent of a place I visited in Japan. A definite place to repeat! Xie xie!
Good diner environment but kobe beef at price $49 is not worthy to order too thin and least. But great there is a tomato soup healthy good for pregnancy women
Omg amazing, can't wait to come back. Saw this on an Andrew Zimerman show and we came to try it!!!

Stopped here wanting to try something a little different. That's exactly what we got. The experience was fun, and the staff was very friendly and helpful explaining everything. 

Cooking the meat in the broth was fun, and trying all the sides coming by in the conveyor belt was pretty cool. We were there 1.5-2 hours, and it felt like we would still occasionally see new items come by on the belt.
Chubby cattle was yummy! Really enjoyed the conveyer belt. Xiao xiao was kind and attentive with all our dining needs!

Decided to try Chubby Cattle based on the high Yelp rating! Being Chinese-American, I grew up on Chinese Hot Pot (fondue). Chubby Cattle was wonderful! We had the beef, veggies, shrimp paste, meatballs, seafood tofu, shrimp & three different types of noodles. Everything was delicious. Our server, Deni was super nice. He explained everything & answered all of our questions since it was our first time. We will definitely go back next time we're in Vegas.
Great food and service. The sauce bar is pretty rad. If you like spicy stuff you won't be disappointed by their spicy soup broth.

This place is new! Very clean and our server Deni was nice. My favorite part was the converter belt. They have more soup base than other places. Mushroom base was very good. Only thing I don't like was bar space was uncomfortable I wish bar space is little wider so we can put our stuffs on the table except that everything was good!
Very good experience. Love this place and Deni was awesome. Great food and atmosphere.

Always love a nice hot pot during the cold season, I ordered the original soup & excellent choices of meat to choose from as well as veggies! Love the beef platter with extra corn, mushroom & baby bochoy! Yummy in my tummy! Outstanding customer service & if you like a little cold drink to go with your meal I suggest the Beauty & the beast it's delicious!
Food are clean and good, great staffs and customer service. No waiting. Great place for hang out in Las Vegas. Recommended for this place :)

Server asked to pay ahead of time cause his shift was over. Also told us another server can take more orders on a separate bill. What kind of service is this? In the middle of our dinner we had to pay for our bill. Will not return!

This was our first time eating hot pot but definitely won't be our last! Right when you walk in, I immediately noticed how cute (and clean!) the place is. We had a reservation so luckily, our party of four sat right away on a busy weekend (which made it so much better considering trying to find a parking spot was horrible). Best part was that we sat right by the conveyor belt and made this experience even better! Thankfully, our server, Matthew, helped us figure out how to order and was VERY patient with us! I got everything he recommended (house soup, enoki mushroom, thick noodle, beef tongue and mango juice to drink), and everything was BOMB! Don't forget to make your sauce at the sauce bar! I made it just how they recommended for beef items, and it went perfectly with my soup! I also loved the idea of the conveyor belt coming around with more meat and veggies so if I didn't want a large portion of something off the menu, then I could just grab it off the belt. Be careful though! That belt stops for no one!!! Can't wait to go back here and try the other soup bases and meats!!!
Was delish!!! Xiao was our server, so helpful! They have big selection of meats, seafoods and vegetables. The watermelon juice was my favorite.

I read so many good reviews so I thought I give it a try.  Totally unimpress.  1st there were no line and I had to wait 10 minutes while there were seating available.  I ordered the watermelon juice, and was told they didn't have it.  I then order the seafood broth, was once again told they don't have it.   I just left the restaurant.

This place is great!! If you're thinking about coming here think no more! I would come here every night if I could. Everything was amazing from the service to the food. I love the conveyer belt it's such a cool idea! I would recommend going after 9:30 and taking advantage of their happy hour because it's so worth it! Buy one get one free off the conveyer belt! There's so much on it from veggies, seafood, random stuff and several different types of tofu! Check the conveyer belt before they come to order because we didn't and some of the stuff we ordered was actually on there! Get the beef combo it's so good! The broths are so good too but the hot is extra hot I could barely eat it! They have all kinds of sauces that you get to serve yourself which is cool! Definitely check this place out you won't be disappointed!

gotta be the best shabu shabu experience in town. the broths are very good. best friends and i decided to go for the family style with a two broth combo. we tried the spicy and numb & the original. overall, the service was friendly and the server was knowledgeable about the menu enough to go over some key points about the differences in broth styles and meats. 

i really liked the spicy & numb broth, but it was somewhat overpowering with bay leaf. if it had a little less of that i think it would've been perfect. the original was beautifully subtle and great for a simple broth for the beef. 
beef combo & tiger shrimp were all great. 

overall, great spot. they also have a sauce bar you can make your own dips in.
This is by the far the best out of 2 hot pot spot that I've been too lol more than satisfying! Shout out to kuya Deni for the great helpful service and for making my peanut sauce! (:

This is my favorite hotpot in town. Great selection of hotpot items from seafood, meat, vegetables and tofu. My favorite here is their house made balls. A definitely must try. They have a variety of broths available too that are very flavorful. My favorite are the house and seafood broths. 

Make sure to mention that you want to be a member so you get special discounts. 

Lastly, Xiao Xiao is a great server!
I normally don't eat at soup spots but when I do. I come here, great welcoming staff and delicious food. I'll be back for sure!

It's a small place and there was a little confusion in seating us. Other than that, this special little place serves up an awesome experience. Quality food, good presentation, strong drinks and truly amazing waiter experience. If I lived in Las Vegas, I would come here on a regular.

Ordered: 
Spicy broth
Kobe Beef
Pork Belly
Variety of items from the conveyor belt

Service was really good that night. Our server was very attentive. The spicy broth was pretty spicy and definitely not for the faint hearted. I like spicy food so it was perfect for me . The conveyor belt definitely changes the norm of eating out, which is pretty cool. Everything we got tasted really good and will definitely be coming back!!

Super fun experience! The colorful plates on the conveyor feels like something out of a Tim Burton film. You get to pick your own broth (I had mushroom) then add in noodles, veggies, meat and seafood. You can also pick extras off the conveyor to throw in. There are lots of interesting options to try and Deni, our waiter, walked us through everything. I'd come back to try this again, but word of warning, the parking lot is a nightmare.

Yummy food ! I
However, I wouldn't recommend the house broth if you are not used to Asian hot pot because it has too much "seeds" (I forgot the name) in it. When you bite into it, it somewhat numbs your mouth and then there is a hint of a metal flavor. 

If you are a first timer I would recommend either the mushroom or tomato broth! Their presentation is beautiful especially with the combos. They have cute little baskets and use dry ice as decoration as well. 

We had the meat combo, scallops, 2 mushroom soup, pork dumplings, rice (you have to order), crab meat, and veggie noodles. It came out to about $50 enough for 2 people. Everything was very tasty however you have to watch the noodles carefully because they tend to get pretty mushy if you leave it in too long. 

I LOVE the sauce station ! They have a wide variety of sauces to choose from and to mix with. It was also a nice touch how they had sauce mixture recommendations. 

They also have a happy hour for everything on the conveyor belt buy one get one free SUN-THURS 9:30-12:30. 

Overall, I had a wonderful experience. Shout out to our server xiao xiao! She was very helpful with refilling our broth and with anything that we needed.

The is the second time I've been to this place. The food is awesome, very authentic and fresh, and our server Deni is really nice and react fast to all our requests. If you want to experience good personal hot pot, this is the place to go! Today is Valentine's Day and I even got a rose from them :)
The food is decent. The food display was nice & unique. Our server xiao xiao was also very nice.

Great spot! They had  variety of veggies and meats and pricing is awesome. Must try the entry level spice broth . For a person that don't eat spicy foods, it had me wanting more. Gillbert was my waiter and he was very informative and always made sure we had everything we needed.
Yes please. Been coming to this place for awhile. Awesome staff great food portions and the novelty of a conveyer belt. Chubby Cattle for life.

We came here last time at Thursday night but they about to close so I choose to comes back again. We choose original and spicy for our base. They both no taste, totally plain. In the soup pot there are a lot of herb, but still does't make any taste. The services was ok. The meats was so so.

Weather has been cooling down in Vegas and the family was looking for a new spot for dinner.  This place had good reviews so we decided to give it a shot.  

Thank you Yelp for yet again a great introduction.  

Chubby Cattle is in a busy plaza that we pass all the time.  We've been to District One and Cafe Moda before.  Chubby Cattle was a huge hit with the family and we'll be back!

Deni was our service and he did an excellent job of showing us the ropes.  We didn't have reservations so we sat at a table.  Not a problem.  At the center of the table is a warmer and you order two different broths.  We ordered an original for the kids and a medium spicy for us.  

We ordered the angus, brisket, shrimp, veggies, noodles, dumplings, and more.  Everything was delicious.  

It's a fun environment, super clean, and the service was excellent from hostess to server.  

We'll be back!!

Just walked into this place at 9:31 pm Sunday (today). This sign is up clearly said sunday-thursday happy hour 930-1145 but the host said they do not have happy hour. Waited 30 mins for this information that is clearly stated on the board in the restaurant. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. BEWARE.

If you like Hotpot then get thee to Chubby Cattle! We went for lunch on Dec 26th as they were open from 12-3pm that day.They have a great selection of broths to choose from and a wide array of yummy goodness ( and sometimes weirdness) to simmer. I prefer beef, tendon and veggies over pork blood and duck flipper, but hey, there's something for everyone! The coolest part is that you can sit at the bar in front of a refrigerated covered conveyor belt and grab things as you see/want them. They keep track of your consumption by the color-coded plates.
I really enjoyed the food! We were desperate to return but were dismayed that they only seemed to open at 5pm everyday. We were confused as we had been there at 2pm the day before. In any case, it's a fantastic experience and worth getting away from the Strip for!

Our server, Matthew was very helpful and explained everything to us. We ordered the beef plate and it had three different meats. All the meats were not too fatty and were soft. We sat at a table that had individual pots. This allowed each of us to cook the food how we wanted to. We got there for happy hour (9:30pm to 12:00) which you buy one plate and get one free. It still cost $66 for three of us. But we were full. Definitely would recommend this place.

Such delicious hot pot! I had the original broth, and couldn't get enough of it. If you order the lobster, the presentation is really cool. Looks vex that we could build our own sauce, too. Service is quick and friendly.

Best hotpot in Las Vegas!!!  I come here at least once a week.  The service is always friendly.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  They also have a great happy hour.   So happy I've found this gem!!

Now I understand why there are so many reviews. Restaurant virtually demands you write a review ... preferably 5 stars. Far from the rating I would give. First and last visit to this place. Must accept some of the blame myself as it was my first experience at hot pot. Spent $60 for myself only. Interesting concept, but due somewhat to my inexperience, it just did not work. I overcooked the meat making it virtually inedible. Tough and tasteless (beef tongue and premium lamb). Shrimp were good, but I do not like peel your own. They were fresh as were the scallops, which were quite small. Best dish was the kobe fried rice, which was quite good but not great. Pass on the watermelon juice which was watery and served at room temperature. Blah!  Based on all of the Yelp reviews, I decided to give it a try and did but wished I didn't.

Pretty cool concept! Each person gets their own pot of broth and you pick what you want to cook from a conveyor belt. You can also create your own dipping sauce from the condiment bar. 
**3 stars because my server is helping and serving everyone around me. I had to flag him down for forks and to order some rib eye...twice! 
***OK 4 stars because he saw me 'Yelping' and is now attentive. Too attentive! Now I can't get him off my back! I would include his name but none of the workers here have a name tag.

Some friends went there together to celebrate for the holiday,I expected to have a wonderful hot pot experience. BUT The meat was NOT really fresh. Taste not very well. Not like other Chinese hot pot restaurant at all. Everyone was so disappointed :((((((
Food was good, but there were no Chunby bbw ladies to meet my desires.... disappoint t

Hot pot is definitely one of my favorite things to eat. Sadly, Vegas doesn't have many hotpot options. I had to resort to try Chubby Cattle. I have been here 4-5 times, every time I have had a pleasant experience. The only issue is that this place is completely overpriced for the amount of vegetables and add ons. The meat quality was soso, and the broth wasn't spectacular. I recently tried the tomato broth and I do recommend that over all the other broths. Also, I would recommend trying the side dishes they have at the sauce table. There was lotus root one time when I went and it was delicious. Another time there was this wood mushrooms. Overall, I would give Chubby Cattle 3/5. It is though the better hotpot places in Vegas.

First time at Chubby Cattle. I was very confused because I never been to a place like this before. My server, Deni, we very helpful and explained everything to me. He was very friendly, funny, and provided phenomenal service. I got the entry level hell pot, even though he warned me it would be very spicy. It wasn't too spicy for me but it did have a kick. Everything was delicious and a great experience! Try this place out for something new.
Great hot pot with great service! Love those food, everyone looks really professional, and well trained. Food are clean and tasty.

5 stars all the way. The waiters were fantastic and attentive. The food was very filling and priced right. Fresh ingredients and super spicy. You can't go wrong with anything at Chubby a Cattle. You can go full cave man and order tons of meat or stick to veggies and tofu and go more healthy. And don't forget the awesome sauce station that gives you the option to heat up any order. The conveyor belt is just a great plus to the restaurant. They have a limited alcohol menu but with soju and some wines and beer I can't complain. One of the best restaurants in the area and a mainstay in a top food corridors in China Town.

Excellent hot pot for authentic Chinese food enthusiasts! I was impressed by the wide array of sauces and toppings for the hot pot dishes, as well as the meat selection. The décor is perfect for a hip date or a casual night out with friends, and the space is perfect for entertaining private parties, small shindigs, or even single eating (because they have a cool conveyor belt with dim sum-like dishes).

Individual pots are a must for our family! I like tomato, my kids like original, my hubby needs the spicy pot, so having those options on a table is perfect. The pork wontons are always delicious, beef and lamb combo, beef tendon balls, pork belly, spinach, mini pork sausages, udon noodles and pumpkin rounded out our menu. Everything was fresh and tasted amazing!! The sauce bar is filled with lots of options to sit everyone's tastes. Lychee mojito is refreshing and pairs nicely with everything.

First and foremost, I believe their rating is a false high.  The server tells you about half way through your meal that if you leave a review on Yelp while you are there and show him at the end of the meal you will get a free desert.  He then tried to clear our food while we are still eating and asked if we were ready for our free dessert.  When we were finally done he approached us again about the dessert to which we replied we didn't want dessert.  

The actual food was just ok.  The broth was a little boring, we both got the spicy broth, I got a little spicier than my husband.  There is a "sauce bar" which is pretty awesome that you can make your own sauces as well as a couple of prepared sauces.  At the end of the day it was just kind of a stressful meal experience.  You get very little room and they try to recommend a meat platter, vegetable platter and seafood platter; we didn't get the seafood.  There is no room to really do much and you are cooking your own stuff so you can't move much while you are trying to cook.  Not to mention if you want anything off the conveyor belt there is no room to put it.  We only got two items off the conveyor belt and both times didn't know where to put the dish.  There were two ladles in the broth, one regular and one with holes to scoop out the chiles and such.  The last hot pot restaurant we went to had a little container to put your utensils in which was very convenient as well as a pair of scissors for you to cut things up, something they might want to look into.  

We've been to hot pot before, Yojie, and had a really good time.  Overall I think this place just doesn't do as good of a job, it's a little to gimmicky and hip.  I think it's way sketchy when you are pushed to do reviews in front of the staff, I wouldn't go back.  On a final note there was a very intense smell in there, kind of a cross between body odor and bad fish, I almost left before we were seated because of it, kind of wish we had.

Good enough food especially with a group of friends. Pricey for food that you cook yourself... Their customer service need improvement especially for the people who handle telephone inquiries and reservations. First they lost my initial reservation, then my group increased to 17 and was told that my group is too large

I ate at Chubby Cattle last night with family and it did not disappoint. This was my first time eating Chinese hot pot cuisine and it Kwan explained everything perfectly and recommended the original broth which was delicious. Sylvia was also extremely attentive and helpful as she knew it was our first time as well. Will definitely be back, everything was fresh and absolutely decadent.

Ugh, I had such high hopes for this place, but my coworkers and I agreed that we wouldn't go back. We went around 9:30pm on a Thursday night for their buy one get one free happy hour. Even with this, my bill came out to be around $16. I got the tomato broth, beef brisket, enoki mushrooms, another type of mushroom, tripe, and jelly noodles (jü luo). Maybe I think it's so expensive because I'm used to eating 5x more food at AYCEs for $25.

Another reviewer recommended the tomato broth ($4.99), so that's what I got. I hated it. It tasted like tomato paste from a can and was really salty. My coworker got the original broth and I liked that much much better. 

For the meat option, I got the beef brisket ($5.99). It was the cheapest option on the menu, but it was still tasty. Came with about 7 slices. The beef here is definitely the star of the meal, with wagyu/kobe options. Honestly, if I were to ever come again, I'd just splurge on the combo and skip all the other stuff. 

The 2 mushrooms were $1.99 each, jelly noodles $2.99 and tripe $3.59 (pre-happy hour discount). SO expensive. I also really wanted the chrysanthemum greens, but they were $2.99 for a single serving. At the Chinese market, you can get enough chrysanthemum greens for 10 people at that price. I definitely wouldn't come without the happy hour discount. I'd only come if you weren't that hungry. If you're really hungry, go to an all you can eat. 

The conveyor belt was really limited in options. They didn't have qual eggs or a variety of fish/meat balls. It also didn't really look that fresh. Maybe it was basically it was late on a slow night.

I will say that the service was really good. The waiter refilled our waters, got us beers and even split our bill for us, which was much appreciated.

This is my second time of the same experience which can't understand why they are doing such stupid thing to a big return customer.
I visited here a few times and I tipped a lot in hoping to be remembered by the staff but it is already second time I had a hard time to be seated since a half the restaurant is empty. I guess they are playing a busy renowned restaurant game or something. We asked nicely to be seated by the conveyor side before visiting by the phome and confirmed but when we arrived there even though 2/3 of the restaurant is empty  telling us to seat at the bar.  Very bad way to treating customers. I will NEVER go back here.

We found this place on yelp and tried it out for the first time yesterday. It has a yelp checking offer 70 percent off waygu beef. We ordered the soup bases, vegetables, and wanted to order different meats. As we showed the waitress the check in coupon she said she couldnt honor the coupon. It was for EDC weekeend only. The coupon doesn't state so, and its online right now, so we went back and forth with her. Finally she left to check for us if she could honor it. Again. Its advertised. That's one of the reasons we came here for. As she came back she said a short. I'm sorry we are out of the meat. So we cant use the coupon. First she refuses to honor it and then magically they are out of the meat.
Then we asked her what meats she is not out of and she offered the beef combo plate that entails three different meats. One is the waygu beef. So we were like you have the waygu beef when its entailed in the platter but not the waygu beef that you ADVERTISE for the coupon. Well thats great. Lol
We just let it go and ended up ordering the meat combo plate and a stella(Which they were out of too...) We waited forever on our meats. We were almost done with the vegetables before even got the meat platter. The conveyer belt was full off mist, so we couldnt see whats on the belt.
In all. Done come here. There are hundreds of other great places in town that actually value their customers and honor what they advertise. (Funny thing. Its been 24 hours after our visit and the coupon is still up)

I've been here three times already, once during happy hour (9:30 pm to closing). With inexpensive hot pot bases, a wide assortment of small dishes, and a house menu you can order from, there is no shortage of variety in the food here. Unlimited sauces and toppings means you can customize your hot pot to fit your flavor preference. My only gripe would be they run out of popular conveyer belt items and take forever to replace them while the same unpopular items pass by on an infinite loop, never to be picked. This is especially true during happy hour.

This is my 2nd time here and I love it. I just love all the Mongolian BBQ and the unlimited sauces. Gillbert is our server and he is very attentive to our needs. Will definitely come back again and try different pot base:)

This place has phenomenal service with high quality food. Not only that, but everything from the plates to the conveyer belt to the tables are clean! 

Let's start with the food -- the broth has a divider that allowed us to try three different broths. We got the heaven, hell, and mushroom (the mushroom was my personal favorite). The heaven and hell pot is called yin yang and you can get that by itself also! The conveyer belt is CONSTANTLY packed with food and restocked so you don't have to wait forever which is a problem I've had in the past. I ordered wine and they do NOT skimp on the wine like other places do and actually know what to recommend. Their serving sizes for the beef and lamb platters were perfect for four people. 

Moving on to the service, impeccable. One of the most considerate staff I've ever come across. They always came to refill all THREE of our broths and drinks. Unlike other restaurants that only check up on you when you wave them down. They explained the entire process for those of us that haven't been there and made the overall experience that much more enjoyable. The manager is also so great! We had a small hiccup with the mix up of food and she (sylvia) came straight out to fix everything and apologize. This is one of the only places that I've experienced this kind of genuine service.

Overall, this is a wonderful restaurant with a cool and friendly ambience. I would recommend this to everyone craving hot pot!

Chubby Cattle is awesome! It's your typical hot pot kinda deal, but the conveyor belt is a nice touch depending on if you sit next to it. Since it was our first time, our server Kwan helped us out! He explained everything pretty thoroughly so we knew how much food we were getting despite the pretty ambiguous menu. But overall, nice job chubby cattle. Nice job

This is such a cool place! 
It's hot pot and how the menu works is you pick a broth, ( I picked the spicy one) 
You can add noodles for $1 ( I had green tea and it's with the add on but only one order per person) 
Pick your meat ( I picked brisket) 
And then there's a conveyer belt of other add-ons, you grab whatever you want out of it and pay according to the plate color chart.
My broth was spicy but kinda meh. 
My meat was perfect, the noodles were good.
I ordered water with lemon and asked for lemons 4 times and never got it but that's okay.
The beer was 1/2 off so I of course ordered 2.
They have an AWESOME sauce bar you can help yourself to.
Honestly this is one of the funniest restaurants I've been to, the food was pretty good. 
I'll be back. 
Try this place out you'll have a good time and it's all a good price.
First time here. The food was delicious and and our server Deni was super helpful and friendly. Will definitely be coming back

I had Chubby Cattle bookmarked for a while, and decided to visit when a friend was in town. We came before 6PM so it wasn't too busy yet. We had the choice of small or large hot pots, and we opted for small (i.e. individual) hot pots, as the hostess said that it was better value for a party of two since there was no minimum spending requirement. We were also able to secure a booth next to the conveyor belt. I wanted to try out the conveyor belt because it was such a novelty for a hot pot restaurant, though if you sit at a regular table, you can still order everything off the menu.

Prices are reasonable, though it's all a la carte, so things can add up quickly if you aren't keeping track. Portions are decent too, so value is not terrible.

The interior of the restaurant is very modern and eclectic. It's not all that big, and there is no time limit, so at peak dining times, there may be quite a wait.

There are five great broths to choose from, and I opted for oxtail. There is an excellent sauce bar, and some complimentary side dishes and dessert as well.

All of the main food is ordered a la carte, and everything aside from the meats and cooked items can be found on the refrigerated conveyor belt.

My friend and I ordered a few things to share, and greatly enjoyed all of the food and broths. Service was also outstanding, as we were checked on regularly and given napkins plus water/soup broth refills. Our waitress Xiao was very friendly!

The one small shortcoming was that the ??? (beef pie) we ordered took forever to arrive, we waited over forty minutes! They did apologize though, and they tasted quite good!

I look forward to returning in the future for some tasty hotpot! Maybe more so when the weather is cooler. ;)

This is on of the healthiest restaurant for who want to take care of your body. I love the house base soup which has Chinese herbs in there....Great service...I will come back here again....highly recommended!!!

Good Chinese hot pot place in Las Vegas. Neat idea with the conveyor belts. Portions aren't the biggest and not the hugest selection, but good quality foods. Good sauce bar selection too. Located in the Chinatown strip malls.

Omg this place is so good! Wish we had it in LA. I love the self-serve style cuz I literally see my food and just reach to get whatever I want. You can choose to get your own pot, with customized flavors. You also have the option to do family-style if you would like, which is pretty nice. The sauces are great and beef is on point! Totally recommend! If I ever come back to Vegas I'm coming here.
I love chubby cattle!! The server Deni was very friendly and provided excellent service. I definitely recommend this place to everyone who loves quality food and service.

Wow! Want to try this place ever since we saw it in BAZAARS FOOD with Andrew Zimner(love his show)..and just wow! Food was amazing and the service was awesome too. We will be coming back here everytime we come to vegas from now on..

ORDER the BRISKET!!! 
First time trying the conveyor belt hot pot. Overall experience a 10/10. Mushroom broth plus all the different sauce was definitely enjoyable. I had the opportunity to try the brisket, ribeye, and pork belly. Ranking in that order just in case. There were other plates, not worth mentioning. 

Hopefully the choices on the conveyor belt would change. The options/choices were the regular stuff you can get at 168. Can I byoi?  Bring your own ingredients? Charging an arm and a leg for my fav imitation crab meat. 

I don't know if there would be a next time, easier doing at home. However was a very unique first time in this establishment. Had to try it out.

Delicious and so fun to eat.  Food on a conveyor that you select and cook in your own broth similar to a fondu.  I had the tomato broth and everything I put in it was delicious!  Service was fantastic even though we were sitting at the bar.  Great place for date night!
Parking is terrible it took 15 mins to wait for some one to leave. But quick service once we got inside.  Good quality of food. Host was attentive. Water is a no no. I would go back again.

Second time eating here. Just as great as the first time. Service was great and very attentive. James was our server. Took care of all of our needs. Will recommend to everyone. I was very impressed to say the least.

Went here with friends for dinner and had a good experience! It's been a while since I've had hot pot and figured with the cold weather it was about time! 

The food was pretty good, but my main complaint with this place is the lack of sets or combos. You basically have to order each ingredient separately which allows for customization to the max, but for people like me, it just takes more time to figure out what you want. You gotta be careful too since the price can rack up pretty quickly! I ended up playing almost $30 for my individual broth, beef brisket, 2 side orders of noodles, and 2 side orders of mushrooms. I wasn't full after my meal, but the food was good and at least the sauces are free XD. I like how they have some ingredients like veggies, mushrooms, noodles, and oysters on a conveyor belt so you can grab whatever you like.

It was kind of hard to understand the waiter due to his accent, but he was very nice. The wait staff could check on us a bit more since they stopped coming towards the middle to end of the meal. We had to flag someone down to get a refill on the broth.

Overall I'd recommend this place for hot pot if you are around the area. It can get a bit pricy so try to go during happy hour when the conveyor belt ingredients are buy one get one free. I wish they had sets you could order so you can get a bunch of things at one price.
I'm sitting here with my friends having a dinner. Our sever is Kevin. He's super nice also the food is delicious. Highly recommended.
Glad I came here! Great selection and atmosphere. Our server, Matthew, really took care of us. I will be coming back.

Excellent place to dine . Portions are good for the price. 1st time here and our server, Deni, gave us good advice on what to order. Was going to order 2 meat combo plates but advised us 1 would be plenty.

Me and my best friend have come here a total of 3 times and don't plan on stopping soon. The place is clean, cute and staff is friendly. I enjoy the food, atmosphere and staff. Sylvia (I'm not sure) is one of the nicest people! She remembered us after only eating one time :)! I love Chubby Cattle and will continue to eat here !

Loves the options here.  Soup was extremely flavorful.  Was able to order from menu and from rotating bar, great options.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed it.

Came back for a second round since we're in LV,  still as great as last time with excellent service from Angela again.

I love chubby cattle's soup and vegetables! Their meat is okay and you can tell it's fresh! However, with high quality meat comes a high quality price! The house broth is plentiful and really good! The sauce bar was HEAVENLY! I love how they give you suggestions of what goes with what and they turn out amazing! The conveyor belt is also really fun and don't be surprised if you look down at your plate and see tons of plates! You don't even realize you took so many items from the conveyer belt. Their cuttlefish fish balls are spectacular and work well with the soup! I love coming here and even though you smell like soup by the end of it you'll know that you had a good meal!

This is  husbands and I  favorite hot pot place. We love their fresh quality food. Our favorite dishes are the seaweed salad, the beef, and the udon noodles. We also love the broth. The guest service is great and we had a wonderful server named Deni and he was very helpful and kind.
Excellent service and wonderful dinner experience. Deni walked us through the menu and how to eat hot pot!  I highly recommend Chubby Cattle!!

Not much else I can say that most others haven't already. The service is fantastic, choice of meats and sauces are not something one could do better to improve. The only thing I was slightly disappointed about was the soup. It was delicious, but the spice level is not as hot as expected. Otherwise, come on down! I will most definitely come here every time I'm in Vegas!

Deni was our primary server. Wow.  He addressed our allergy concerns and made sure we ordered what we wanted.  The other staff consistently made sure the empty plates were cleared and answered any other questions.  Definitely coming back!!!

I came here again on Dec. 26 and had a meh/whatever type of experience. The meats were good still but everything else was pretty whatever compared to the first experience I had here. On top of that, they don't offer the conveyor belt happy hour BOGO during the holiday season apparently. Our server did not mention this at all, but kept encouraging us to get items from the conveyor belt.

Awesome idea! My mother and I had a fantastic time at Chubby Cattle! The service was phenomenal and the experience was just so much fun and like nothing I've ever done before!

You can eat as much or as little as you like. Just choose your hot pot broth, select some meats of the menu, grab some sauces from their sauce bar and pick and choose the plates as they roll by on the conveyor belt. Hungry for more? Then just keep grabbing those plates and they'll tally the plates up at the end. (If you're wondering how much each plate costs, just check out their little plate key below every window). 

My mother is in from Texas and she loved the experience and can't wait to go back. Besides just having a great time, the staff were all very helpful and super nice and attentive. Kind of rare for a Chinatown restaurant to be honest so it was greatly appreciated. 

Would I go back? Absolutely without a doubt! Would I recommend it to my friends and family? Heck ya!

My first time here and I really enjoyed the food. The food is fantastic and it was a really good experience. I definitely plan on returning. Our server, Deni, and the rest of the staff were great and had a wonderful sense of humor! We had the mushroom platter, meat platter, veggie platter and seafood platter and were not disappointed with any of it.

My husband and I spend a lot of time in Asia. I had to convince him to come get hotpot while we are visiting Vegas. We LOVED this place and cannot wait to come back! I got the original and loved how the flavor changed the more I cooked in it. If you want food away from the strip you have to come here.

Really good! Our waitress Xiao Xiao gave us a wonderful first timer run through with all the meats etc. explained everything and how the portions came out and was open to answer every single question we had. The atmosphere had a very modern feel with authentic indie music playing. Very clean place and had quick service, due to heavy staffing which is good because they look around to see if you need anything. Overall it was a fun experience!

We were expecting more from this restaurant after reading the reviews.  We ordered the wagyu beef and ribeye.  Do not order the wagyu.  It was totally not worth it.  The meat was chewy and looked more like bacon where half of it was pure fat.  There was no marbling of the fat and the pieces were so tiny!  The ribeye was very good and that was worth the price.  The side dishes on the conveyor belt were not very appealing.  We only chose the green leafy veggies to add to our hot pot.  The spicy broth was very spicy so I would recommend the least spicy of the choices.  Will we go back?  I don't think so.

Yummy food had the mushroom and seafood base step 2.  Loved the conveyor belt it was fun to watch and grab food as I go. Quinny was awesome very friendly!! Super busy so it's a must for a reservation. Hoping to come back soon!!
Please don't post certain special hours and not accommodate time posted. Came in at 12 only to be told they open @ 12:30.

This is our second time here and we love it! Great food, great service from a sweet and patient waitress that explained everything to us. Thank you Queeny! You choose the base broth you like and then it's endless food choices to cook in your broth. We tried all the broths so far and they are all good. The freshness of their produce is ridiculous, the meat oh so tender! Will come back again and again!

Finally a restaurant with a conveyor belt that serves a variety other than sushi. You'll find so many options. Our server Kwan walked us through pretty  much everything and recommended the spicy soup base at entry level spice, the beef combination generous for two. And happy hour is BOGO on the belt!!! Definitely worth coming back to for numerous occasions!
Very tasteful hotspot. Great service Deni. Thanks you. Will definitely come back here again

We have been consistent patrons of Chubby Cattle, we come to eat here at least once a month; especially during happy hour on Sunday to Thursday from 9:30 onwards. What became our favorite here is the hell soup and mushroom pot; they are satisfyingly tasty but not too overwhelming that you can truly finish the whole lot of broth. They have quiet a selection on meat, seafood and vegetable and all always come to our table fresh. Their watermelon juice is also worth the try. We will keep coming back here.

What a fun place have dinner.  Service was excellent. Sylvia (manager) is a wonderful person.  Makes you want to come back and visit again.  This place reminds of me old benihana Japanese restaurant except with different ingredients of foods on rotating belt. You order the broth of your liking and meat from the server. The rest of stuff you pick it off the conveyer belt moves around entire restaurant. You are charged by the dishes at the end of meal. Sort of like dim sum place.  Food is tasty and ambiance is very modern and stylish.  This place will make a fun date night restaurant.
Great food and service!  Best beef I got anywhere!  Definitely come back.  By the way, Deni our server was great!
This place is awesome. Love the Tomato Base Soup. The meats are really good, too. We had the brisket and the lamb along with some seafood. The servers are also great. Will definitely comeback.

Super inconsistent. Want to love it so bad! I have been here over 10 times. On busy nights, slow Tuesdays. Late nights and early dinner, but I never have the same dining experience. My reason for finally reviewing this place is after so many dining experiences; the fact they didn't have Szechuan pepper corns! Literally the main ingredient in Mongolian hot pot! Come on guys, get it together. 

       Now the broth was spicy and actually had some love, (they compensated by adding tons of chili oil and chili's) but it just drew the line. I love their beef combo great   meat program, but are often out of product.  
 
       Great concept with good product, but just never consistent. Try it out, maybe you'll have a good day for chubby cattle!

I really hate to leave a bad review because the staff was so nice. I came in with my mother to eat. I spent $75 (after tip) and left unfulfilled. It looked like a lot of food since it was spread out so nicely, but there was hardly any meat. The meat was sliced so thin, it disappeared into the soup. We get the dumplings, noodle trio, beef combo, chicken and veggie. That was my experience :/

The reason they have close to 5 stars is because they bribe people w/ free ice creaming. First of all, there's no flavor in their soup. It was disappointing service. They say me at a high top table that was clearly made for a large party. It's awkward sitting that close to other parties. I was extremely disappointed in the lack of flavors. Shabu Shabu Paradise is still #1 in my book and can't be beat!

Chubby Cattle is, in my opinion, one of the more prominent locations for hot pot enthusiasts. From a wide variety of meats, vegetables, seafood, and noodle/tofu varieties; it's difficult to not find something that will eventually become your favorite. I highly recommend that if haven't had hot pot yet, this should definitely be your first spot. Chubby Cattle sets the bar high for how how pot should be served and enjoyed; all with fair prices. Our server, James, provided phenomenal service which made our experience here much more enjoyable. I plan on coming here again soon.
Best hot pot in Las Vegas! Customer service is great, which is hard to find in Las Vegas!

Extremely helpful staff and a packed house made for a fun night. I chose a mushroom course with a very light, low-salt broth. Great prices to offset the über. I would love it if they added duck to their selection.
For our first time going here we have to say it was nothing but great service! Deni was very helpful with the menu. And helped us pick out some great combos! Can't wait to come back

Awful! So expensive and not enough for 3 people. The conveyor belt is so useless. All it does is spin around the belt over and over again. It doesn't have any selection in it. It is also over priced for bite sized portions. The Chinese pancake was disgusting. It literally tasted like the ones you get in the frozen aisle at 168. That was over priced too. For one of those frozen, store bought ones, it was $5. DO NOT GO HERE.
Great place. Service. So good. Food was good and fun.  Great atmosphere. Staff was attentive. Fun concept.

I love the concept of this place, a conveyor belt bringing food to me. Yet, something gets lost in translation. First, the broth, I liked mine, it was entry level hell- at first really spicy but as I ate it down it was fine. I made myself a decent dipping sauce, but would love it if there were some suggestions. Meat and vegetables seemed very fresh, but too expensive for me. The amount of meat given per dish was not that much for the price. The amount of vegetable was fine. I didn't partake of any rice or noodles but they seemed very run of the mill. I didn't take anything from the conveyor belt, and I didn't notice anyone else taking any either. I sort of question the freshness of the dishes and the dishes themselves, some sort of informational chart would be helpful. 
The people around me seemed to enjoy their food. Service was slow because they were crazy busy. We asked for soup spoons, twice, then received iced tea like spoons. We never had our water refilled, and didn't get much attention. Deni was our server, he was just too busy for us. He came by to ask us to fill out a survey and check in on Yelp to get some free ice cream. Another server plopped down the ice cream when we weren't done with our food - honestly I would have ordered more, but they never asked. For the 3 of us, the total was about $62, I'd much rather go to an all you can eat KBBQ place and pay a little more. I'd say Chubby Cattle, is good to try once, but I wouldn't come back.

Wow! I've never had chinese hot pot before and didn't know what to expect, boy was I blown away by this place!

What an experience! The food was so fresh and flavorful. The rotation sushi hotpot bar was supper cool and convenient. They had so many varieties of food you could add to your soup to customize it.

Not only was the food great but we had the most helpful and kind waitress. She recommended many things to us so we could try our food the traditional Chinese way and she was so happy and sweet the entire time. 

If this is your first time having chinese hot pot, please come here!

10/10

I have to thank our local cousin who recommended this place to us.  We came in town during the week of Christmas and new year so we the wait over half and hour. They were so kind to give us little snacks while we waited. Their soup the hot pot had these herbs I remembered my mom would make for with when we were sick, so I knew the soup was super healthy. The vegetable and mushroom combo had so many varieties of different vegetables and mushrooms. The meat we had was soft and tender. They had a table full of different sauces you can choose from. I had the ponzu sauce and chili so it was sour and spicy combine with the tasty herby soup, I can't ask for a better experience with hot pot. Fantastic eat! I gave them a four star because we ask for one of their desserts but they said it would take too long to make. It seems like they were rushing us out because of the long line. However their service were all very nice. If I had some green tea ice cream I think my dinner would been a perfect 5 star experience.

This place was a gem that my wife and I found on yelp. Had great reviews and I can see why.  The service is awesome. Our drinks were refilled without us asking. The recommendations that Demi gave us were so good. We were hesitant to try the tomato soup base but he said we should try it and he was right about how delicious it was. The beef combo was yummy and the mushroom sampler was so epic. There was an over abundance of mushrooms, and some were types that I have never had before. The presentation of the food was excellent as well. Not to mention the selection of sauces and condiments is unrivaled by anywhere else we have ever been. Thanks for a great experience.

Probably one of the best hot pots I've ever been to! As soon as I walked in, I could smell the curry aroma and lately I've been loving curry. 

I went around 8pm on a Thursday and all the spots where the conveyor belts were taken so we were sat at the high bar. At first it was awkward because we were sitting with strangers but then it got comfortable after discussing what their favorites were

The service was exceptional. Our server explained to us the entire menu and his favorites which makes it easier for us to chose since we can be indecisive at times. 

I got the mushroom broth and ordered a variety of meats including the meat combo plate, cuttlefish balls and house meatballs. Enoki mushroom was delicious and the MUST HAVE game changer was the lamb skewer. I would go back and order 10 of those skewers. It was so juicy. And please do get the beef tongue - literally melts in your mouth. 

Also, in the center of the restaurant is a table with a bunch of different dipping sauces. Don't get the peanut butter sauce- it's definitely not like the peanut sauce you dip your spring rolls in. Do get the minced garlic and add that to your broth. 

The complimentary moon cake at the end was a nice touch.

The food is really good! And we do like our server Deni? I do like the tomato soup and I probably had 5 bowls of it.  My husband told me that you are crazy!   And we also like the beef tongue, normally we will make two orders of  it!  We do recommend it!  Me and my husband would definitely come back!

Great experience, food quality and service, further heightened by attentiveness of Deni, who was very patient and prompt with our questions, inquiries and service.  The set up is wonderful where you can be seated near conveyor belt or bar height table, all with individual hot broth cooking pot.  The noodle is quite a wonderful accompaniment, and one can really go to town with the sauce making section.  Perhaps the desert menu can be broadened a bit to satisfy those with sweet tooth finishing.  Great beer selection!

Friendly and super attentive staff. Lively  atmosphere.  Nice variety and selection of fresh ingredients, meats and sauces to choose from. The original soup base is tasty and not overpowering. The place gets packed so arrive early or make a reservation.

Best place so far for hot pot. The soup is great flavor and  all the meet is fresh. We have been looking for the hot pot place for awhile. We are so happy now this will be one more place added to my regular place list...

You know, I can't say that I hate Chubby Cattle but I also can't say that I love it either. It was very middle of the road for me. I'm not even sure I would recommend it to friends to try out. Meh. 

The food was good and everything but boy, your bill really adds up quickly and very sneakily. The restaurant is still quite busy so be prepared to wait if you come at peak dinner time or are just unlucky :P They have a conveyor belt options of items for hot pot or you can just order ala carte off the menu. From what I saw, most people order off the menu. A few people here and there would grab things from the belt, but not many. 

You first order your broth, I opted for the mushroom broth but also tried the house broth. Then you start ordering everything you want to cook in your broth. I will say that their menu is very very extensive. From veggies to dumplings to noodles to all slices and cuts of meat, there will be something to tickle your fancy!

Everything tasted fine and I will say the food quality is there but nothing blew me out of the water. There is also a walk-up make your own sauce bar to mix and match your own flavors to make a dipping sauce. 

Well to each their own on this one. I was left a little underwhelmed with a bigger hole in my wallet than I would think for hot pot.

One of the best places in Las Vegas to get some hot pot! They even have a happy hour for the revolving belt of meat, vegetables and noodles. 

There is a bar full of different sauces where you can make your own concoctions. I'd recommend asking for an egg and putting some sauces. Might sound weird but it's bomb!

You choose your own soup base. One dislike that I have about the spicy soup base is that here are too many red rectangle pepper things. I honestly don't know what it's called, but every time I tried to scoop out some meat, I got some of those things along with it too which was kind of annoying.

Servers were polite and our drinks were refilled. They have a TV where they had the game playing. Pretty nice modern interior decor. 

Parking can be hard to find in this plaza, but it has always been this way. When there's a will, there's a way. Usually I will find a parking spot even if it is super busy.

I love this place, food was amazingly good! We had 4 different kinds of soup base and the wagyu beef is so tender .... love the conveyor belt where we we get to pick up different kinds of add on's ! Our server James is the best!! Very friendly and polite... definitely will come back soon!

When I lived in the Northeast, I used to travel all the way to Montreal to find hot pot. Now that the weather is getting chilly in Vegas, I find myself in search of hot pot once more. Chubby Cattle is the newest hot pot restaurant in town. It's funny that it advertises itself as "Chinese fondue" and the interior decor is a little bit ridiculous, but whatever appeals to the masses. 

For those who have never tried hot pot, Chubby Cattle is a fun and interactive introduction. You start off by choosing a soup base. If you're sitting at one of the individual stoves, you can pick any broth except the Heaven and Hell, which is reserved to be shared between people on one of the larger burners. I stayed clear of the spicy broth and stuck with the House Original. Next, you choose an assortment of meats, vegetables, noodles, tofu, mushrooms, and whatever else you feel like putting in your hot pot. Otherwise, if you're sitting next to the conveyor belt, you pick whatever looks good that passes by.

For ingredients, the meats are high quality. I enjoyed the beef brisket, prime short rib, and lamb. The presentation of the mushrooms, vegetables, and noodles were aesthetically amazing. The mushrooms and vegetable combos look as if they had just been foraged from a farmer's market and come in a wooden basket. The arrangement of the assorted meatballs make it easy to cook by hooking it onto your pot without losing it into the abyss. There's also a sauce bar where you can mix and create your own dipping sauce. My personal preference was the fresh garlic, green onions, and white pepper in the ponzu sauce. 

Overall, dinner was fun and delicious. Everyone got a scoop of complimentary coffee ice cream. Our waiter was very nice and helpful and service was excellent. My one gripe about Chubby Cattle would be the cost for the amount of food we got. Everything was fresh and delicious, but we were pretty hungry even after a couple of rounds of meat and vegetable/mushroom baskets. It came out to be around $30 per person, which is on the expensive side considering it's hot pot (traditionally, a cheap homemade meal). Also Little Sheep (the franchise Mongolian hot pot) is all-you-can-eat for cheaper. If you're hungry and you eat a lot, you might want to look elsewhere.

I was super stoked when I heard about Chubby Cattle because 1) I love hotpot and 2) I love conveyor belts (come on, we are already cooking our own food, who is trying to do cardio walking up and down to the fridge while eating?! Am I right? Lol) 

Food: Chubby Cattle has a big menu with beautiful platted seafood and meat options. They also have noodles, vegetables, mushrooms, etc. on their menu. Their conveyor belt is also very impressive and I saw taro pieces to seafood to various greens. My brother and I ordered the tomato and seafood broth, and honestly I found them both very bland and flavorless. The seafood was very watered down and tasted like the seasoning from ramen packets (I read from other reviews that the mushroom and house special broths were also bland). The tomato broth was much better and probably the only broth I'll consider ordering if I come back. We also ordered the seafood platter, beef brisket (because my fave beef tongue was sold out), and vegetable noodles. The seafood consisted of muscles, scallops, shrimps, clams, and octopuses. Both the seafood and brisket dish were very fresh and did not seem frozen beforehand. 

Service: Mathew was our server and he was amazing. He answered all our questions, made suggestions, refilled our waters twice without us asking, cleaned up our table as soon as one of our plates were empty, and got our ice creams quickly. While all the servers seem stressed and all over the place, I found that our server kept his cool and smiled whenever he passed by. Thank you Mathew!

Overall: I'll definitely come back because the prices of the conveyor belt items were fair (ranging from .99 cents and up), the meat and seafood platters were great quality, and it was just a great experience to enjoy with family and friends. Hopefully they add more soup options or at least perfect their other ones because it sucks when the soup bases are so bland.

It's a pretty cool concept. Our server deni was really helpful because it was our first time. Don't order too much in the beginning because there's not a whole lot of space at the bar. 

They have the prices on the conveyer so it's a good guide!

I would def come back it's a cute atmosphere

Best hotpot in town!  The quality of their meat is much better and pricing is very reasonable. They have a sauce station for you to arrange for your liking. Menu has a great variety staffs are always friendly. I love both of their managers and do a great job making sure we always have a great meal.  You can also sign up to be part of their VIP program and get 50% off your soup base!
Come here at least once a month and it's the best chinese hot pot in Vegas. Very good value, especially if sticking to foods from the conveyor belt

From the time you walk in I was greeted with a menu and the option of a drink (while I was waiting for the other people in my group). This a great out of the norm experience for me and the food was good! Like I wouldn't have expected that when looking at soup! I like that everyone can choose what they want to eat and compare. Thanks again to the hostess and to James!!
Ordered 'mushroom soup' it just tasted like hot water. The first time I came here, it was nicer but the start of 2018.. they got worse.

Love love love this place. The broths are soooo flavorful and that's definitely different than all the hot pots I've been to before. I've told my friends about this place or brought them and Chubby Cattle has blown their minds!

This is our third time here and we always love it! Good service and quality. I like the idea of having your own pot and you can pick out your food from the conveyor belt. We had the original soup base and it had enough flavor. The beef is cut well and the balls are good.
Great service! We loved Mei! She's super kind and helpful! Great attitude as well! Please work on sauce though, it wasn't salty or flavorful enough. But loved the service. Would come back.
It was our first time at the Chubby Cattle. Great service by DENI! He was very attentive to all our dining needs. Will be back soon with friends and family. Thanks, Deni!

Incredibly unique dining experience with the conveyer belt & hot pot combination concept, delicious & Deni was super knowledgeable walking us through the menu! Great ambiance, music selection & staff. 

I had the fresh watermelon juice- perfect for ailing my hangover :) 

We both tried the house broth- light herbaceous and flavorful. 

We added the tiger shrimp, ribeye, veggie sampler, cuttlefish balls (I had to) & shiitake mushrooms. 

Everything we tried was fantastic. The veggie sampler was mostly lettuces, an incredible amount for two people and most were varieties I was unfamiliar with, but enjoyed greatly. 

We later grabbed crab stick & lotus from the conveyer belt as well. 

Loved it. Will definitely be making a stop back on our next trip!
my fav hot pot now 2nd time with family and definitely gonna bring some friends over soon

The food is good. But the service was not. There was also another thing that turned me off, it seemed like a lot of the locals were friends with the servers. Even though I was in line and put my name on a list, it seemed like they were a lot more attentive to their "friends" than to the person who has been waiting for a table for a while. So they got a table first and more attention from the waiters.

Sign clearly says happy hour after 9:30 Sunday thru Thursday for buy one get one free conveyor. Asked the waitress who ask some other guy who looked completely confused. Apparently he's the manager and he looked at the sign like he's never seen it before. So... The sign says it's happy hour but they don't have it? Good thing I asked before I sat down and ate. Bad thing I waited until 9:30 for the happy hour... False advertisement!

Been here twice and have had horrible experiences. On my first visit I sat by the conveyor belt. I would later find out that it was a bad decision. I like how they had lots of options and you choose what you want off of the conveyor belt, but there was barely any room for the plates on the table. The seats were squished together and my neighbor and I kept bumping each other which made it hard to be comfortable while eating. 

I love spicy food so I chose to go with the medium spicy soup base. Their medium was more like a 10/10 on a spicy scale. I was unable to enjoy anything because it was so spicy.
