The more the soup kept boiling, the spicier and more inedible everything became. I spent most of my time drinking water, and that's if the waiter even came around to fill my cup without me asking. 

I wanted to give it another try, so the second time around I asked for a table away from the conveyor belt and was planning to order a non-spicy soup base. I didn't make a reservation but the lady at the desk said it would take about 30 minutes. 30 minutes went by and the lady offered a conveyor belt seat. I explained that I'm willing to wait for a table because of the terrible experience I had last time. She said ok and said it should be a few minutes since they still had to clean a table that was just cleared. 15 minutes go by and the host says our table is ready. The waitress leads us to our "table" and to our luck she seats us by the conveyor belt. I tell the waitress that we specifically asked for a table and were waiting for a seat away from the conveyor belt because of our last experience, but she said that they can't seat us at a table because there was only 2 of us. 

After all that waiting they thought that we'd cave in and just settle for what we didn't want. No thanks! We simply walked out and had dinner elsewhere. Never coming back.

This place was amazing! My husband and I had the pleasure of being served by Kwan who was super helpful. He explained how everything works, gave us tips on sauce mixes and was ready to help us with any questions we had.   Serving sizes are perfect, atmosphere is energetic and the staff is extremely attentive. This place is now on my list of favorite places to eat in Las Vegas!

Chubby Cattle is the Bomb spot for Hot Pot. You know it's good when there's a line out the door. Celebrating my daughters Birthday, this is where she wanted to go. Second time here and it did not disappoint. Highly recommend plus our server Matthew was Awesome!

Interesting take on hot pot dining which ended up in unexpected pig out. I definitely felt chubby when I struggled to get up from the chair to leave. Good food and service made this experience a memorable one.

We sat at their bar tables with conveyor belt around which offers small hot pot items like mushroom, tofu and cabbage. I noticed that most people order with the servers and not picking off of the conveyor belt. It seemed more like a display. I hope those items are not spinning around for days and weeks. 

Simple concept. Choose your soup, sauce then meat/veggies. I got to try their original soup base and tomato soup but have to say tomato soup is a lot better. As for sauces, you can either order one off of menu ($2 each) or walk over to their sauce station and grab your own. If ordering a sauce, I recommend their original sauce. If are going to the sauce station, I recommend mixing the soy bean sauce with green onion and spoonful of garlic. More garlic the better. I overloaded mine with 2 spoonful of garlic and it was a bit excessive...ha

As for meat, I must say their beef tongue was off the hook. It was the perfect slice, not too thin nor thick. You are eating the meat shabu-shabu style so you don't feel heavy or bloated after eating, which can be good or bad. 

Skewers were good also. We got the lamb and beef. Lamb didn't have that strong gamy taste. Both were tender and not chewy at all. Servers couldn't tell the difference which was kind of funny. "I got lamb and beef here. I can't tell the difference but you will know once you eat it". 

Talking about service, you can tell they are new and trying hard. Our server constantly checked on us and gave some recommendation, though his face was way too close to my face (so close his facial hair brushed a few times on my cheek which made me flinch every time). Training should focus on menu knowledge as he didn't know what was included in the combo or the difference between certain items on the menu. 

Is it all a hype? Not really. Cool concept and good quality food served here. I can see myself coming back here again.

This is one of the best, highest quality hot pot restaurant I have been to in the States. Very high quality cuts of meats and seafood, and their prices reflect that too. They're also unique in that they've got raw dishes of food on a conveyer belt you can just take yourself and pay per plate, but we weren't seated next to the conveyor belt so can't comment on that experience. We just ordered full plates of food from the menu. Their hand made shrimp paste recommended by our waiter was out of this world good. Very bouncy texture. And surprisingly their service was very attentive, which isn't the norm for Asian restaurants in general.

A super fun place to dine with friends. The ordering can be a bit confusing but the staff was a great help. There are tons of selections, the veggies are all very fresh and the seafood was perfect. Next time we go we will sit at the conveyor table.
Very good shabu shabu in vegas. Washed everything down with a couple of beers. A-5 wagu

I really. Really. Wanted to like this place. 

Me and my party of two came here on a weekday about 2 hours before closing. The smell when you first walk in is very overwhelming, but not in a bad way. It's in a way where you get excited to eat! 

We were greeted by a very pleasant hostess. In all honesty, she is the only reason I am not giving them just a 1 star. 

After we explained that it was our first time here, our hostess was kind enough to explain how the menu worked. She went over the soup bases, meats, what was on the conveyor belt, and any additional side items. It was neither of ours first time going to a hot pot. But it was the first of this nature for both of us. And our hostess made ordering easy. 

The soup was tasteful and flavorful, while the brisket was my favorite menu item to order from. The conveyor belt idea is very creative and I'm glad to have experienced it. 

A reason for the negative stars is because we were both extremely dissatisfied with the service given to us by the other employees of this location, especially our waiter. We asked three times for a bowl for soup and rice (each time we ordered a new meat, we asked them about those two items) and we NEVER received EITHER of it. Not once did he check up on our table, but he did manage to find time to talk to his friend who so happened to visit. We were very upset that his friend ended up getting a bowl of rice, even though we ordered way before he was even seated. 

Overall, I wish again that I could like this place. But the (lack of) service that was shown to us really left a bad taste in our mouths. Maybe we caught our server on a bad day, or we just sat on the wrong side of the bar. Either way. We will not be returning.

I am so happy to have this hot pot place less than 10 minutes from my house. They're open only during dinner hours, but once they do open it gets packed! I was here and every table was full.

The meat is high quality and affordable for the quantity. They also have a great array of items to put into your hot pot! Everything from fish balls to pork blood.

However what really set this experience apart was the great service! I had Matthew as a server and he was extremely attentive. He would frequently check up on our table, and answered any of our questions. 

Highly recommend!

We tried the Chubby Cattle last night (our first night in Vegas) two of us had the original broth and one hellish hellfire pot.  We ordered the lamb/beef combo and a rib eye, a large udon and a large glass noodle plus a veggie combo. Grabbed a couple of items off the conveyor belt and got down to business. Delicious.  As we were leaving my party was already asking when can we go back.

Absolutely delicious!! Different, fun and yummy!
We arrived 15 minutes after opening (5:15pm). The place was pretty much all to ourselves! But it didn't take long for this place to start hopping!
We are currently in the keto diet so this was a great place for us. We ordered the hell out of some meat! Honestly my favorite was the chicken and thought least of their signature. My hubby ordered the original broth soup while I had the spicy. I am a huge spicy guru and they mild is pretty mild. If you're like me get the medium. Now he did explain that if it's not spicy enough he will fix it up for you. 
Upon entering they were right at our side explaining everything to us. There is high energy dance music playing which was pretty pleasant. The waiter was very good, attentive and fun. He let us know if we aren't making a mess then we aren't doing it right! 
They have a type of sauce buffet where you create your own sauces. That part was a lot of fun. A bit later I saw a long line to the sauce bar. I was very happy we had it all to ourselves when we enjoyed that part of our meal. The food is severed immediately. 
They have a conveyor belt with plenty of extras. 
We left stuffed! They asked if we would like desert but we couldn't eat another bite. 
The prices are amazing. We had everything we wanted and kept ordering and walked out paying $50 including tip. 
I highly recommend this place. It's fun, fresh and worth every dime.

I cannot comment on the quality of the food because we were never seated. My friends and I decided to get a nice meal in China Town last night and thought to check out Chubby Cattle because of its uniqueness, good reviews, and because I love Mongolian food and was dying to try the Mongolian pancake.

My friend arrived around 7:20 p.m. and put his name down for a table of four. The rest of us arrived a few minutes later. They told our friend it would be a 35-40 minute wait, and we were willing to wait for any table that opened (conveyor belt or not). A little before 8:00, I went in to double check the wait time for our table. This is when a series of customer service mistakes started.

First, the greeter pretended to not have our name written down. When I pointed it out, she said, "oh yeah, we won't be able to seat you until 9:00." which would have been about an hour and 40 minutes after our arrival. I asked her why she didn't inform us that the wait had changed because we didn't want to wait that long. She just got rude and combative and said that everyone else had reservations.

When I pointed out that other people who had arrived after us somehow jumped our name in line (my friend's name ended up being second from the bottom, despite people arriving after us) and asked if they had reservations she said no. At this point I was getting pretty upset and I asked why they were ahead of us and she just shrugged it off. Then she rudely handed me a business card and suggested that they were a reservations-only restaurant and that if we ever expected to get a table we should set a reservation. 

I was fuming at this point and after she argued with me for a few more minutes, I walked out to prevent myself from getting even more upset. We ended up walking over to Hachi, which is in the same strip mall, and the experience there was soooo much better. At Hachi, they apologized that we had to wait five minutes for a table and gave us menus to look at while keeping us updated about the process. 

I would never recommend going to Chubby Cattle based on their service. It seems that other people also have this problem, and I'm guessing it's a management issue that will not change. I understand that they are busy, and we were not upset about having to wait, especially on a Friday night, but we were outside and they had my friend's phone number so they could have easily informed us that our wait time had increased by over an hour. Hot pot restaurants are a dime a dozen here in Vegas, so we will definitely take our hot pot adventures somewhere else.
Im in love with tomato soup base... beef very fresh... chili soup base is good too... Best hot pot in town

This was our first time here and it was amazing!! Perfect place for a cold Vegas night. Our server Quinny took really good care of us and provided great recommendations when we were ordering our soup base and meats. She also helped us cook our fish noodles and shrimp balls and was very attentive. The house special soup was very flavorful and the meats were fresh. The conveyer belt idea is very creative and convenient. Lots of selections for toppings and veggies. The manager, Joyce is also extremely friendly and made sure we had a good experience. Food and service were both fantastic!  I highly recommend this place!

Really good food and great service. Lots of choices 
Great service from xiao xiao will be back for sure
....
Great food choices, healthy eating at its best. Server and service was great. She explained everything wonderfully. Definitely get the shrimp paste!

Mongolian hot pot! It's pretty good compared to little fat sheep. It doesn't beat it but it holds its own. Meat quality is good and they have a station for sauces. There is a rolling conveyer belt that has different side dishes you can choose to your liking. 

First pick your soup base. There were five different types and you can choose up to two simultaneously. Then pick your choice of meat. Beef, lamb, and seafood. There's the typical vegetable sides as well. What I liked was if each person pays $1 more you can get different types of noodles. Green tea, tomato, and purple yam (I liked this the most).

Our server was James. He was attentive but not overbearing. Perfect amount for a waiter. He took his time to explain to us how it works and gave us good suggestions. 

You should check with them for half off prices or by one get one free and for student discounts. 

All in all, would I come back? Yes.

This is one of the coolest restaurants I have ever been to. We sat in front of the conveyor belt and was picking items off to put in our oxtail broth. 
I usually hate going to restaurants where you have to work to eat but this place has customization down pack. 

The oxtail broth was super flavorful. All the ingredients we picked off the conveyor belt were fresh. We order a plate of beef with all types of variety. And they all were delish. 

They have a cool bar where you can make your own sauce. It also included kimchi and edamame.

We saw this place on Andrew Zimmerman's show and it was so worth it!!!
Xiao is our server and shes very kind , excellent food thank for the wonderful meal , best hot pot in town

My mom was able to babysit my son so that my husband and I could have a date night together. More like an uninterrupted dinner for me. I love hot pot and I was so excited to try out this new place. We sat where the belt was, and it was fun choosing the different plates that passed by. The beef was fresh and tender. I had the tomato soup, which I loved. Most of all, we really enjoyed the service from our waitress, Gia. She was very helpful in helping us choose the more popular items to order and she was very delightful and kind.

First off, let me say that I can understand why people like this place.  The service is very friendly if somewhat less attentive after the food has been served.  It is clean and hip.

However, this just wasn't for me.  The meats pretty much all tasted the same to me.  The majority of the flavor seems to come from the soup and so there wasn't any noticeable variety.  For the money I could have had an expertly cooked and seasoned steak.  The mushrooms actually were more interesting than the meat.

It is worth coming here and experiencing it but I can't say I'll be back.  Parking can be a pain here and it just wasn't a good value.  They are only open for dinner and reservations require you to have four people.

First off, when you first enter the restaurant it had kind of a weird smell from the raw seafood. You get used to it after a while. What's cool about this place is that you get to build your own soup. The restaurant has this conveyer belt style so that you can choose what you want in your soup. 
So my man and I never really go to a lot of shabu shabu style restaurants. We decided to try this place out. We were soooo confuse. Our hostess gave us this attitude like she was shock we didn't know how to do it. Lady, that's why we were asking how to do it. Luckily, our server Matthew was great. He explained to us how to do it. So we ordered the original soup base and a medium spicy soup base. Let me tell you, I can handle a lot of spicy food but man that medium spicy soup base was SPICY!! I literally was tearing up. I had our server change my soup base to original.  So if you decide to get that spicy soup base, beware. 
Okay the reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because our experience was not so good. We were confuse. They had charged me for the spicy soup base when I only had one bite of it. I changed it to original. Usually restaurants can accommodate  that for you esp. if they notice you were burning up and tearing. And I didn't like how that hostess was rude to us. Also, the oysters wasn't fresh. :/
I did like the broth but I didn't like how the aromatics they put in the broth made it hard to enjoy. I found myself trying to spit it out. I know they gave us the slotted spoon but still it was hard to enjoy.

It was great to have dinner
Pro: you can choose what you want
Cons: when the Belt was messing up working people know late.
My sever was deni
He was great service

If I come here too often, I'm going to become a chubby(-er) Chris.

In spite of the telltale location in the corner of the popular and very parking-deficient Spring Mountain Plaza (Jones near Spring Mountain, also home to Chada and District One and so on), it didn't register to me that Chubby Cattle was once home to HK Star and then Imperial One until I saw the latter's name on my receipt. I only knew it as this "Mongolian Hot Pot" place that was getting talked about on Yelp and in foodie circles - until I finally went on the night of what was actually considered a grand reopening of sorts.

I was able to join a group of Yelp buddies to try out this Chinese take on hot pot, which differs from the common Japanese shabu shabu locally and the Vietnamese hot pot that accounts for most of my experience in this type of cooking. We eventually got seated at tables with support for individual hot pot support. This allows everyone to have their own choice of broth and to eat at their own pace. I find it more equitable than potentially having one person cook for the time, and more reasonable than the somewhat frenzied rush that I've seen in situations with one huge shared pot. Plus, you can still exchange tastes of different broths with your tablemates if you're so inclined.

Oxtail Soup Base ($6.99): interestingly, everybody at my table wanted to try what appears to be a new option, rather than their established and loved options such as original, tomato, or mushroom. I couldn't say that that the oxtail broth bestowed really distinctive flavors like a tomato broth might have, but it definitely added meatiness and was properly seasoned, the latter of which is essential because it's the vehicle for cooking everything else.

Beef Combo ($18.99, 13 oz): brisket, ribeye, Japanese Wagyu. I was advised that it was hard to discern differences between the thinly-sliced meats while eating, but I definitely tasted the rich marbling and tenderness wagyu before I realized what I was enjoying, and the ribeye was also enjoyable. The brisket is definitely tender and flavorful enough on its own and would be a reasonable budget option. These all cooked up quickly in the hot pot, so I was really just submerging them for a few seconds before pulling them out with some pinkness still visible.

Hand-cut Texas Dorper Sheep ($7.99, 5 oz): like the beef, thinly sliced. Unlike the beef, gamey flavor - but not all that gamier than lamb, although it was a slightly different quality. I definitely enjoyed it and would urge lamb-lovers to give this a try.

Mixed Mushroom Basket ($12.99): literally a basket of all of their mushroom options. I'm not so much of a mushroom connoisseur, so I could've been just as happy (and not so light-walleted) if I'd only picked up an order of enoki, but they were at least useful for texture and flavored my broth to the point that it tasted like mushroom soup by the time I was done with all the cooking and only had a little broth left to sip.

Veggie Combo Platter ($12.99) - couldn't exactly tell you which items are in here, but there were a few different leaves and herbs that add nuance and texture to your hot pot. This and the Mixed Mushroom Basket are probably best enjoyed with a larger group.

Green Tea Noodle ($3.99) - I wouldn't say that I tasted green tea, which tends to be a subtle flavor anyway, but the noodles tasted quite fresh. It's quite a small portion though, so you may need to grab double if you're hoping for a lot of noodle all the way until meal's end.

There is a sauce station in the middle of the restaurant floor where you can mix sauces and fresh components (especially green onion and cilantro) to your palate's pleasure. I was a bit unfamiliar with this, so I tried to follow their simple recipes which they suggested as pairings for beef (ponzu, green onions, and a little chili oil) and lamb (sesame sauce, sacha sauce, chili sauce) respectively. The beef sauce was pretty good, but I couldn't locate the sacha sauce for the lamb accompaniment and wound up throwing in soy sauce instead. I found myself not using the sauces at all about halfway through the meal though, because the combination of meats and broth were really that good.

Another note on the cooking: you'll want to adjust down your heat (ask a server if you can't figure it out) or else the water in your broth base will boil off too quickly, Play around with it and have fun.

I'd probably put Chubby Cattle at about 4.5 stars, but it's rather tough to imagine significantly better hot pot. The meats were very enjoyable from start to finish, the veggies were fresh, and the value was reasonable. I'll have to branch out to more meats and maybe even locate a seat near the conveyor belts next time, although that seems like a bit of an unnecessary gimmick in light of my excellent meal.
Food was great and service even better. Deni and Alex we're both super helpful and made the meal even better.  Never had to ask for more water or napkins once.

Great spot for a cold winter night or any night.  Husband has a cold,  and the broth and music doing him good.  Kwan our host was a great guide through this new experience of hot pot dining.  A must try!

First off, let me start with our server Deni, very attentive and funny! Made our experience a lot more enjoyable. Food was delicious and fresh!. I do have a suggestion for the restaurant to have some guide on how to make basic sauces. But overall, can't go wrong with any of the meat and broth!

My girlfriend and I had been planning on coming here for about a month, and the perfect opportunity came up to double date with my best friend. I was not disappointed in the slightest - the food was great and the atmosphere was on point. Deni was our server, and he did a wonderful job making sure that we were able to enjoy our meal.
Great options for gluten free consumers. Most places don't have good sauces that are gluten free. This places has LOTS of options and it's delicious!

Service was veeeryyyyy mediocre. Though it is expected from an Asian restaurant, there are a lot of upcoming Asian restaurants that have more modern style serving, therefore a better service. We had a reservation and they sat us about 20 minutes past so that was kind of crappy, a lot of their sauces/ toppings in their little sauce section was empty, and our server didn't really understand that we were 3 different groups (2 couples and 1 guy) so a lot of our food was combined. Which we reiterated it wasn't supposed to be family style.

The food, however, was AMAZING. Left extremely full. The homemade noodles were really good, the broth was amazing and very flavorful, my bf and I added brisket and the meat combo. And I got quail eggs, mussels (which I would definitely skip) and mushroom. 

Altogether, I will be back. Just wish they cared a little more about their reservations, topping refills, and common sense with how we wanted everything split.
Second time here, the service and the food is wonderful. Our server "queeny" always making sure my water cup is full, yes

After a few days in Las Vegas, anything other than more casino food was a welcome idea.  A friend of mine had apparently been to this place, and when he described it as a hot pot joint where food comes out on a conveyor belt for you to choose as little or as much as you want to eat, it was a pretty easy decision for the rest of us to agree to try this place out ourselves.

Being a dirty tourist, I can't speak for the location other than the fact that it was roughly a 20 minute ride using an Uber to get there from the south end of the Strip.  We ended up in what appeared to be very Asian part of town based on the stores rapidly changing from English to various Chinese, Korean and Vietnamese names.  Eventually we arrived at our destination which was inside of a pretty packed and busy shopping plaza.

The interior of Chubby Cattle is very light, bright and welcoming.  Immediately upon entrance, you'll see the conveyor belt rolling adjacent to several booths, with lots of little plates containing various vegetables, dumplings, proteins and noodles.  We were lucky to not have a substantial wait, and were seated pretty quickly.  Service was quick, and gracious about explaining their process and pricing.

Basically, broth can be ordered individually or to share, and they come in a variety of spices and flavors.  Larger portions of meat can be ordered, raw, to which you will dunk them in boiling broth for a minute or so, before they can be eaten.  The conveyor belt has small portions of a wide variety of foods that are also cooked in the broth from anywhere from 2-4 minutes.  The color of the plates determine what each plate costs, and at the end of the meal, servers count and tally up all the plates at your table.

It's a pretty unique idea as far as I'm concerned, as the only place I'd ever encountered conveyor belts were sushi restaurants.  But the idea applies wonderfully to hot pot, and I have a lot of admiration for a place like Chubby Cattle at executing it in the way that they did.

Overall, I was very pleased with the dining experience, and I ate generously for roughly about $20 spent.  I had a wide variety of noodles, dumplings and lots of meat, and don't feel like I got shortchanged or cheated in any fashion.  Service was outstanding and friendly, and this is the kind of place that I'd tell my friends about, and actually want to come back to in future Vegas trips.

Made reservation day of through Yelp messages for 4 people at 6pm on a Saturday and they responded promptly. James was our server and he was super awesome, recommended us a lot of good choices, explained how the belt works, and made sure we didn't over order so we weren't bursting at the seams (still happened anyway). Food was delicious, everything was incredibly fresh. We were in town visiting family and even though it was 106 degrees outside, hot pot was amazing. Great selection of meats, veggies, fish balls, tofu, etc. Sauce bar had so many choices! Delicious! I can't wait to come back again when I visit. This compares really well to Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot in Northern California, except Chubby Cattle's sauce bar has way more options!

I ate the dragon seafood broth mixed with a little of the spicy broth. It's cool cause you can mix your own sauces and they have combos for the meats and noodles. And there is a conveyor belt for extra sides. Overall our meal was really good! Our server was Deni, and he was nice

Lets first say that the reason this place is getting decent reviews is they are either bribed (with ice cream apparently) or, they are getting stars for a gimmick - namely the conveyor belt.

If we talk about food quality, service, price this place gets demerits in all three:

Food Quality: 
I tried nearly every type of beef and lamb they had to offer - and frankly they were just ok. The sort of OK that you'd expect from an AYCE hot pot place, except this place isn't. In fact, if you travel two miles to the palms, there is an AYCE hot pot place that blows Chubby Cattle out of the water - the quality is good, and theres even more variety of vegetables and meats to choose from.

The broth, which is critically important in a hot pot place was just okay. So far, no one has lived up to the pretty mild standard of Little Sheep (I wish we had one of these in vegas!)

Service:
Service was pretty bad, but I did go opening week so perhaps they will work this out. Slow to check up when I was out of meat (which you can only get via ordering, because the conveyor belt only carries small items like little pots of veggies or small things like an oyster).

Price:
Way too expensive. I ended up leaving having spent around $80 for myself, trying all the items I wanted and actually was not that full. Each plate of meat costs like $10 (or so) and only comes with perhaps 5-10 thinly cut slices. I would've rather gone to any of the other hot pot places in town, namely the AYCE at the Palms or Yojie and would've had a much better meal for my money.



Long story short: This place is okay, but its overpriced. The service wasn't great, and you have tons of better alternatives: namely AYCE Hot Pot at the Palms which has better service, better food, better price, better options, or Yojie (which is more japanese style) but has significantly better quality.

We had a quality dinner here tonight with the parents. The wait time was shorter than expected (she said 20 mins but we were seated less than 10 mins). Our server Matthew was very nice and accommodating. One of the ladies (not sure if she was a server, hostess, or manager) took our order. She memorized it without writing it down and our order came out perfect. Definitely recommend.

Food is pretty good. Just a bit more than I want to pay since I have to cook stuff myself. 5$ for like 3oz. Of shiitake mushrooms is a bit much. We ended up spending $50 we could have had ayce kbbq or sushi. We barely had any food. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I didn't feel cramped and had more space to put my uncooked food. I space factor is want killed it for me. Once again they didn't have the chubby cattle special that they so greatly advertising on the tv all the time. I keep coming for that.

Try this place for the first time, like it overall, but table space is a little too tight, not enough table space, would also be nice to train server to teach how the heater control works since its in Chinese, but they don't seems to be willing to do that :( my American friend kept panicking about how to turn up or down the heater, if only the server can take time and explain it to us.....service also a little slow at times, we got the meat before our soup came, sign up for member ship to get half off on soup by leaving review on Yelp, will still come back though, good food, fun idea!
*they use melamine bowl, if you are paranoid about getting cancer, bring your own nice ceramic bowl from home (melamine bowl release chemical when in contact of high temperature food)

Great service great food!

The first time I was here, i was somewhat disappointed in their food. I thought it was really bland and their sauces did not go well with the kind of broth they offer. I was not really planning on coming back, but came back because a friend wanted to try it out. However, my second experience at Chubby Cattle was great. Igot house original broth both times I went, but this time the broth seemed more flavorful that I didnt even bother going to the sauce station. We got the beef and lamb combo. The meats were soft and tender as they should be. I wouldnt really recommend their lamb skewers since they were a little dry and tough, but I would definitely get beef skewers again when I go back next time. They were so tender and juicy. 

Also, we loved our server Kwan! He was very friendly and knew well about the menu :) Yay!

This place was amazing. Kwan our server was probably one of the best servers I've ever had. We had a table of four and he was extremely friendly and make sure we understood everything and told us what's the best way to get the most bang for our buck. He was always there when we needed it and was always smiling and friendly.  Food was fantastic. We had the lamb and beef combo and beef Combo. The meat was great quality and price was. It bad at all. You should definitely check it out. Make sure you ask for Kwan
food was so good!!! real fun place.. the soup has a lot of flavor. the conveyor belt is something different here in vegas. parking is a pain in the weekend.. price is also real good!!!

I'm going to simply join the Chorus of Yelp Reviews and give it my endorcement. Food is good and tasty, service is very prompt and polite, and I did not walk away hungry.

Since everyone else has already reviewed this place in detail, there's not much for me to add. 

However, I suggest going there Sunday thru Thursday, when there are 2 for 1 specials, and specials on the conveyer belt ingredients for your "hot pot" meals, but again beware; you need to be a Student with an ID Card, or in the ACTIVE Military. 

The only reason I "lowered them" to 3 Stars is they are a little pricey, and very stingy offering promotions. So, beware, this place will most probably cost more than a really good "all you can eat" sushi place. At least most Sushi places give you a "comp" meal after 10 purchases. 

Quality is very good, but don't go here looking for a Chinese food bargain. As I have warned, though it's good food, your wallet probably won't like the check.

Summary: Good: Everything about the food, staff, concept.  The slight bad: there's often a long wait, because it's a new restaurant and very popular.  Definitely worth a visit.

I've had a lot of shabu-shabu (Japanese style), but not as much of the Chinese style hot pot.  On a previous visit to this shopping center for a reservation at the Thai place (also great), we saw a long like outside Chubby Cattle, investigated, and discovered it had just opened.  Filed it away to try later.

A month later, still quite busy.  Showing up without reservations seems to mean a 30-40 minute wait (there are some good tea places nearby to wait for the call...); I don't know how hard it is to get reservations.

Well worth the wait.  Essentially, it is hot pot where you order meat from the waiter directly, and then use the conveyor for additional plates of vegetables, mushrooms, tofu, etc.  There is also a sauce bar to make custom excellent sauces (Thai fish sauce was my favorite.)

Quality of meat seems to be excellent -- tried the beef combination and beef/lamb combination, as well as the hand-cut angus special.  We also had skewers of grilled beef and lamb (also excellent.). Watermelon juice was a good accompaniment.

The staff were all very friendly and efficient.  Given that every seat in the restaurant was full, I was amazed how fast they were with food and drink requests.  Looking forward to going back.

Great place for Mongolian hotpot with a conveyor belt option. Pick and choose what you like to eat from the belt or order bigger sizes from your waiter. There's a generous sauce bar where you can make your own dipping sauce. The hot and spicy base (its spicy!!) and the tomato base are a must try! Will come back again and would definitely recommend 10/10!

This is shabu" restaurant & I love shabu". It was my first time. 
The host will sit you & the server will come to give the menu also asked have you ever been there. If you said no, they will explain how it work. 

The First thing to do choose your broth.. original, oxtail, tomato, spicy (3 levels) for individual pot also they have yin yang (1 pot for sharing with your party). 

If you eat meat or seafood, they have chicken, beef, pork, seafood. You can order combo beef ($19) for your party, I believed have 3 differents type of beef in one plate and with only $1 you can choose your noodle (they have 3 different flavor..original, green tea, taro).

They have a menu alacarte for raw meat & other food like pot sticker or cook lamb or rice bowl dishes but the fun part, they have a conveyor belt next to your table ( which I like).You can grab anything you want, they charge each small plate depands of the color's plate. In that conveyor belt have vegetables, shrimp, scallop, beef ball, oysters, different types of mushroom, shrimp ball (have a surprise inside, REALLY RECOMMENDED delicious), quil eggs. 

My friend like his tomato broth & I order spicy broth level 6. I like my broth but I wish they put all herbs like garlic, bay leaves and more other stuff in the pouch so it make us easy to grab out food because it is hard to find your food with a bunch of herb in the broth. Don't worry about getting not enough broth, they keep refill the broth for us.

They have buffet table style for your sauce to make your broth or dipping sauce like hot chili oil, sesame paste, green onion, minced garlic, cilantro, mushroom sauce ( HIGHLY RECCOMENDED!! You can mix with your rice) & other sauce also they have bachan like cucumber salad, beans sprout (kimchi flavor), edamame.
Oh BTW rice is separate, 99 cents each.

It is fun place to experience with a bunch of people & yes they have bar

Such a cool place seeing the conveyor belt~. The place can be pricy if you grab a lot of plates and the plates that are at a higher price, but it's worth it for the experience!  My friends recommend to get the Tomato or Mushroom broth.
It's our first time here, it really expresses me, the food is the best in Vegas, and the service is best. We will come back often.

See Deni for the best service! Menu is a little overwhelming, but the severs will walk you through it. Make sure you utilize the sauce station, as it really makes the meat personalized to your taste. 
 Oh and portions are pretty big, so make sure you order gradually.
Fantastic place for delicious hot pot!! Open late so it gives my coworkers and I time to eat after a long shift.  Highly recommended!!

There is a new game out there called "Chubby Cattle" where you stuff large amounts of meat into your mouth and say nothing... just chew, swallow, and let the serotonin do its job to your body. 

Setting: I have been here during its grand opening and have returned for its re-grand opening. The decor of the restaurant has been updated with an improved layout to the sauce station. Previously the sauce station was on what looked like a plastic wedding cake design now in a more buffet style, but is a bit cramp as many diners will be all over experimenting with sauces and other additions. The party area does boast individual hot pot stoves for large parties and a large stove in the middle for the larger broth option. 

Service: Pretty typical but it was a busy Saturday night, we seem to have three different servers tending to our tables. Drinks were a tad slow but nothing to lose yourself over. 

Food: The oxtail broth, new cuts of meat, add new items on the conveyor belt (chicken feet, enoki mushrooms wrapped in bacon). Being a big oxtail fan, I chose the oxtail broth which was... a bit bland. The sauce station helped play a nice role as I experimented with my broth by adding spicy, salty, bitter, sweet etc... till it matched exactly what I wanted. Wagyu was beautifully marbled with a nice chewy but not so melt in your mouth texture. 

Personal Choice: Tomato broth and the spicy broth are great! Brisket + Wagyu Beef + side of enoki + rice. Bam! 

Overall: One of my favorite places to eat hot pot. Great quality meat and savory flavorful broth, this place has it all!

We love this place.  It gets a little pricey if you don't monitor how many bowls you grab from the conveyor but it's fun and well worth it.  It's one of those places we take visitors from out of town to so we can show them a great off-street Vegas night. 

The service is also very good and the staff pleasant and helpful. We will be back to this restaurant many more times.

We have seen others post about this place on fb and decided to try it out.   Deni our server not only asked if this was our first time,  but also took the time to describe their menu and how the ordering process went.  We sat at the bar by the conveyer belt which was a bit cramped,  but we enjoyed the experience.   Servers were quick to clear out plates as we pulled them up.   Will definitely come back with a bigger party and out of town guests.

This restaurant is too deceptive, we have eight people to eat, we have $ 1000, a la carte when we do not tell us the price! We still live in Las Vegas, tourists come, is not more deceptive, I hope you do not come back to this restaurant

Not my cup of tea. I had the oxtail broth and found the broth to be flavorless. The veggie basket that had 5 different veggies were all leafy based. The meat quality was just okay. I had the combo platter so I tried three different meats. Overall dinner was not satisfying.
Great fresh food, great experience! Deni was our waiter. He was very nice and informative. Cant wait to come back!

Got lucky and got seats here when we came in. It was pretty busy and full when we got here. We chose to do the individual pot for each person. My cousins got the spicy broth and the other one got the mushroom broth. I got the plain broth. I really liked the mushroom broth, probably will get that next time. We shared an order of the beef and lamb combo meat. Then the rest we just picked from the conveyor belt. It's such a cute place and it was pretty cheap for three people since we shared. I would go back here again for sure.

Delicious food and different than most hot pot places I've been to. I really liked that most of the add ons were on the conveyer belt, made it convenient so we didn't have to constantly order. We also had the lobster special which was absolutely wonderful with a good garlic flavor. Xiao Xiao was our server and she was great! Always made sure we had everything we needed and constantly was checking up on us. Will definitely come back.

Brandon was super helpful at the bar. He accommodated us, as a bartender, while we waited for our table. The food was served fast and the servers were extremely helpful. I would recommend for anyone who loves hot pot!

First time at Chubby Cattle was great!

SERVICE
Our server XiaoXiao was polite, fast and came to check on us throughout our meal. I felt like we were pretty needy customers, so to accommodate our hangry demands with a smile and as quickly as she did, 5 stars for XiaoXiao! Our waters, soups and bellys were never empty =) we were also seated in a timely manner, although it was very busy. 


FOOD
$7 Two soups 
$5 Vegetable noodles
$6 Grilled oysters (2)
$6 Beef brisket
$6 Homemade Cuttlefish Balls
$1 Steamed Rice
$2 Yellow Plate Conveyor Belt Item (3)
Total bill for two: $42.06
The food was healthy, delicious and my favorite part was the sauce bar. The sauce bar is a delectable self-serve counter where you can choose from several sauces, including black bean sauce, fried garlic, house sauce, sesame oil, peanut sauce, etc. You can choose to dip, mix and eat your food with any number of sauces. Awesome, right? The food on the conveyor belt was fresh and didn't smell, due to the high turnover rate of customers. I enjoyed my meal and so did my boyfriend. 

ATMOSPHERE
The music and ambiance of the restaurant was fun. Great for groups, dates and families. Very clean and interactive. 

Overall, I'm glad that the conveyor belt culture has come to Vegas. Will come back again =)
Love this place!!! So delicious and fresh and the sauces are so good. And Matt is really nice too
Had a lot of fun here! Deni was very helpful since it was our first time at this place. Most importantly the soups are fantastic!

Find me here Sundays through Thursday at 9:30 for happy hour- BOGO on all conveyor belt items. Such a great deal.
First, choose a broth for your personal hotpot. I'd recommend the heavenly tomato broth. It is SO GOOD, I don't even have to use sauce. Get it if you like Tom yum soup. Order the handmade noodles of your choice and a small amount of veggies for an extra dollar. Order any meats you'd like. Remember the portions are pretty filling! 
Then keep an eye out for your faves on the conveyor belt, which are veggies, noodles, some seafood, and tofus. The color of the place tells you how much each one costs. So many options. So little stomach room. 
There is a sauce bar toward the front of the restaurant - add whatever you'd like to the sesame sauce base. 
Oh, and Chubby cattle also has a bar! 
The only thing is that this place gets busy, so it's hard to track someone down for refills.
Good quality and service, sit where the belt is to help yourself best deal around for hotpot.

This is one of the best hot pot places in Las Vegas. I ordered oxtail soup base and my boyfriend got the mushroom base. After that we ordered proteins and veggies. We tried Beef Wagyu- this was very delicious but I didn't get to enjoy it much because once you cook it in the pot it shrinks very small ... so there's not much to eat. Beef brisket- this was good and was a stomach filler. The Quail eggs is our favorite. (Meatballs, land, fish etc). The broth soup is even better towards the end when all the proteins and veggies had simmered together giving a tasty result. 

They also have a conveyor belt with food  over the counter that you can select from - and a self serve sauce area. Service was quick. Quality of food was phenomenal. 

Check this place out if you're visiting Las Vegas and tired of eating on the strip. Located in asian Plaza. 
The only downside is crowded parking.

Really good hot pot. I had the tomato broth really flavorful. The steak wrapped enoki mushrooms were amazing.  The dishes that go around have a good variety and the prices are clearly labeled.

It's not cheap for a hot pot if you do a variety of items but it was well worth it. 

I did the beef, some dumplings two different kinds of mushrooms and I loved it all.

My first time here and it was amazing! Deni was our server and he was great recommending items to us. Deni made our experience even better. He recommended us the seafood combination and we loved it. The coconut Mojito is a must as well! Everything was delicious! Very pleasant atmosphere and great service! Definitely coming back !
Was really adventurous to come here, super great service and experience. Was guided by the staff on how this worked, overall a place to try. Something new to do.

I really liked this establishment! It can be a bit pricey but that's expected from a hot pot restaurant! The decor is cute and service was okay. Only downside was that the hostess didn't acknowledge us at all when we walked in. We stood there for a good 5 mins with no one attending to us and we were literally in front of the hostess all she did was stare at us occasionally, it wasn't even busy at the restaurant at all so that was a bit of a bad first impression.
the price is reasonable. And it really tastes good??especially the spicy pot??it s really deserve to try??Oh BTW thx for James' service.

Deni was a wonderful server.  Constantly making sure we had everything we needed.  We went as a group and shared the rib eye, the sea food, the lobster, the noodles, etc.  Everyone chose their broth and cooked their meal to their liking.  The sauces were numerous and you can create your own concoction.

First time here for a date night out with my husband and what a fun and delicious experience from beginning to end! Xiao Xiao was a delight, very attentive and hospitable the entire time. We will definitely be back and with friends! We love soup and this hot spot...hit the spot!

My very first hot pot experience!

I came with extremely high expectations. Their rating on yelp is baller and a couple of my coworkers have raved about how amazing this place is.

Pros:
- Huge menu! Overwhelming but always great to have a variety of options 
- Conveyer belt of goodies which are constantly cycling. Veggies, meats, egg - you name it! There's a sign with the prices per colored plate and you can grab what you want off the conveyer belt at any time. Whatever you take will be added to the bill at the end of your meal, kind of similar to the dim sum concept
- Individual hot pots available so you can choose your own broth and place whatever you like in it. The group I dined with opted for this instead of sharing one large hot pot in the middle. I was with 5 others which made this a better option - if there were 3 of us total I wouldn't have minded sharing 1 large hot pot
- Love the self serve station with spices, sauces, and pickled sides - so you can make a concoction to your liking to either add into your hot pot or use as a dipping sauce for cooked meat/veggies
- Servers come by to refill your hot pot! If you're running low on broth, just request for more! 

Cons
- Service was slow. All the protein and veggies came out slowly in a random sequence that didn't make sense. We didn't receive our mushroom basket until the very end of our meal, which would have been nice to have had cooking in our hot pots earlier during our meal 
- Small portions (but very reasonably priced!) Make sure to order an abundance of any proteins if you're sharing, they go fast 

Overall this was a fun, new experience as I've never been to a hot pot restaurant before. I love soup, meat, and veggies... so this place is right up my alley! I will definitely be coming back to Chubby Cattle!

My friend is a hot pot fanatic so I did quite a bit of searching on yelp to find a good spot to have dinner for the both of us. The food and experience here was enjoyable. Service was nice. The conveyer belt is a great idea since I prefer only eating certain sides, I can pick and choose however I please. Their sauce bar had hot cheetos, which was a plus for me. I thought it was very sincere of our waitress to warn my friend that the spiciest broth was very strong. However, don't doubt my friend, she'll drop 10 more hot drops if she has to. When the broth came out, it wasn't spicy enough for her so she was disappointed with the hype. She liked the flavor nonetheless. The only thing that made her lose her appetite was the sour peppers she kept biting into in the broth. She recommends the kitchen puts the spices in a spice bag. 
If there is one thing that irked me about this place was that I did my research online before I came and the price for the Kobe was $25.99 for a 3 oz, $49.99 for a 6oz. The 3 oz was what we ordered. It was the only meat that doesn't state the price on the actual menu which seemed kind of sketch because it seems like they could just decide however much it could be at that point. I was too trustworthy. They charged me $50 for this and when I asked, they said the 3oz was for $50 and the 6 oz was for $100. I felt cheated and super annoyed. I probably should have brought up their menu online to confront them about it. I didn't want to ruin my experience here though by bringing up conflicts considering it was my friend's and my first time here and we did like it a lot... except for the sketchiness. Next time if I decide to come here, assuming I'll get over this situation, I'll ask for their prices first before I order.
Dream of this place every time I get hungry! All about the spicy hot pot. Just wish it was open later
Great food... good service... food is delicious... great atmosphere.... i def left feeling like a chubby cattle my self lol

We're here nearly every week now!   This place is so delicious!   I like the medium spicy soup base (spice level #12).  My sister loves the mild Mushroom soup base.   There's something for everyone at Chubby Cattle since you grab whatever you want to eat as it goes by.   I recommend the Beef Combo platter to kick things off.   It's always our first dish. 

Thank you so much Silvia and Mathew!!
Our server was very nice and we were seated immediately.  I like the conveyor going around you and son was very entertained by this.  I also like the idea of having our own pot to cook
I think this is one of the best hot pot spot in town. The original broth is so soothing and very tasty. The meat quality and also the veggies were great. If craving hot pot, this is the spot.

I want to tell you all--the food was delicious. I ordered the tomato base and my bf got the house special, we liked the tomato soup more. From the moment you walk in it stinks in a good way. Like a yummy savory smell very appetizing. The conveyor belt was a cool way to try different foods like revolving sushi except for soup sides. Also, we had Kwan as a server and he was really great!! Best service ever!

Overall, 
Food: 10/10
Service: 11/10
Wait times: 8.5/10
Overall experience: 11/10

We got the original hot pot with beef combos and veggie combo. We added some sides from the revolver. And there was self serve sauce bar which is great. Everything was really good!! I'd come back again.

My husband and I have never had hot pot style dining before, this was an interesting experience! The waiter was very knowledgeable and patient while he explained everything to us. We will definitely be going back, but the only thing I see that could be improved would be to label the dishes in the conveyor belt. Most of the stuff was not labeled and we had no idea what it was so we didn't try it. The broth was delicious, and the meat was very fresh and tender.  We loved the concept - so fun!!

I really wanted to love this place so bad, but afterwards just felt kinda meh about it. Don't get me wrong the concept is great and there's nothing else like it in Vegas so I definitely recommend giving at least one try, but I don't think I'd come back.  

About 5 of my friends came on a Thursday for dinner. We had made a reservation so had no problems with getting a table. The server was very good with welcoming us and giving a brief explanation of everything, but during our meal she wasn't super attentive with clearing plates or refilling our drinks. Maybe they're just overwhelmed by still being a new restaurant, but it definitely effected my overall experience.

Food wise it wasn't bad, but I honestly prefer doing hot pot at home better. I do love that they have tons of sides and meat choices and that you can get your own individual pot. As a group we definitely ordered too much food so I recommend starting with a few items and ordering as you go. For the broth I went with the spicy entry level. I personally did not really care for it. My boyfriend had the mushroom which I tried and thought was much better. I did enjoy the concept of being able to mix your own sauces, but wish they had some type of guidelines of what to mix or just some basics. 

Overall I'm glad I tried this place out and think it's still a great one time thing, but I'd rather do my own hot pot at home.
Great food, all of the meat items are really fresh. Dani the waiter was very helpful and help us on make our selection on our first time

I met this restaurant while traveling to Las Vegas from Shanghai, I would high recommend if you wanted to try traditional Chinese hotpot, it is yummy and even beyond my expectation. Thanks Deni for hosting, it is very kind of you.
Such a cute design inside, rather pricey however. Would love to come back to try out more of the menu, but a bit overpriced in my opinion.

This place is not my cup of tea. Quality of the meats are low. I ordered a Wagyu plate and beef tongue. My Wagyu is fake, you can totally tell by the looks of the Marbling. I don't think I got the real deal. I had Wagyu enough times at a Japanese Shabu restaurant to know what's real. I don't think I'll ever purchase Wagyu from a Chinese hotpot restaurant anymore.

Our server wasn't very attentive either, and kept wanting us to order from the revolving belt. They are smaller plates, and not worth the money. The only thing I love was my broth, and my mushroom basket. Not to mention I had to wait for about an hour for 5 individual pots. I understand they get busy, but it's not worth of my time.

I've never done hot pot before so this was kind of *confusing* for me (and next time I'm definitely bringing a friend who knows what they're doing)
The food is really good even though I'm not sure if I cooked it correctly. The staff and service is excellent!
The menu is huge and they have a ton of choices, I'll definitely be back once I figure out what I'm doing.

Deni very kind and very good service 
And he always come to our table ask for service
The food is very fresh and good
Nice music and very clean

We found this new hot pot place to try. Grand opening sign was still on the floor in front of the restaurant. We went inside and waited to be seated. Wait for a while then this hostess asked how many people. I told her two. She said "There is no seat for two and silence. She looked at us and then silence. But we were confused because there were empty seats still available." I guess two people cannot assigned at four people table size. I felt sad for the owner. Good luck with your business. If you plan to go to this place, make sure you have more than two people because there is no seat for two. Terrible service!!!

I loved the concept of this new restaurant. You have the option to pick from 5 different broth choices. From there you can pick your vegetables, and your meat. If you sit next to the conveyer belt you have to option to pick any of the items you would like just at your reach. They also have a great selection of sauces, so if you feel a bit adventurous you can mix them and create your own. They had several meat and seafood packages which allowed us to try some of their most popular meats. I had a great time picking and creating my own soup. However, the service was just terrible. It was almost impossible to get out waters refilled. On top of that we ordered a side dish with our server and he never delivered it. We even reminded him twice and no luck. Thankfully this restaurant had an excellent manager. Joyce was very friendly and tried to accommodate us and help out as much as possible! So I was torn I couldn't give this restaurant a higher rating, but without their manager our overall experience would have been below expectations.

Very good balance between price, service and food.
generous portions, kind and continuous service, clean.

I liked the sauce bar and the hotpot, which tasted excellent.
Certainly, a place to repeat.

Matthew was our guide and he made us feel comfortable with assembling our custom pots.  We had a great time watching the conveyor going around and mixing our own sauces.  Looking forward to returning.

First time coming to a hot pot place with a conveyer belt. The meat quality was great and the soup is pretty standard for Mongolian hot pot. We also had the lobster for 15.99 and the seafood platter. These are both recommended. We would definitely come back again whenever we hit up Vegas.
For first timers, they recommend a platter and grab and go from the conveyer belt! It's overall a great experience and the food is good! Denny is a great server!

This is my second time doing a converyor belt syle setting, but not my first hotpot meal. First impression: sleek, clean, inviting, and modern. The decor is beautiful and the place is well ventilated and bright. There is plenty of seating and I was seated promptly.

Our service was spectacular. This being kind of my first time, our server James was very patient and friendly when taking my questions. He explained the process and the food items, and took the time to wipe the glass of the conveyor belt line which condenses up pretty quickly. He checked up on us frequently and made sure our water was always topped off.

We had a large table for the two of us. We got a split pot, half mushroom soup base and the other their "Heaven and Hell" spicy base at mid level heat (it was too hot for me!) We enjoyed the brisket, beef tongue, and angus beef. All were delectable, especially the hand cut angus steeped in the Heave and Hell. We turned to the conveyor belt at our side for our add ons and everything was great and reasonably priced.

Tl:dr great times and I posted to share the experience and get half off my soup base...which I should get next time since I am in the loyalty program now. Woot!
I love sitting at the bar where you can just pick items to put in you hot pot. Tomato hot pot is so amazing. Ask for some Nappa cabbage when ordering, fantastic in the hot pot.
Best hot pot place in Las Vegas !!!! Nice customer service from Gilbert , love this place !!

I have never been to a place that have conveyor belts, I've seen them in California but never had the chance to actually sit down and pick what I like! but anyways, you pretty much cook everything yourself and pick out what you like, the plates in the conveyor belt are all random and are priced by the color plates such as a white plate would be $1 or a blue would be $2.49. Plus if you come at 9:00pm it's happy hour so it's buy one get one free!!! (By color plates though) Over all I just loved the experience, I was definitely sweating at one point but coming here in the winter would be a great idea!

The service and food was great.  Our waiter went through the menu and patiently explained how it all works.  He even named some of the veggies that had no name for us too.  The manager checked on us as well and she made sure we were taken care of.  The meat combo filled us up and the quality was great.  We enjoyed the fish balls (cuttlefish and the one with an orange sauce inside).  The original and spicy broth was a hit! You definitely smell like the broth though when you leave lol

One of my favorite hotpot places ever. We loved the individual pots. Try the lamb, meat combo and handmade noodles. Deni, our server was super helpful and explained everything well. We would definitely uber here to eat off the strip again.

Fun take on two great things, hot pot and the conveyor type meals!!!  They have quite the selection of soup bases and we tried three types of the soup bases.  The original, quite healthy and traditional tasting.  The tomato base, very flavorful but definitely for the tomato lover.  The mushroom base, is very healthy tasting too.  The quality of vegetables, meat, and seafood is very fresh!  The mix is constantly changing according to the staff and chef, you can definitely tell there is a lot of local and seasonal flavors.

Mathew, our server, provided great service with a smile and was very friendly!  

Really fun place, you can do individual style hot pot or community/family style.  Small groups to a large groups, this is a great spot to go!  We'll be back again!

We've tried hot pot before and didn't know what we were doing. The staff at Chubby Cattle was very helpful and assisted us in making our selections. The food was great. We are looking forward to coming back and being even more adventurous. Great job Xiao Xiao!

Love this place ! They have specials monday thru Thursday & happy hour late nights everyday. Their beef selections are good and they taste like great quality 

The staff (for the most part) are nice. Very attentive for most of the servers. 

Get the beef combo and pair it up with a glass of watermelon juice. (Yum!) Also, you get to make your own sauce

Delicious! 
This is such a fun experience. The food is great, the service is amazing and the atmosphere is awesome!! 
All of the soup bases are great, but medium is as hot as you want to go.  The sauce bar is super fun and the conveyer belt is crazy awesome. 
If you have friends in from out of town this is THE place to come. Love it!!
After eating here yesterday I was setting on the toilet all night long...... there mush be something wrong, maybe I'm wrong but I won't come back again.
So good! And affordable, I went during happy hour and the plates were buy 1 get 1 free. I didn't have to wait long, was seated almost immediately. I wish there was more locations

I'm big fan of hotpot , I got used to eat good hotpot but when I moved to Vegas no good hotpot and I missed it so much finally accidentally I saw it on the social media and I took a tried it was so good and I loved it , if you like hotpot this is the one .

The BEST thing about this restaurant is their service. The food on the conveyor belt is great too, but the service makes it so much more enjoyable. Everyone is super friendly and helpful. Don't know what you are doing? No problem...just ask. Definitely coming back with friends and family. There's a good variety of foods that will suit everyone's taste.

Very helpful extremely friendly. Help me select...very easy since they speak very good english.  Fresh healthy and good for your soul...James was excellent...will be back to experiment more...try the small sausages...

Hot pot joint in Vegas, brisket all day and beef combo. Make your own sauce, I would suggest going with the fried fresh garlic, ponzu, and chili sauce. For the broth, opt for the yin yang and get the tomato and entry level spicy!

Great place to eat hot pot. Food was great. Come early or reserve because this place gets packed. Great service from Deni.

One thing, they don't fully cater to children who need boosters or high chairs because of fire hazard law. We made do with the situation and glad we did. This place is great.

I don't don't rave review really but what the experience I received is worth doing so.

I've been to many high-end restaurants thanks to business dinners that I get to attend when the my boss take our clients out ever so often.  The reason I bring this up is because the service I received here at Chubby Cattle was no less if not superior than what I get from restaurants that cost 5 times more money (I'm thinking even better than Mastro's in Costa Mesa which cost us $250/person last time we went).  Those expensive restaurant already come with service at professional level, but Chubby Cattle really blew me away with their super attentive and friendly service.

Our server Kwan was, well, the best I've seen especially for someone that young.  Kwan and his colleague James really made sure we felt well taken care of with every need we had in the restaurant.  As a family of 4 (2 kids, 1 = 2 years old and the other 4 1/2 years old), it's not easy to find every accommodations we need in places that we eat dinner at.  We normally don't go to hot pot places because it's potential disaster for the kids.  Chubby Cattle's hot pot sits below table surface so it looked safer than usual Chinese hot pot places so we decided to give it a shot.  At this restaurant we really felt like we were constantly checked on and they did everything they could to make our experience there at the best possible.  Manager Joyce even stop by at least 6 times to make sure we are well taken care of (and even brought carved turkey over later to make sure we got some!).

Now on to the food:

We got a split hot pot with tomato base on one for kids and wife, spicy on the other for myself.  The soup base is decent and about the only thing I wish for is the spicy level can be increased to even hotter/spicier!  I had the level 6 to begin with, then upgrade to level 12, then level 18, then asked to have more spicy chili paste (that's used to increase spiciness) until I feel bad doing so.  Note that the price between different spicy level is different for the soup base so expect to pay more for more spicy version.  If you can tolerate a LOT of Tabasco on your food or can eat Sriracha like it was nothing, I suggest you go directly to level 18.  This way you get what you want right away. 

My favorite: the beef brisket slices, it's best I've seen in Chinese hot pot restaurant in term of quality & portion.  The pork blood (I know it's not everyone's thingy...) was good too, as well as the seafood platter and shrimp paste for making shrimp meat ball.

We had a bunch of other things but the only other item I recall was the combo sliced beef plate.  There are 3 types of beef on it including the brisket mentioned above, I liked the 2nd one on it too the 3rd one was cut in a way that it basically crumbled and felt apart when you try to cool it in the hot pot (sorry I can't recall what the 2nd and 3rd ones were).

Self-served sauce table was complete with enough different options to cover different needs.

I hope this helps anyone who's planning on visiting the restaurant.  I will definitely be back whenever I'm in town.
This place is great! I really like the conveyer belt idea and the food tastes good as well. I've been here a few times already and can't wait to come back once again.
First time An love it .. super cute inside everyone is so helpful An sweet the options are endless !!!! Edename is super yummy

Chubby Cattle is a neat hot pot restaurant! It's so cool that they have a conveyer belt. I've only seen conveyer belts at sushi restaurants. The conveyer belt is convenient for those sitting at the booths and bar to grab anything. You can also order anything on the menu if it isn't on the conveyer belt, like meats. There is a sauce bar and they also provide recipes to compliment the meats. There's a bunch of different broths you can get, but they are known for their bone marrow broth. My favorite is the mushroom assortment! I usually get noodles, tofu, and a bunch of beef brisket. Especially with the enoki mushrooms. There's just a lot of different things you can order but you will not be disappointed. If it's your first time, they will gladly explain how it works too!

This was my 2nd time here. If you are planning to dine here,  come a little earlier as its a challenge to look for parking space.

The interior changed a bit compared to when they first opened. It's still packed from the 1st time I was here. We sat by the counter and we had individual burners for our own hotpot. There were 3 selections for broths and a variety of meats, seafood to order. The rest of meats, seafood, vegetables are on a conveyor belt which was amazing idea. It's hard to figure out sometimes what you want unless you see it. 

They had a buffet for sauces, create your own. When we were there they ran out of bowls to make your own sauce and had to wait until they bring more. 

This is best comfort food for cold weather.

first time here and had a great time!!
Food is super delicious service is on point.
Ask for Deni He's great!

The service and cleanliness were impeccable. Our server DENI!!!!! He's amazing! The quality of the meat was outstanding. They have a variety of sides dishes that compliment each flavor. Definitely recommend this place!

The meats are good, very nice presentation. The broth is solid. You get individual pots, so no need to share and it's close to you. A good selection of different hot pot things to choose from. The parking could get a bit full in this plaza, may need a little patience to find a spot.

Love this place! A friend brought me soup one day and now I'm hooked. The broth selections are delicious. I had the oxtail broth by the end of the meal as full as I was I just couldn't put my spoon down. Everything was fresh off the conveyor belt and I love happy hour but one get one free. Who doesn't love a great deal.

I've traveled to China quite a bit and I love hot pot. My wife's never had it and we saw this place on the Zimmern list so we really wanted to give it a try while out here on vacation.
The place is way off the strip which is great in my opinion, get away from the overpriced Vegas BS.
We were not disappointed.
Excellent service and they were very helpful in picking the soup/broth base
We got the Yong yang with hellish hot and a milder house original.
I can handle pretty hot and spicy so I got the medium, it's not that hot but of course everyone's opinion of hot is different. It definitely has some heat and a great flavor.
We ordered the beef combo and seafood combo along with assorted mushrooms bok choy and cabbage.
Everything was fresh and really happy with our order.
The house hot tea was also amazing.
They have a spice / dipping sauce bar that is pretty well stocked and is a wonderful compliment to you cooked items.
We were here on a Monday evening and got right in without a reservation. You should call ahead though just in case as it filled up right after we arrived
Highly recommend Chubby Cattle!

One of the new places to try an amazing hot pot. The fact that they open from 5 pm-12 am is actually a plus, since it means that everyone in the kitchen is not haggard and the meats are all fresh. The service is acceptable, still a little rough I guess. Just a few things, my mushroom soup base, which my mom also ordered took about 15 mins after everyone in our table start eating. So they were almost done while my soup barely makes bubble. Our server didn't explain on how things are done in their establishment. For example, the conveyor belt, how to turn on the individual stoves and also what is in the menu, or ask at least if this is our first time or are we a returning customer. It would've made the experience a little more better. Also, the bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms of my boy friend ordered when our server was pitching the daily specials at the start of the meal arrived at the end of the meal, with the enoki burnt and the bacon not all the way cook. And this man, eats a lot of bacon. Daily specials, unless you actually have to harvest or kill a live animal should be part as the appetizer experience, to tease the taste buds on the next gastronomical adventure that would follow, not present it when the person is full and almost done with their meal.
All in all, it was an experience, I can't really say if it's good or bad and I do understand that they have a little bit more refinement to do. The soups though were perfection, yes they are bland at first but that's what the condiment/sauce/spice bar in the middle of the restaurant is for, to create your own flavors and make the experience and your imagination tingle for a little while. I will be back and I do hope the next time, I could say it is beyond 5 stars.

It was our first time in this restaurant and we loved it. Our waiter Deni was amazing and made it very easy for us to understand the concept of eating there. Everything was delicious and absolutely top quality! We are definitely will be back soon!

This place is a solid 4 stars with the food and experience. But the service was perfect. We had Matthew as our server and he was always there when we needed something and he answered all of our questions. 

It was our first time here so we had many questions... now that we know what we like, I am sure we will love it next time. 

I ordered the 
Mushroom Broth
Thick Noodles 
Beef Brisket
Super good!!

Added shrimp, spam, dumplings with a few other mix ins. We really enjoyed making our own sauce! I put the exact amount of everything that I like in it. Perfect for the hot pot base.

Our server Kwan was great! Our experience here was wonderful. Food is awesome! Our bill came out to $43 between 2 ppl and I would say that is pretty good considering how much meat and sides we ordered. Definitely will be back.

Get their tomato soup base. It's bomb!!!
Conveyor belt is the way to go if it's just a few people. Yelp check ins are a bonus too

Honestly, this place is good but it's way overpriced for hot pot. The bill for two ran over $70 and we didn't order much! The waiter was pretty aggressive assisting we order the combos. The seafood combo was a rip off with 5 shrimps, 5 tiny clams, 4 mussels, 4 small scallops, and two tiny octopus....see I remember because it's not much food!  We just want to check it out since it's new and we won't be coming back....

I have only started going to this place about 2-3 months ago, and it is now one of my favorite hot pot places in town! The meats are always fresh, and the portion size does not disappoint. However, what I truly love is their broths. I definitely would recommend their oxtail broth. It's very savory, and it adds a unique taste to the meats they provide. Deni is one of our regular server, and he's beyond amazing. He's very attentive, and caters to all of your needs! I'll definitely be coming back again very soon!
Pretty good this time around. The beef and lamb combo 2x will fill you up. Kwan is a great server and will assist in you in getting a satisfying meal.

Been here 3 or 4x times now.  It's my favorite Hotpot place in Vegas.  I love the concept. The presentation is just like the Hotpot places I visited in China with a slightly more modern vibe lol. 
Prices are reasonable and vary depending on your individual appetite. 
My favorite broth is the original broth, and next the Mushroom.  tomato is a little too sweet for my taste.
For meat, I recommend the beef platter and some lamb shank :)
So good! Get the pork dumplings! Yum! They don't have their liquor license yet, but you can BYOB. I loved the spicy soup base and was pleasantly surprised that they had lotus root. Matthew was great!

First time having hot pot and the server Angela made it easy as can be! I definitely made a few mistakes, but staff was kind and helpful :) 

I'd come back for sure!

I would give ZERO star, if I can. The sever was too Rudy to service us. She was so hurry that to let us order, even we had no idea about the menu. When we asked about the size of their meals, she said as tiny. She only wanted us to order more. However, it actually wasted a lot! Their soup base tastes like boiling water, especially the mushrooms soup! After we asked for the check, she was standing beside us, and asked for the sign check many times. When we gave back it to her, she even came to ask us about the tips!!!!!! I will never come to this store again! It my worst experience in Las Vegas!!!!

Really good experience, I will definitely come back here! Hot Pot was amazing!! This is my first time trying hot pot and the soup and wagyu beef was great! Trust me you have to get the wagyu beef!! My waiter Deni was very good at instructing us what to do also.
Nice and fancy. A bit pricy tho. Something new to try. Some item in the menu are not available.
Wow!! So much fun and the food is great. Must try the house noodles, shaved prime rib and waygu. I will be back again.

Food was great! It was our first time there and our server Deni was fantastic explaining how it worked and what to order,what sauces to use, how much, etc. It was so much fun to experiment with different flavors. When we left we felt satisfied--not stuffed, food was light but just right!

I love this place but I came 2 days in a row because they only had someone who made fish balls at certain times. I called, they said I didn't need a reservation. I Uber over and have to wait 30 minutes. I don't care, I love the food but I ask the manager to have the chef prepare me fish balls because I specifically came for them. After questioning me about whether or not I would eat them I ask for an order that the manager assured me of. I finally sit down with my party of five to receive my food to then find out that the fish balls I ordered were not only never made but the person that prepares them had left. I make an annual trip to Vegas and honestly I felt like a second rate customer. Possibly because we are a young group of males, I feel that the employees just never took us seriously and thats the fault of youth. It really sucked getting grilled from the manager about something you specifically want and they completely ignored the request when I show my patronage and support. My annual trip to this place may not happen anymore because of this.
