Damn shame, but honestly I felt almost disrespected by the fact that they ignored my eager desire to eat something they make specific hours for. I'm only writing this because the waiter asked me to write a review and be honest, hopefully they see this and listen when a customer speaks regardless of me being a tourist, a single male, or Asian. Was going to make it 3 stars but I had made a big deal about eating the stupid fish balls and showed up an hour and a half before the chef was supposed to leave, at 10:30pm, and yet i didn't get what I mainly came for. Couldnt give me my simple request and I felt patronized when I asked for it before sitting and expressed my concerns to it being prepared prior to me getting a table which could have been after I was seated. Really really sucked to be ignored when I spent money on a sizeable meal.
Fantastic service! Great food especially the beef and lamb. Perfect for a cold night! Thanks Xiao Xiao for taking care of us.

Great food and atmosphere. Start by picking a hot pot flavor, which you'll cook all your food in, and then choose type of meat and extras. Order on the light side, so you can pick from the converter belt as you dine.
This is my favorite restaurant.They are offer hot pot soup and all kind of foods on the rail.Great atmosphere.

This place is awesome...I got the tomato based soup and it was delicious!! Everything was so yummy. And our server Deni was so helpful and had excellent service. Definitely coming here again!! One of my favorite places!!

Mei gave excellent customer service! A very nice & sweet server and was very attentive. Love how there's many sauces you can choose from to add to your broth and how you can pretty much customize it however you'd like :) the house made meat balls were awesome !

Had an awesome time spending my sisters bday here! Matthew our server was very helpful. He told us about the happy hour special which was bogo conveyor belt items and half off drinks on Tuesday nights. Food was great and fun. We got to pick our soup base and sauces. The prices were really good for the portions! Overall an awesome experience!

This place is well worth the hype. A must see in Vegas. Beware of long wait time though. I love the concept of the (hot pot) Shabu Shabu. Chubby cattle made it even more fun by adding a self serve sauce station as well as the conveyor belt filled with the ingredients to put into the pot. - Ansel Ponce Diama

Great concept and good execution. Choices are plenty and varied. It's good that plates are available on the belt, because the servers are SLOW! I just wished they let you refill your soup yourself. But I get it ... Liability & all that stuff.  Pretty much everything is self service: the sauce, the seafood, the veggies, etc. Love that I can have my own pot of soup & adjust it to my liking. Overall yum!

They had an advertisement on yelp for checking in and getting 70% off on one plate. Well.. they didn't honor it. Initially they said it was for the week before and then they said that they were "sold out" of that specific plate. Also, their bartender (the only American guy in the place) was super loud, obnoxious, disrespectful and kept dropping F bombs very loudly. 
Aside from that, the place is nice and a complete different experience.

We love the food here, we really REALLY do. If it was based on the flavor and quality of the food alone, then I'd easily give this place 5 stars. Unfortunately, service plays a huge factor in the overall dining experience. 

We've been here twice now within a week because the flavor and quality of the food is that good! However, the staff is very clearly inexperienced. Some don't even really speak English that well either. I can speak Mandarin too, so I don't mind because I can just switch languages to accommodate. But they don't really know their own menu or the fact that the soup for children 12 and under is marked as half price on their menu. I get that they're new, but part of the hiring process should include hiring experienced management who can teach and lead a successful staff... and training that staff prior to opening. 

When we came here last week, the hostess gave me a business card so I can call and check on how we were progressing on the 45 min wait we were quoted. We weren't planning on going anywhere so I didn't have a need to call that day. Today, I did call because I knew they took reservations. Guess what? The phone number printed on their business card is wrong. The number here on Yelp is correct though so I was still able to call. When we got there, I mentioned the error to the hostess, who then pointed it out to the manager who had no idea of the typo. He even grabbed a phone to try calling the number himself (though I would think that most people should know the phone number to their job and just recognize the typo). Did everyone from the owners, management, wait staff, etc not notice this?? Or is this more a reflection of a staff that doesn't care? 

Now let's talk about the dining experience. On both visits, it took a while between getting seated until anyone acknowledges you to take your order (in the 20 min ballpark). Once you've ordered, it will take equally as long to get the soup. The stuff you order from the menu won't come out together either, or even relatively at the same time. For example, today we ordered 3 plates of meat and 3 large bowls of noodles off the menu. The noodles and one plate of meat came out quickly, but we were literally done with all of that and everything we took from the conveyer belt before the last 2 plates of meat arrived. Our drinks didn't come out together either! There were 4 of us and only my juice came out before the food. After the food came out we asked about the 3 waters... which was met with the waitress bringing one and walking away. Which led to us having to hail her down again to get 2 more. Really? I also saw the waitress talking to the table next to us... and one of the bussers interrupted her from helping those guests to show her/comment on the tip that was left by the next table over. That was probably a conversation that could have been saved for when the waitress wasn't at a table in the middle of talking to a customer. Whatever the case, with all of the delays with their service, both visits we've made have turned out to be 2+ hour ordeals, which is excessive for hot pot. After today, we're totally not that motivated to come back anytime soon. Based on service alone, we'd rather pay more and drive further to go to Red Pot even though their food quality isn't as good.

Came here on a Sunday night and there was no wait. We ordered the combo of Wagyu, brisket, and rib eye. And another dish of the beef and lamb combo. The service was fast and nice. The price is a bit overpriced but their meat quality is pretty good. They have an unlimited side dishes bar which contains a variety of sauces. I would come back again!

This was my first time visiting chubby cattle. We didn't make reservation so we had to wait around 20 mins which isn't bad for a Saturday. The hostess was friendly. Our waiter Gillbert and Kwan was very attentive. We are satisfied with the service. We had the individual hotpot. Flavor of the broth was good so was The quality of the meat. Some of the dish was pretty price for the portion. I like the fact that management really take customers feedback very serious. Definitely will be back again

Came here with my friend on a Monday night to try this conveyor belt hot pot themed restaurant. The inside is nice. They decorated it for the Halloween theme right now. There's bar seating and table seating with a conveyor belt of raw ingredients floating by for your hot pot. There's also a sauce bar off to the side where you can build you own savory dipping sauce. 

When we sat to order the waitress explained how this restaurant works. Its individual pots per person. You get to pick the broth and spicy level. Each broth is 3.99 to 6.99 depending on type and spicy level. Next you order all big items, meats, veggies and hand made meatballs from her. The items on the conveyor belt are smaller items like mushroom, bean curd, tofu, raw fish, veggies etc. So for the two of us we got the meat combo, veggie combo, and on her recommendation, the small portion of the shrimp paste. From the conveyor we got the beancurd, quail eggs and fishball with roe inside. My friend also got the mango juice and a bowl of rice. The flavors of the broths were good. Very flavorful. They are also very generous for refilling it. I thought the ingredients were fresh and delicious. Meat was good, veggies were good. 

The reason why I give this three stars is for the price. For the two of us it was 80 bucks total. That's a whopping bill for hot pot. You might as well go to an all you can eat hot pot restaurant for less than 30 bucks a person. They charge you for everything.. Broth, rice. Don't think I'll have the urge to try this again.

Chubby Cattle is the best hotpot restaurant that I have ever been to, better than Hai Di Lao Hotpot by far! Our wonderful server Xiao Xiao was incredibly courteous and patient in guiding us through their easy-to-use menu and explaining the convenient conveyor belt, which contained numerous goodies including fish balls, beef balls, and scallops, and even salmon sashimi (not to be put in the hotpot). The service was fast and presentation beautiful: the Kobe beef even came with dry ice in a separate pot for a dramatic effect! It just melted in your mouth--in fact, everything did. The lamb, beef, and chicken were all sliced so thinly and delicately. This was an immaculate dining experience.
Chubby cattle has some really good deals! Our host Denny was more then accommodating and did a great job setting the atmosphere! Good job and don't change it would be a shame!

If I am into hotpot, I always come to this place. They have the closest Chinese/Mongolian hotpot that has never been Americanized I believe. They have great broth and amazing selection of meats. Just keep in mind that the portion is a bit smaller than what you expect and bill adds up quickly. If you keep in mind that part, you will for sure enjoy this place.

I came here with my party of 6 right as they opened so we were seated quickly. We ordered the original and entry level spicy pot. First time trying this kind of hot pot but I thought it was delicious! Broths were super flavorful. Then we got the beef combo plate and the beef and lamb combo plate (both around 18$ if I remember right) and then we got veggies and other stuff from the conveyer belt which I thought was super cool! Overall super great experience with lovely staff. Will come back next time income visit!
Great food. The spicy soup has got some intense heat. Deni recommended some great choices. Will be back.

"I've been practicing eating lamb after I saw Eater put this place on the heat map"  says Midwest poker bud, smiling ear to ear.

"Practicing?"  I say.

"Yep.  I bought a some. grilled it. and ate it.  Taste pretty good doused in BBQ sauce" his reply.

"OK, let's go.  Errr and good luck".

Snazzy, contemporary feel, HD monitors everywhere, plexiglass cutouts in the table to protect your mobile, and a conveyor belt filled with raw foods.  

Simple hotpot concept.  Choose the broths, choose the proteins and veg (help yourself is seated by the conveyor belt and pay by the plate colors), cook in your personal or communal pot if you wish, dip in a sauce, and eat.

The broths sampled (house and "hellishly spicy" mid level heat) are wonderfully aromatic with the pronounced flavor of ginseng, cardamom, cinnamon, and other oil based spices (unsure of the extract but it has a bitterness and green vegetal finish similar to chrysanthemum).  It's not for everyone.  The broth is mildly seasoned.  Use of the dipping sauces is required to get the fullest flavor.  Warning, spice heat is achieved with dry chilies and LOTS of them.  

Good selection of mushrooms and relatively fresh veg.  Very good selection of proteins including multiple kinds of tofu, free ranged chicken, USDA choice to Wagyu beef, lamb and a plethora of live seafood.  Of course, wanting the authentic, it's all about the lamb and mutton. (Mongolia is land locked isn't it?)

Tip:  If it doesn't live together, don't cook them together.  That is unless you want to create a very "unique" soup.

- Mutton (thick sliced) - pronounced gamey flavor, lots of external fat.  Cooked rare for best flavor.
- House special lamb - thin cut, cooks instantly.  Very little fat.  Subtle leg of lamb flavor.
- Supreme lamb shoulder - most connective tissue, least lamb flavor.

Finally, do not pass on the charcoal grilled skewers.  the spice rubbed lamb, moist though cooked through and tasty lamb ribs with its melting fat and chewy connective tissue just good eats.   Both are well seasoned to enhance the classic lamb flavor.  A grilled "French style" rack of lamb, very aggressively seasoned with a spice rub, cooked through but tender with the cleanest lamb flavor; too fancy.

Patient and helpful servers who are willing to take the time to explain the many options.  

Eater Vegas has it right, deserving of the hype.

This a pretty cool place. We tried most of their soup base (mushroom, spicy, oxtail, etc) and our table allowed us to have our own individual pot. The soup will set you back a few bucks but it's worth it.

They have a sauce and a small appetizer bar at no cost which is a nice touch. Everything else here is a-la-carte,  I would opt out their certified Waygu grade 5 steak and stick with their beef and lamb offering. Their seafood was ok but not something you should go out of your way to try. They offer a few variety of "balls" so if you had to choose one, pick the fresh fish ball; the other variations didn't work.  They do have a sushi type carousal but I didn't see any price charts for the different color plates. 

As usual expect yourself to smell like what you ate..

When a place doensn't need any more reviews...

Service: Excellent
Food Quality: Great
Variety: Perfect
Drinks: Thumbs up

This place is really cool. They have individual soup stations or a large one for larger parties. We had 6 of us eating, so we got a shared table and did the heaven and hell pots. 
We ended up getting a large portion of meats as well. We did grab about 6 dishes off the belt to add to our soups. 
They also have an sauce bar. 

3 of the guys that we with us eat a ton, and they were all full. It ended up being around $35 a person with tip. That is fantastic. 

Overall, this is a super fun place. It's great for groups or a date. And they take reservations for parties over 2. *heart*

First time here with the family. The staff here was very friendly and attentive. The most unique thing we came across was the ability to make our own sauces. Overall, they had a large selection of meats, seafood and broths which was delicious and satisfying.
By the wise words of my younger sister as we finished our food, "10 out of 10, would eat again."

I just moved here from Hawaii where hot pot is very popular. That's what we were craving so I looked up a few places on Yelp. Chubby Cattle was on the top of the list. Mind you, they open from 5pm-12am. We got here at 5:30pm so we were able to get seats quickly. If we came 15 minutes later there would be no more seats. This place was a hit! The broth was flavorful! We had 3 to our party and everyone had their own hot pot because a mini pot is built right into the table in front where everyone was sitting. And I loved the concept of the conveyer belt! I'm going to miss Hawaii, and if I'm every craving a little taste of home I will definitely come here.

First time eating Korean hot pot and I fell in love. We chose to sit by the conveyor belt of food toppings to get the full experience and see all the goodies that can be added. They offer multiple types of broth to cook your proteins in and like mentioned, have toppings you can pick from all differently priced depending on the color of the plate they sit on. Our server was very helpful in explaining the menu.

This is the best Hot Pot in the west coast and their original soup base is to DIE FOR! $3.99 for the soup? How can you beat that?

Get the beef brisket with the potato noodles. Best combination so far! They hand make EVERYTHING from scratch and you can taste the difference.

My favorite part about Chubby Cattle is their innovation. The conveyor belt is fun, but it's not overwhelming like other places. It's truly an experience to eat here, but you won't have to burn a hole in your wallet to get it.

Most important aspect of all - Service.

Gia is my favorite server here and you have to request her when you eat here. She takes the time to explain the process to you, especially if you have people in your party who are unfamiliar with conveyor belt hot pot. This is a big deal because I have a lot of friends who are intimidated by Asian food.

the best hot pot place i've ever been to. the kobe beef and the uni were so fresh it melted in your mouth. we got a private room for 8 people and the service was impeccable. would recommend and definitely go back!

This place is really good!! I'm originally from LA (SGV/626 area) so we have a TON of hot pot places. This may be an exaggeration but there's probably one hot pot place every 3 shopping centers there and I've tried a fair number of them. Food in Vegas doesn't really compare to food in LA with the exception of Chubby Cattle!

Let's start off with the soup broth first! We ordered their house original broth and it was g-r-e-a-t! It was full of flavor. You could taste the herbs and the richness of the animal bone in every bite. As the soup boiled down their waiters were very responsive and came back to refill us every time. Their meat selection and seafood selection was really good. The beef tasted fresh and their seafood looked fresh (personally didn't try any). Their selection of veggies was a bit limited but they made up for that with some bomb.com house made noodles! My favorite were the green tea ones.
It's not you its ne I just not a really big fan of hot pot. Great service though and really like the bibbs they give you.

Been hearing about this place for a while; finally checked it out tonight. Our party arrived around 7:30pm and the place wasn't too busy so we were seated quickly. We ordered individual House Original Pot soup base and a variety of proteins including the beef combo, pork belly, house fish balls, noodle combo, veggies, etc. Everything was fresh and the quality of the beef was great. We get to mix our own sauce so each of us have different flavors. The place also quickly filled up; we are lucky we got there early!

Definitely would return for the food and service when we want hot pot!

Loved the whole experience. Our sever Ting guided us through the concept and had great recommendations. I'd definitely go with the tomato soup and the short rib. From there grab what looks good from the line. 

They also have do it your self sauce bar. You can mix a variety of ingredients together. They even have a few signs to help guide you in the right direction.

Came here for their does count night where it was buy one get one if you are a student with an ID card at first glance when entering this place it has a strong smell once you get past that you'll be able to enjoy your food. They have a lot of meat selections and a DIY sauce bar. The soup base was good and flavorful as well!
We sat at the conveyer belt table and this concept is very cool and fun. You will definitely need to shower when you get home but it is worth it for you hot pot lovers! The price is a little steep so I would recommend going on a discount night!
I can't say enough good things about this place. The lamb, the noodles, the soup are all amazing. Kevin makes the whole experience even better. Chubby Cattle is my newest obsession. Can't get enough.

First time trying out a hot pot in Las Vegas. This place is great! Our server Deni was very helpful about explaining the menu and how to go about our meal. I got the house special broth and my boyfriend got the hellish spicy entry level ( suuuuuper spicy ). You can adjust the taste by making your own sauce. They have a station where you can pick out different ingredients. The conveyor has a lot of add ons that you can pick out anytime!

Amazing place. The restaurant is open and spacious, and the personal hot pots makes the dining experience hassle free and enjoyable. The revolving food bar was also very new and interesting, and makes it easy and quick to get our food. Presentation of the food was also beautiful--from vegetable picnic baskets to plates in the shape of shells, the chefs know how to attract foodies. Our server Matthew was super helpful, and explained to us how to get started with the experience. The food itself was superb, and I would definitely come back again!

Very friendly but forgetful. The food quality was exceptional. I understand it is busy but our server kept saying he would get back to us, about every 20-30 minutes. Aside from that, everything was good.

To start off, I'd like to say that the staff is very nice. That being said, it was still a disappointing experience. I'm a newbie to hotpot, and I was used to the checklist format found at Little Sheep. To say the least, I was a little intimidated by the thought of a conveyor belt. I ordered the mushroom broth and my S.O. ordered the medium spicy pot. We sat in front of the conveyor belt for 10...15...20 minutes with no broth. We started to wonder if we were supposed to go somewhere to actually get the broth.

Finally, the broth came out, then the veggies, then the meat. The meat was decent quality and the veggies we ordered were fresh, but the pieces of cauliflower garnish that came with my tomato noodles were moldy - not like a few spots of black that one may just cut off at home, but like an entire half of a piece was trimmed off to account for the mold.  The food from the conveyor belt, however, was dried out. We went during happy hour, so it was understandable that the conveyor belt wasn't a fresh as possible, but some of the items were shriveled enough that they weren't readily recognizable as food. Also, the conveyor items come on cafeteria style plates, with plastic covers (most of them cracked and frosty), giving a very cheap feel.

The food was good, but not good enough to warrant the price tag.
I like the soup here. Very fresh and clean Vegetables and good stuff to eat here too. Good for cold weather coming. Delicious foods here.
The food was excellent and the service was too! James was very attentive and was there to guide us through the correct way to cook our food. Thanks James!

I've been going here since their soft opening and have always been pleased with their food. There have been times when service has been slow but usually during high peak times. One of my favorite hot pot places in Las Vegas.

Awesome spot for hot pot. Can be intimidating if it is your first time, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. The basics are choose a broth and the waiter will bring it out and set on the heating element. Order your meats and veggies to be cooked in the broth. Enjoy.  The conveyor is fun just grab what you want and the waiter counts the plates at the end. If it's your first time try the original broth or the mushroom. The beef and lamb combo for meat is very good. Recommend reservations as this place is very popular.
The food was great.  The seasoning was wonderful.  It was very clean.  Dani was an excellent server.

I've never been to a Mongolian hot pot until now. There's a conveyor belt where you can pick and choose additional items besides what's on the menu. Deni was our server. He helped us pick out 3 selections and the type of hot pot. I will come back to try more!

Went here for Valentine's Day and the food was good! For newbies I'd recommend the Beef combo, the yin yang broth (mixture of two broths), and the seafood combo. Deni was great and even hooked it up with the ice cream! We will definitely be back

This was my first time at anything even remotely like a hot pot restaurant, and it was phenomenal!

The place smells wonderful when you first walk in,  and is spotlessly clean.

Our server Xiao Xiao was extraordinarily helpful and very patient, explaining the menu multiple times until we understood hot hot pot worked.

I had chicken, mushrooms, park dumplings and a little mini-pumpkin pastry for dessert. All nicely presented.

My roommate had the seafood combo and it was a huge buffet of things, shrimp, prawns, scallops, mussels, clams and fish. WELL worth the price. 

I give this place 5 stars, will definitely be back with more friends!!!

Yes, this place is expensive. But I personally think you get what you pay for, which is awesomeness! The sauce station is the absolute bomb, I love the conveyor belt style of the restaurant, and I love the plethora of meats they have. You really can't go wrong with this place. I introduced this place to my family and now they're hooked. We go there for special events, or if we just feel like being fatties. The servers are really nice and accommodating and their playlist for music is pretty fun. I heard your Porter Robinson playing, good on you. I usually go for the numbing spicy soup base, and my boyfriend gets the oxtail soup. Both I highly recommend. I wasn't too impressed with the House Special base, but it didn't detract from the awesome food party going on in my mouth. Their handmade noodles are pretty legit, too. Love the green tea noodles. Keep it up, guys!

Hot pot is something you don't hear to often in the Las Vegas foodie scene let alone Mongolian food. To my surprise, I was very excited about this restaurant opening especially finding out that they would have a conveyor belt full of various dishes.

The family and I decided on this place because we were pretty much Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Vietnamese and even Filipino out. We have been wanting to try something new and different for a awhile. Since I'm the designated unofficial planner for my family. I pulled up my Yelp account and came across Chubby Cattle that I bookmarked.

When we got to Chubby Cattle, the staff immediately greeted us and we were seated upon entering within 2 minutes on a Friday night. We got place with a table that was next to a conveyor belt, because not all seating arrangement have a conveyor belt. Our server Kwan, was very friendly and attentive to our needs and explained to us the concept. We decided on the Halloween Special Combo at the time since it was suggested by our server. We got a huge pumpkin carved out wit a variety of meats, shrimp & dumplings. Included was a bowl of various vegetables. I personally like the fact that the Hot Pot was built with a divider so we had the option of 2 soup base. One was tomato paste broth and the other was a mushroom flavor broth. Both were delicious and paired well with everything that came on our combo. There was a few dishes we added ala carte from the conveyor belt like quail eggs which happens to be a favorite of mine and my sisters. Overall the whole experience was amazing and definitely will be a topic for discussion with our extended family and friends. The cool thing about our dinner was how my parents actually enjoyed their meal. Even though they are biased with many Asian restaurants. 

The only thing I noticed that could be improved on is their clarification of the menu. It could use more description of what is being offered and specifically how big of a portion each combo can feed. Plus the options of adjusting according to group sizes would be beneficial. However, everything was great and I would recommend everyone to try this dinning experience out!

Kwan, Thanks again for the awesome service! :)

Chubby Cattle was a great place to eat, the waiters were super kind and the food was great. It was confusing to use the hot pot at first, but then we got the hang of it. The reason I gave it only four stars is because when we ordered the entry level spicy it was spicer than I thought. Overall it was great!

Chubby Cattle, I really wanted to like you. I have been waiting for you to open for ages. Ever since I heard wind of "Little Lamb" opening and that it is a similar concept to Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot, I had been ecstatic. 

Chubby Cattle has a very interesting concept when it comes to hot pot. For half of their tables, everyone at the table gets their own individual pot. The other half gets a shared pot for those who don't mind. On top of that, they have a conveyor belt for certain hot pot items that you can grab. The items are on different colored plates that differentiate the cost of each item. Just keep in mind that meats and a majority of the seafood items won't be on the conveyor belt. 

My friends and I came here last night for dinner. When we first got in, the hostess greeted us and proceeded to ask if we have reservations. Her question threw me off because I have never been to a hot pot place where they asked for reservations. She then told us that she could seat us but it would be shared pot and it will not be by the conveyor belt. 

We want to be able to experience the conveyor belt and we told the hostess that. Instead of giving me an estimated time, she just gave me negative statements such as, "I just can't sit you there right now. I have a reservation coming in at 7:15, 7:30, etc. I just can't." Well, that's great. Why do I care about what reservations you have coming? She eventually told us that it'll be a 45-60 min wait. She said she'd call us if the table was ready early or we can come back in an hour. Sure enough we came back in an hour and when she saw us, she told me, "I tried calling you but it didn't work." I was really tempted to say, "Well, did you dial 1 first?" Without another word, she walked off. So, the hostess is unprofessional, not personable, overwhelmed, and doesn't know how to use a phone. 

When we got seated, the table wasn't completely set up. Why? Because the hostess sat us without taking that into mind. It took a while before we got to order our soup bases and when we did, our server told us they were out of their original and original spicy. Well, why am I here then? I almost walked out but the manager came up to inform the server that if we were willing to wait 10 minutes, then the original and original spicy would be ready. And of course we opted to wait. In the end, I ended up with their original spicy soup base at medium. It was pretty bland in flavor. The soup tasted like spicy water that smelled like spicy herbs. 

When we looked through the menu, we were a little curious about some of the dishes. There were single dishes and then there were combo dishes. We wanted to know the differences between them -- like, what is the better bang for our buck. We asked our server and he knew nothing. The manager had to come over to explain. Even then, according to the server, the beef & lamb combo platter, they don't serve the dishes by weight. The kitchen just does the best that they can to fill the plate up. So if I knew someone who worked in the kitchen, I can get a hook up right? We ended up ordering a plate of beef brisket and lamb shoulder. The quality of the beef brisket wasn't that great but the lamb shoulder slices were decent.

Aside from the meats, we also ordered napa cabbage and watercress. The napa was fine but the watercress wasn't fresh at all. A lot of yellow and browns on the leaves. We also ordered their fresh thick noodle and when I was ordering it, the server suggested the noodle combo. Of course, being curious, I asked what's in the noodle combo. He told me it was random and the kitchen decides on that. Well then, why am I ordering from a server? Should I just order from the kitchen directly? Maybe they'll know more about what's being served to me. On that topic, the fresh thick noodles were not fresh -- they were dry. They were also not thick, they were thin. They were thinner than spaghetti noodles. The texture of it was really good though and tasted great when cooked in the spicy soup base. I just wish they were thicker. 

From the conveyor belt, we got some king oyster mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, and glass noodles. They were pretty okay but we also noticed that a lot of the plates were not consistent in the amounts. Some plates looked like they had more product than the next even when it's the exact same item. 

Our server did apologize for his performance. It was his third day on the job and he was overwhelmed and his knowledge was limited. I'm not sure if that's the greatest excuse but I do appreciate the apology though. 

Bottom line, I'm not sure if I would return. The establishment has a great outward appearance to everything they do: conveyor belt, presentation of their seafood plates, table set up, etc. But the service wasn't great from square one and the quality of certain items were only average unless you spend a lot more. I've experienced better in general. The conveyor belt was a fun experience though! Was worth it just once.
This place is hella good but please avoid them meat cheeseballs. They taste and smell nasty.

So I really love eating here but a few small things keep it from being five stars. First the good, love the concept of individual hot pots and pulling the mix-it's from a conveyer belt. It's engaging, interactive and fun. The staff is generally nice and the most of the food is really tasty. I know now what I like and I get it every time and so I know it will taste great. Get the tomato broth base its phenomenal with mushroom a close second if you like it filled with all kinds of different mushrooms. The spicy soup base is almost inedible, just avoid it. It's too frustrating to eat because it's filled with so many inedible herbs and roots, like eating a soup of tree bark. And it forces you to separate your edible mix-ins from the inedible items which takes forever. You're trying to eat a noodle and it's wrapped around a stick, arghhh.

So the few downsides, the array of side snacks (along with sauce mix-ins) is so often depleted well before closing. We show up with hours until close and the bind of things like edamame or fruit or crackers or whatever that day are almost always empty and don't get refilled. Secondly the conveyer belt selection is hit or miss and there's no rhyme or reason to what they put out. Sometimes there's a lot of one thing and nothing of others, and it's frustrating that seemingly the two sides of the belt are not connected, so often I see something on the other side of the room that will never come to us. So I've taken to getting up and walking over to the other side of the restaurant to check the other selection.

Also the pricing is weird and ordering something from the server is often 2-3 times the belt price which is frustrating when you have to ask for it cause they forget to restock the belt. They don't consistently give everyone the same utensils so I go to serve myself the soup and I have a slotted spoon but others have a ladle. You have to ask for what should just be there. Overall these are all issues of inconsistency. It doesn't ruin the experience, just annoying when I love the food. But it doesn't seem to bother most people cause it gets pretty crowded. I'm one of those regulars so for all it's flaws, it's still pretty great!

First time I came here was little than a week ago. I came here with 2 friends and my girlfriend and we're very excited off of the reviews, let alone the sound of this place. To start, the first time was amazing, great service and great food. Our waiter was attentive and the hostess made sure things went well. HOWEVER the reason of my review is because of our second trip which was tonight. 

My girlfriend and I went because the first time was amazing. However, it was one of the most irritating times I ever had at a restaurant and usually I'm very easy to please. The hostess was PERFECT as always but the server wasn't. I don't know if it was his first time or not but I see it how if you mess up once, fix it. First we ordered the beef combo and got a lamb and beef and after I tried politely to tell him it was the wrong order, he told me I was the one who ordered it and it wasn't his mistake. I didn't order it and what I originally ordered was more expensive so why would I lie about that in the first place when I'm about to pay for the more expensive one that I ordered?? Second, through our meal it seemed as if we offended him with getting what we originally ordered that he stopped attending to us. Our drinks were empty for almost the entire meal til we had to stop someone and ask for a refill. Next our server attended to the people to the right of us, skipped over to the left of us and finally I was frustrated and made eye contact til he finally came over to us and checked on us. After that the group to the right of us interrupted us while I was asking for something and he walked away to attend them! He also interrupted us in the middle of our meal to ask if we're done, keep in mind we started way after the people around us, felt as if we were being pushed out. 

Got to the end of our meal and my girlfriend and I wanted to take our food home because we were full. We had A LOT leftover and the server came to us and only brought 1 container and said they don't have anymore. I was upset because not only did they not have anymore containers for myself to take home the extra amount of food I'm paying for and had leftover, he said to us "You guys should try and finish it." ARE YOU SERIOUS? How are you going to tell a customer to finish their food because YOU'RE out of containers? Let alone he told us multiple times to try and finish it?! The nice hostess again stepped in, ran to another restaurant and helped me. After all this, one of the chefs in the kitchen they have opened to the customers eye's to see, I saw him staring at us like we were ridiculous and laughed. He was the white chef with glasses. I also heard him clearly joking around with his coworkers about how we made them run around to get us stuff for our leftover food. SMFH. I was highly pissed off at this point. 

I feel horrible ever writing a post like this and I barely ever do but my girlfriend and I were highly disrespected here. I worked and managed restaurants and kitchens as well as have my own business. I know what customer service should be.

Awesome place. Best hot pot I've ever had, The mushroom base with the mushroom basket was divine, the lamb platter was too good for words. I would come back just for the awesome service. Silvia "the manager" was very sweet and helpful. Kwan is an awesome server, he was very helpful and attentive. I will definitely be back and bringing my friends.

I was really looking forward to this hot pot place for a while because my friends posted it on Snapchat.   Let me tell you this,  it was well worth the wait because the soup was very flavorful.   This is a great place for hot pot.  I ordered the tomato an ox tail soup. It is a excellent choice and I pretty much finished a whole entire pot.  Everyone gets their own individual hot pot .  We ordered three combos of meat and that was shared among five people.   This is a very fun place to eat because it has the same concept as revolving sushi except it's hot pot items.  Our server was named Deni.  He was super nice and very excellent and his explanation of the menu.  They have multiple TVs here and we watched the Warriors game seven of the NBA finals.  I would definitely recommend this place as it is a very fun place to eat.

This place is great!!! The most authentic hot pot I have ever have in the State! food is AWESOME! I will definitely go there again if I go to Las Vegas next time. Plus the price is not high at all. but parking is hard to find during rush hours and tooany people waiting. better make reservations.

I really like this place, and the service is always excellent here. The waiters are really helpful if you're a first timer and they are full of suggestions. They still remembered me when I came back for more, too.

The meat is always so goooood. I love the rib-eye and brisket. I've tried the spicy broth, house original, and mushroom. When I ordered the spicy one, I didn't really take them seriously and went for a medium level, I think it's best to start with the entry level spicy if it's your first time here. I honestly can't tell if I like the mushroom or original hotpot better, both are really tasty. The mushroom is a more subtle broth but if you love mushrooms like me, it's great.

Honestly, I really, really like this place, but I can't give in 5 stars because it's sooo expensive, overpriced in my opinion. All of the Shabu-shabu places I've been to charge for their meat, and the choice of broth comes with your order of meat. Those shabu places also include a vegetable platter and a bowl of rice. At Chubby Cattle, they charge you separately to add rice, any veggies are their own prices on the menu, and the broth itself is also charged to your bill. Everything adds up so fast!! I feel like at least rice should be included because it's kind of hard to just eat meat in sauce for an entire meal.

Also, the cilantro in their self-serve sauce bar could be a bit fresher... (some of it is turning black sometimes...)

First time and we had a great experience. Deni was awesome and the food was delicious. Definitely what las vegas needs more of. 

Downside is there is no waiting area so customers are standing in your area. Possibility for expansion.

Great food and amazing service. Be sure to ask for Xiao Xiao. She will take care of you and help you navigate through the sometimes not so obvious choices. Highly recommend the prime short rib with egg.
Great service.  Clean atmosphere. Quality food.  Overall experience is excellent.  Highly recommended to anyone.  Special shout out to Deni! Great service. Very attentive to needs.

Chubby Cattle! Oooooh what a place! I simply love it so much that I dream about it sometimes! Delicious and very addictive, probably the best in town, only small tiny detail is the oyster sauce!!!!!!I really wish you guys had it at the sauce bar! But all in all it's a great place and one of my favorites!
Great service with delicious food for a good price too! Matthew, our waiter was one of the best service I've had

This is he best hot pot restaurant in town. Everything is fresh. Beef is top quality. There's rotating conveyer belt that brings food to cook so you will never run out of food and keeps fresh. Our server Bin is great, very attentive and nice. Can't ask for anything better. Have to try

between three people we ordered the meat combo, thick rice noodles each, shrimp, pork dumplings, and potatoes. everything was amazing. tons of variety, the meat was of the highest quality, and the sauce bar was delicious. 
the noodles were freshly pulled. all at about $20 per person without tip. 
this is probably my favorite restaurant in vegas currently, let alone hot pot. what a unique place to eat!!

Ok, talk about different, this place is crazy good! It is Northern Chinese and Mongolian fare, something that I know I've not had before. It all starts with the broth, similar to a shabu shabu, but much more. We had what they call the heaven and hell, which is two broths divide in a pot. One was flavorful beef bone broth, the other was Hell. Now, I'm a hot spicy eater and we had the entry level version of hell which is about a two and it goes up to 10....OMG!. They have different additions like lamb/ beef, seafood and more. Lots of grilled meats and seafood. They have a conveyer belt that has all these different sides...lots of fun! Our server Deni was the best, made all sorts of recommendations, great ambience as well and pretty cool music. I highly recommend this place
Got the original pot and beef/ lamb combo. It's totally worth it if you come on a day with buy one meat get one free deal

Everything is really unique! Especially the revolving dishes!
This is the first time that I've seen a hot pot restaurant with individual pots.
One of the dishes you must get are the cheese filled beef balls!!
Ordered the beef and lamb combo, the portion is bigger than expected. 
The waiter Gilbert was really nice to all the customers(hope you read this!)
definitely will come back again in the future!

Despite the absence of conveyor belt sushi's in Vegas, they somehow have revolving hot pot. Go figure. For those who have never had revolving anything, here's the breakdown. Each plate is color coordinated by price and there's no limit to how much you can have. I mean, you pay for each plate, so no one will stop you. If what you want is not on the conveyor belt, it may be requested. 

We picked up noodles, fish balls, and veggies. Clear noodles were the cheapest at $.99, while the fish balls were about $3 

You choose your broth, meat and anything extra, like rice, you want to buy right away. Remember that broth is refillable so don't skimp on those slurps of soup. To fill your broth with extra flavor, there is an unlimited condiment station that is full of different sauces. My favorite has to be the peanut butter, garlic and peanut bits mixture with a hint of chili paste. The flavor was just perfect. 

I walked out of there at least a ton heavier....but damn, it was so worth it! Don't forget to look into daily discounts. They have a great one for students!
We love this place. Order as much as you can eat. Excellent customer service! Denni  was our server tonight.  He made our dinner very pleasant. He welcome you back with open arms. Thank you Denni!
It was alright! I can't say that I hate it or love it. The service was great. Friendly workers! The food was okay. I would recommend it to people who want to go to a new hot pot place.

CHECK OUT MY SAUCE!! 

Definitely coming back here when I'm in Vegas!!! When walking in, the food train had already caught my eye. It wasn't until I turned my head right to see a bright godly light shining on their sauce bar..

I'm known for being a sauce boss and to see their sauce bar amazed me. However, I did think it repeated itself but I walked around and nope!! Not at all. ALL different sauce so I added each one into my bowl. 

My favorite thing at the bar was the enoki mushrooms wrapped with beef was my favorite dish; we had to get two! We also got the lamb and beef which was good. The charcoal lamb racks were delish as well. Thanks to Gia our server, we had a great experience here and will be coming back with friends and family!

It was a fun new experience. Food was good and I really loved the mushroom broth base! I took it home and used it to make another soup the next day for work. Just added my own udon noodles. They were super helpful in explaining everything and how it all worked.

Terrible experience!
-place was dirty and unorganized.
-quality of the food was minimum, poorly prepped, and overly price.
-service was extremely terrible.

Since the place was quite new, reservation is recommended. If you do not have reservation, waiting time will be about 10-15 minutes.
Great hot pot spot!! Love the variety & great prices. Very fresh, lots of pot flavors, great service and food.

Deni , good service . All the food we order are so good .
I m so happy to be here. We will come back !

This was my first time ever trying a hot pot, and I chose this place specifically because of their conveyor belt attraction, which we all know is a very scarce find in Las Vegas. 

Being a first timer, I was very overwhelmed by the options on the menu. The list was so extensive, I had no idea what was good and what wasn't, so it was one of those moments where I literally went with my server's recommendation. Gilbert, by the way, was fantastic, having a vast amount of knowledge on hot pot, and helped make my experience less intimidating. 

I ordered a variety of meats on their list in the end, not really knowing what to try. In the end, I think I can safely say that the Beef&Lamb combo was the winner for me. All the meat was such great quality, sometimes it felt like a shame for me to put it into a boiling pot instead of grilling it. Haha. 

On the other hand, this may just be silly old me, but I assumed that you don't really drink the broth because they gave us straining ladles, and there was no other utensil in sight for us to put the soup into our bowls. So yes, silly me, but also silly them for not giving us the right ladle (it was on my second visit where I learned you drink the broth too). It would've been helpful to know the first time before we spent a whopping $70+ on our meal, trying to get full but still left unsatisfied. 

On our second visit, we brought family, a party of 7 seated in a booth for 6. There was only one pot to share among 7 people, which we all felt was very inconvenient and uncomfortable. We had the right ladles, at the very least. Perhaps consider adding a 2nd hot pot for tables accommodating to larger parties so they don't all have to huddle around one small pot. 

Despite the inconveniences, I loved the piping broths and A quality meat of their hot pots to the point where I couldn't give Chubby Cattle any less of a score than a solid 4.
The waitress xiaoxiao is an amazing server as good as the food here, This place is the bomb,My view will be 5 stars all the way. What an experience! Great waitress, great service!!
We found this place on yelp and we gave it a try.  Wow, it is so good.  Everything fresh and delicious.

Even though eating this kind of thing in the middle of summer is as strange as having a popsicle in a snowstorm to me, the fragrant scent of boiled meats and other delights coming out of the kitchen squashed any of those concerns upon entering.  I walked to the table as quickly as possible to dive into it all.  

The excellent ingredients and presentation totally take this place to the next level.  Their beef and lamb combo platter was sliced red meat pornography and tasted even better with their vast array of sauces (the BBQ one seemed most popular).  The seafood combo platter packed with shrimp, scallop, octopus, squid, and mussels with its dry ice center garnered the "oohs" and "ahhs" it was looking for.  Even the people at a neighboring table came over to snap pics.  We also ordered the meatballs, live scallops (huge!) and the short rib; all top notch. 

My only real gripe is with the menu itself.  There are a lot of options and it could be daunting for first timers to the restaurant, let alone this type of dining experience as a whole.  It's probably even more annoying for staff since they have to constantly answer questions that could easily be clarified on the menu, like portion size.  To save everyone time, offering combo meals for 2, 4, and 6 people with a little bit of everything should be considered.

- While a cool novelty, the conveyer belt will go ignored unless dining solo or if you're the only one yearning for a plate of blood tofu or cuttlefish.  We ordered a lot and it was more than enough.  It isn't important or as fun to sit by as I thought it would be.    

- Dipping high quality beef into boiling water is never worth it.  Avoid the "Kobe".

- I really want to go spicy next time!

- Can we PLEASE STOP calling this fondue?

4.4888888889 stars

This place smells like cabbage feet. The bathrooms were slippery to the point people were tripping. They serve no alcohol, but tell you that you can walk over to Walgreens and buy it to bring over. The food taste like hot garbage. We paid and left to go eat at Herbs & Rye after this. Parking is a nightmare too, we had to park at the next center over.
Pretty good dinne experience.  ??????????and also you can creat your own place at sauce station,love it so much
Very good. A little bit pricy but still ok. Really great service and food quality. Will come back again.

I've come here a handful of times and every time I leave full and happy. The service sometimes were better than others. Always busy, so I've learned to use OpenTable to reserve a table prior going. Their food is always yummy. I've tried the oxtail, original, and mushroom broth with entry level spice. We always order a beef combo plate, seafood plate, vegetables, and noodles. My favorites here are: taro noodles, tiger shrimp, and their brisket! Lastly, I do enjoy their pricing. Their meat plates are resizable you could spend at least $20/per person and still get a lot of food. My first choice for hotpot closest to home.

Always wanted to try this place when i discovered it on yelp. Came on a Tuesday night around 7 and there was a wait.  I'd say only waited for about 20 mins for party of two. Got sat along the conveyor belt.  The spicy pot was way too spicy for me to enjoy.  And the mushroom base taste like nothing with mushrooms in it.  The beef combo tasted all the same (beef tongue,brisket, ribeye). Scallops were the size of a nickel. Really cute restaurant. but i think i had my expectations too high because I was disappointi

Something new in Vegas, a conveyor belt with different varieties of food to choose from.. hot pot !! The meat has to be ordered with the server though and also the live seafood.. but everything else is on the belt.. we were lucky enough to sit at the area so it was convenient. If you don't then you must order everything from the server. Our server Xiao Xiao was really nice and explained  the process of everything from the beginning. Only thing I would changed is the size of the counter at the belt area as it was a little small with all the food being ordered. Other than that.. this place was great !! Would come back again.
Fun experience and the soup was amazing and the food choices was good , great staff and we will definitely be back

Place is really fun, good food. Service was solid and Deni made sure we were always getting anything we needed. The coffee ice cream  was a perfect way to end the meal. Make sure to check it out!  

For sports guys/girls they have tv's showing the game.

Very good service! We came here for my moms birthday and everything was great! Matthew our waiter was nice and very helpful.  Food was delicious and they have a bar with all the different sauces that you can pick from or combine to make your own. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone who like hot pot .

It's our first time eating here, and let me tell you... It's pretty great. The food is good with lots of choices. Something I've never seen before here in Vegas! The staff are all so punctual and genuinely nice. Our server, Deni, was also very delightful. Can't wait to come back here!

It's a unique experience in the U.S. but common in Asia. Many options on broth in which to cook your veggies and meats. My favorite was the tomato-based broth, which added nice flavor to the otherwise bland veggies. For the unitiated, I would advise that you first try Chubby Cattle with someone who knows the ropes and can guide you on how to make your own dipping sauce and what meats to order. It can be a bit overwhelming if you come in cold turkey, though the staff is friendly and can help a lot.

Biggest danger is choosing too many items with no knowledge of the price. It gets expensive fast and a glance at your bill can end up inducing acute indigestion. It's one if the reasons I tend to avoid dim sum.
I am addicted to this place i come often everything is great from the cleanliness, food and it's presentation, to the service! I highly recommend!

As much as i am fan of their food, you should make reservations or else you have to wait for about 2 hours during the evening time. This happened to us as a couple of times already. We've asked them a couple of times and they said we we're next after an hour. Another 45 minutes have passed said we we're next. 5 groups were seated ahead of us as they indicated they made reservations. It is sad to say we walked out because we were felt neglected as others are being seated. From a customer service standpoint, this is unacceptable. Other than that, their food is good but their seating system needs adjustments.

Wow. I can honestly say we had no clue what we were getting into when we visited Chubby Cattle. We were just two hungry white folk who had never experienced hot pots before (well, the Melting Pot-- but does that really count?) and we wanted to try something new. Reading the Yelp reviews-- we decided tonight was the night!

Chubby Cattle was amazing. The wait staff-- Harry and Angela were extremely friendly and helpful. We ended up ordering the combo beef platter with the mushroom broth and the house broth plus a skewer of lamb and beef. There was so much food-- we couldn't finish it all!

Really-- we were intimidated walking in but it was totally worth it. Try Chubby Cattle if you are looking for a new great place for lunch or dinner!

this is my favorite place and food are fantastic great food!!! shout out to my server deni he is amazing knowledgeable about the menu  he explains very well and very helpful and i love this place and i will be back !!!!

It's a pretty solid hotpot restaurant. I have been there couple times and tried few soup bases; all of them are pretty good. The spicy soup base is pretty spicy so be conservative if you decided to have the chili soup base. They make their own fish a shrimp balls and I like them a lot, way better than those pre-made stuff. Service was solid, servers made good suggestions and pretty attentive. There's a sauce bar where you can make you own dipping sauce, have quite a few ingredients so you can experience a little with your sauce and that's also my kids favorite part of the restaurant.

The best hot pot place in town! Good food, music, servers, great place to hangout with friends and have some real Chinese hot pot. The design of this restaurant is very cool. Matt is the best waiter. He is very patience help us explain everything. Very love this place! I will recommend for more people

I'm been here twice and this restaurant has awesome food. 
My boyfriend really liked the taste of the entry level soup... 
he ate so much that he cAnt even stand up lol... 
also. Deni provided us a great customer service 
He already checked up on you to see if your are satisfied with the visit
I highly recommend this restaurant

First time ever having hot pot and it will not be my last! Chubby Cattle is amazing, the staff is friendly and explains how the hot pot works in a very polite manner. Angela was my server, she recommended the Mille Crepe Mango Cake, it was light fluffy and delicious! I will definitely be coming back with a group to share ! I could not finish 1 pot by myself and my whole meal was just about $25!!

Food: Chinese hot pot very similar to "Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot" in Cupertino, CA. Their original soup base tasted the exact same. We ordered combination beef plate, combo vegetable plate and combo seafood plate, soft tofu and another tofu. We ordered the family pot which is one pot for 5 people to share with half original soup and half mushroom. We all agreed original was best. The sauce bar was awesome and something Little Sheep doesn't have. I made my sauce with ponzu, green onion, cilantro, chili oil, sesame oil and garlic. So tasty!!

Ambiance: clean and casual with loud music. We only used the conveyor belt once to get extra corn. 

Service: super friendly. Kwan was our server and spoke both English and Mandarin Chinese which helped with my in-laws. They were good with water refills. 

Cost: $80 for 5 people. 

We'll definitely be back and maybe to try the individual hot pots so we each get our own.

Heard of this place and finally made it here. The hostess was friendly and accommodating. Our server Matthew, did an amazing job. He explained everything on how to order items and suggested menu options that would be suitable for me and my family being our first time dining here. He was very accommodating for my children as well. We all enjoyed the food, and the service. We are definitely coming back.

Took 4 kids and the significant other here to try it out. We eat hot pots all the time and wanted to try something new. We were drawn to this place for the conveyor belt we saw, but they seated us at a table that didn't have access to it. There is quite a stench when you walk in-my 7 year old hated the smell. Once your there for a bit, you get used to it. It must be all the broths. The waiters didn't speak Much English so it was hard to converse. Service was just OK. The food was good. We tried a bit of everything. My seven year old wasn't impressed, he felt it all had a lemon taste to it. He didn't eat. The rest of us enjoyed it, but it probably wouldn't be our first choice for hot pot.

I really enjoyed the concept of the conveyer belt and picking out items as needed, though it is very dangerous if you have no self control and pick out everything!! 

My friend and I opted for the beef combo and picked other items to our liking. I had the mushroom broth and it was very good but I liked the tomato broth way better which was what my friend chose.

Friendly waiter and great service. Very prompt and followed up frequently.
Best hot pot in town, great customer service. Kwan was our server and he was the best.

Visited on Saturday 8-20-16 at 5:30 pm.  We were asked if we'd like individual hot pots or a communal one and we chose the communal pot.  

The process is easy...pick what type of broth you want, then order your raw items to throw in it, and you can pick up more items from the conveyor belt if you're sitting close to it.  

For $75.28 we got a yin-yang pot of broth, a small order of enoki mushrooms, grilled shrimp, grilled chicken gizzards, fresh thick noodles, napa cabbage, hand-cut angus beef, beef meatballs, steamed rice, pork dumplings, chicken breast slices, three soft drinks, scallops, sausage, salmon, and crab sticks. 

After ordering we were urged to check out the condiment bar in the middle of the restaurant.  It's a circular table with pots of seasonings and sauces and everything was labeled but the writing had faded off of the labels so it was impossible to tell what was inside.  After peeking inside all the containers I chose a spoonful of an unknown brown goo that turned out to be quite tasty.  

They were out of a few items we wanted to order like the wagyu fried rice, duck flippers, and the server didn't even know what the pumpkin cake was even though it's on their menu.  They are still pretty new and trying to get the hang of things I guess.  

Grilled chicken gizzard skewers were tasty! They were a little spicy but tender and yummy. The "grilled shrimp skewer" from their menu was just 6 grilled shrimp on a plate. No skewer LOL weird! 

Items coming down the conveyor belt are not labeled and I couldn't really tell what all of them were.  There were a few items that looked like they were fried balls or dumplings but the case is refrigerated so that didn't really make sense. 

We chose half house broth and half tomato broth.  I didn't really like either one...neither was salty enough and they were both very...herbal?? Like a pho broth but thicker and pungent.  All of the items we ordered appeared fresh but none were presented in cool containers like I see in other pictures on yelp and their website.  I think you have to order one of their more expensive "combos" to get the neat presentations with the dry ice and dish gardens.  

This place is definitely worth the trip and I really enjoyed my first hot pot experience here.  The decor is awesome as well and I love love love their light fixtures and modern tables.
Amazing food, awesome service! Thank you Kwan and to the Chubby Cattle clan! I highly recommend this restaurant!
Delicious hot pots!  A very hip place & very friendly staff, especially our server, Deni, extremely helpful! Definitely coming back! Actually this's the second time in one week.

I just wanted to try it because of the conveyor belt. They had really good quality meats and seafood. The conveyor belt was cool but I didn't really use it because Anything good you had to order it. I didn't feel like the soup had any flavor but maybe my expectations were to high. It was just an okay place.
Cute place for lunch/dinner! I like how you get to make your own sauce  I just wish there were more flavors of broth to choose from.

Really good hot pot place!! I sauce station is everything!! It's fabulous!! You can look at food move by you on the belt. My only request is the quality of meat can be better, it doesn't look that fresh.

Overall: If there were a Chubby Cattle in Southern California, I might actually get hot pot more often. They have solid soup bases and fresh food at a decent price point for a build-your-own hot pot place. It's more of a 4.5, but I am rounding it to a 5.

Food: 4.5

How It Works: You pick a soup base, which is priced per person, and then you order protein, veggies, and noodles to put in your broth. There's a bar for you to get condiments, including sauces and garnishes.

House Original Pot: This is a traditional broth with dried jujubes, Chinese herbs, corn, and a few other veggies. It might not be for everyone because it does smell and taste a little like those Chinese herbal medicines, but I thought it was nice on a super cold night. Tip: Add a little fried garlic and green onions to round off the flavors.

Assorted Mushroom Pot: As it name states, it is a broth made with an assortment of mushrooms. This is one of my favorites because I love mushrooms.

Dragon King Seafood Pot: If you love seafood, this is the broth that you should pick. Their online menu has 3 different choices as 3 different price points, but they only had 1 choice ($6.99) on the day that I visited.

We ordered Beef Tongue, Seafood Combo Platter, and Veggie Combo Platter. All of the food was really fresh. I definitely recommend ordering the platters to share because they are a better deal and they allow you to try a decent variety if it's your first time. We definitely did not spend a lot (~ $60), but we were stuffed.

ALSO, the owners gave us a free order of wagyu beef because they found out that we were visiting from a different state. Yay!

Service: 4.5

Our waiter was very patient with us and even made some recommendations to help us save money because it was our first time. However, I wished that he explained the restaurant concept to us in a little more detail. He did not explain the conveyor belt or the sauce table to us, so we had to figure that out on our own.

However, the owners do seem to care a lot about what their patrons think. A woman, who I assume is the manager, stopped by to ask us about our meal. She also promised that they would read any comments that we left on their comment sheet or on Yelp. Hopefully, they actually act upon the input that the customers give.

Ambiance: 3.5

The restaurant is located in a quiet plaza not far from the Strip. Even though we came fairly late (~9 pm), there was still a short wait of about 20-30 minutes. I believe that they have a couple of private rooms in addition to the common dining area. The restaurant is pretty cute and decently clean. However, the restaurant could benefit from better ventilation as the smell of all the broths can be slightly overwhelming when you first step into the restaurant. Furthermore, the bathroom is surprisingly dirty in contrast to the restaurant.

This is he 4th or 5th time I've been here and I have always had a good experience. I always get the hellish spicy pot mid level. I really like spicy food. I grab a few items from the conveyor belt such as mushrooms, tofu, and other goodies. I like to order both lamb and beef to cook in the broth. Kwan and Gilbert are both exceptional staff and I have never had a problem. I really recommend giving this place a try.
First time we've been here. Matthew our server is awesome taught how to do this Mang. Thanks Matthew!!!!!

Great spot if you're looking for a good local hotpot place! I enjoy the a la carte style of ordering, so each order is easily customizable, and the sauce bar is amazing. The service is great and the staff is very proactive if you have any questions.

Hot pots featuring traditional Chinese medicine ingredients for tonifying the body has been around for a while. The Chubby Cattle, literally translated as Cow Demon King, is one of the best.  Ingredients are fresh, and the flavors are delicious.  Do not spend extra on the fancy $25 Waygu beef.  We tried it, and it was no where as tasty as the ribeye at $9.99.  The large condiment bar has every flavor you want for dipping, but be careful or you will go home stinking of delicious garlic.

Negatives were - broken credit card machine forced me to drive to an ATM at 11 PM in Vegas.  Seriously, what self respecting business doesn't have a mechanical swiper? 
It took about 10 minutes at 10 PM to find parking due to the packed lot.  You may consider parking near by.  

Our second visit was smoother, with a working credit card and a much more varied edm mix.  We will be back.

Of you are reading this, what are you waiting for?! Stand up, drive to chubby cattle and eat some good, delicious soup!!! I love the individual soup pan idea, one can put whatever condiments they already provide.. servers are fast and attentive as well.. this restaurant is very perfect this winter season, i just hope they would open for lunch!!! Or better yet, open for 24hrs!!! Sooo good!!!

Great service from James and manager, Sylvia! Fresh food in interesting atmosphere. Interesting array of soup making ingredients, each one adding to the flavor. Server kept adding more broth forcing me to take home for a memorable lunch the following day!
I like the serivece here. Greate service with great server Deni! Good food and good taste ,never regret to eat here.

Kwan was our server and he recommended us many good dishes and suggested us which soup base to get. We ended up ordering the beef combo and brisket, it kept our tummy very warm for the cold days 

Excellent customer service and food!
This is a very authentic Chinese Hot Pot restaurant. The Lame skewer is very tender. Highly recommend if you want to try Chinese food.
First time here.  Excellent food and fast service. Shout out to Kwan for the excellent service he provided.
Amazzinggggg food and service.... Deni was an exceptional server!! So glad trie them out :)
Great spot. great food and good service for reasonable prices.  Vodka was a bit on the expensive side ;  I highly recommend.

Went to this place twice because I liked it enough the first time to come back again - the second time with my family (a total group of 7). 

FOOD: I really enjoyed this place because of how many options you get given the conveyor belt. You start off with a soup base - the first time I tried the spicy soup base which I didn't like too much but 2nd time I got the tomato soup which reminded me a lot of Thai tom yum soup yum! We ordered the beef combo which comes with a generous amount of meat for around $17. My go to items for the conveyor belt are the rice cake, tofu, and fish balls but haven't really had the chance to try everything. All in all, I understand how people can get lost or feel overwhelmed with the menu. 

SERVICE: Main reason for a 3 star rating instead of 5 is because of how my family and I were initially treated when we came in. We came in around 11:30p looking to try their buy one get one on the conveyor belt stuff. When we came in, I told the host we had a party of 7 and a lady said "Uhhhh 7?" And continued to quickly walk away saying something I didn't understand. Right when we were seated, the same lady told us that we need to "please hurry and order quick" because the kitchen closed in 10 minutes. What? Your hours say you close at 12:30a? Then, a male server approached our table immediately and asked us if we were ready to order even though we weren't even given menus yet! He then started to tell us that they weren't doing the buy one get one special since it was a holiday, but it was Dec 29? By this time, I was so annoyed and ready to leave but decided to stay since we drove all this way and was really excited for my family to try this place. The male server then continued to tell us that we need to hurry because their kitchen is closed and I asked if we could still get stuff from the conveyor belt and he said they were closing it down very soon and we may not have time. So we quickly got our food from the conveyor belt and during this time, we were told multiple times by the same and different people that they closed in 5 mins. Ok, ok I get it that's why we're rushing. The lady came back to our table and asked "did you order yet??". I was shocked - your hours say you close at 12:30. Keep the kitchen open until then or change your hours! I know not to expect much in terms of service for restaurants in Chinatown but this was just unacceptable.

Came here on a Tuesday night and it wasn't too busy. There was a wait at the Conveyor belt seating though so we decided to just sit at a table and was sat right away. Service was pretty good. Food got here quick and the drinks were refilled in a timely manner. Food was good. We ordered a variety of meats, seafood, veggie/mushrooms combos and I must say I think i liked the veggies/mushrooms the most. Overall the place was good. Clean and decorated nicely. Even had some Halloween decorations.

This was my first time here took a lovely lady with me who isn't as brave as I am and they helped with the whole experience and made it so much fun and delicious.  Spend the money go here have fun and interact with your friends and loved ones instead of being on your phone great date spot

This is the worst hot pot restaurant I have ever been. Their services always busy, it takes 15 minutes for a cup of ice water, and the attitude is rude. Vegetables are not fresh at all, half green half yellow. Also we tried their  MOST FAMOUS live lobster, unfortunately, it is frozen. So, don't waste you guys' money and time here.

Great option for Chinese hot pot; here's the lowdown ~

THE GOOD
+ seafood quality
+ vegetable quality
+ portions
+ vegan/vegetarian selections
+ open sauce bar (loved this!) 

THE DECENT
~ broth
~ forgetful, but apologetic service 
~ pretty pricy

THE BAD 
- conveyor belt stuff, the items you order off the menu seem more fresh 


Overall, a great (but pricy) soup option in Chinatown. Be wary of over ordering, and bring an appetite!

TIP: ponzu, green onions, and garlic is always a safe base if you're a newbie at the sauce bar

Absolutely delicious! Mathew our server was very great and brought out our soup base pretty quick. Great wide selection with the conveyor belt making it convenient to grab anything you want for your own hot pot. Even if you can't grab the item you want, you can just order it from the menu. Joyce, one of the managers, was very hospitable and gracious. Overall, great food, amazing service and great idea for hot pot.

Never had hot pot before. Didn't really know what to expect. Pretty nice place, very clean. Service is very good. Servers are very attentive and friendly. Tomato broth was delicious! The "hellish" spicy broth was loaded with peppers! So many options to spice up your hot pot! Pretty decent price for food! I would recommend!

This place was amazing. We wanted to get off the strip for dinner and we hit the jackpot. This was our first time eating at a hotpot restaurant. The staff walked us through how it all worked and helped us order. We will definitely go back if we ever go to Vegas again.
Good place. The food is good and nice. Service by Den. Nice guy. The hot pot is very especial that you can pick up what you want.

The food was amazing, quality of the meat, vegetables and all the side dishes were amazing as well. The staff was very kind. Must be the best hot pot I ever had. Price is very reasonable for the large portions. The location of the restaurant is very convenient, near by has a lot of desert shops. The inside is very clean and big.

Great service. Our server, Bin was so helpful and gave great recommendations. Broth was flavorful and we had the house broth to start. 

I recommend the lamb with the house broth. We also had beef. 

Their guide to mixing ingredients for the sauce bar was really helpful. The restaurant was super clean and service was fast. I can't wait for them to open in Denver!!

Cute little place that just opened up a few weeks ago. We decided to come here last minute for a nice dinner night and were greeted with a wait time of about 20 minutes. I can definitely see this place go up to 1-1.5hr wait times after the word gets out on this place, especially on weekend nights. Make a reservation if you could! 

If you want to spend a leg and an arm, you should definitely check out Chubby Cattle! It's clean, new and the "restaurant" that everyone is talking about these days. Unfortunately, we had a mixed review about this place. First of all, we didn't order a dish and another server delivered it to our desk and got frustrated when we said it wasn't ours. Our original server came to check on us and he apologized profusely for the mistake. The other server just walked away with attitude and mumbled something in Chinese back to the kitchen. I wasn't uncomfortable with that. 

Again, this is a Asian restaurant so I knew I had to expect sometime of stereotypical service, right? After we got our broth, my partner's heater didn't turn on and struggled to heat up for at least 15-20 minutes. No, I'm seriously not exaggerating. I felt so bad because he had to wait for his soup to boil. He couldn't use mines because he didn't like spicy. Poor guy. 

For our main dishes, we got the beef and lamb combo for each of us and a bowl of mushrooms to share. We sat across from the conveyer belt too and it was fun to pick and choose bowls to eat. This was awesome since I grabbed a lot of the seafood dishes from here, which were amazing by the way!

Overall, this place was an interesting experience to check out. Aside from the rude interaction with one of the servers, the rest of the staff was super accommodating and friendly. The place was relatively clean too. Unfortunately, I wouldn't really come back here since I felt like the place was a bit overpriced.
I came here many times this is favorite place.The food excellent. Deni is friendly. Very good service.

I'm a tough critic, so often go off the strip for the gems of Vegas.  This place just opened and doesn't disappoint.  The novelty is fantastic, but the food is equally a small impressive.  What is great is as you add items to your soup base the flavor of the broth changes making the meal evolve.  And you can continually experimenting adding items and eating them.  The meats are amazingly fresh as are the conveyor items.  This place is not a fad and will be around for a while.  Maybe they will franchise

Chubby Cattle!!!  The first time I heard the name of this restaurant, I thought it was a steakhouse.  Surprised to find out that I was incorrect.  

Found out the following from their website: "As a reformer of the traditional Mongolian Cuisine, Chubby Cattle is the first restaurant in the world to combine a refrigerated, conveyor belt-based hotpot with the finest traditional hotpot from Asia."  Now I knew what to expect after reading this.

The restaurant is located in a crowded strip mall.  Finding a parking spot during the peak time that we arrived was a challenge.  Once inside, we were seated right away.  We ended up ordering items from their menu.  Yeah, we did not try one item from their conveyor belt.  Got to say that it did look cool, though.  Everything was labeled nicely.  Depending on the color of the plate, prices ranged from $3.99 to $9.99
