Tried two different broths.  The House Original and the Mushroom.  Personally, I preferred the Original.  The meats tasted so good cooked in that broth.  Also tried the Seafood Combo platter and Potato Noodles.  All good!

Don't know if I would return.  I am not crazy about "cooking" my own food.  It was a good experience, service was terrific, and the food was delish.  Give them a go if you are in Sin City!

Been here few times. Expensive and smelly but I've aways enjoyed it. Staff are very nice too. Don't forget to ask for your free desert, they don't offer it, so ask!


Tip: for your clothing, wear something you will be ready to wash after eating here, it will smell bad guarantee and leave your designer bag at home or in the car.

This place's hours are constantly changing. On yelp it says 12:00, but the kitchen actually closes at 11:30. Not sure how anybody can plan to go here if the hours are always changing and incorrect online. We showed up at 11:20 expecting to have a nice meal and got turned away. Really unprofessional.

this is the worst customer service i hardly see in Vegas.... I call 4 hour early to make a reservation for 2 people.. and get conform. But when I be there 5min early they said sorry u have to Waite 30 min. Before I call I did saw a bed review about complain about the Waite and the mistake they made for the Waite line..  the most important is they fk up my Christmas date

Who can say no to Hot Pot..... I'm planning to keep my relationship with this place for a very long time. Casual dining place. Always feel comfortable walking in with my flip flops. Love the soup base. Quality of the meat isn't too bad. This is a Chinese Hot Pot restaurant.. don't be looking for Shabu Shabu here please.

Great concept,  fresh food, and the presentation was really nice.

We had a private room, with 6 individual pots per table. We chose mushroom, original, seafood and tomato broth. For food, we ordered dumplings, seafood, beef, and vegetables. The center of the table houses a large steamer, which was stocked with raw rice. The steaming food cooked and infused flavor into the rice, giving it it a unique flavor and texture. The meats were presented on special trays. Veggies came on carved wooden bowls. Noodles were served uncooked, and were dipped into the broths. 

Tomato broth is the best. I didn't care for the seafood broth.

My only complaint is that the table would be better served with 4 or 5 pots, rather than 6, to accommodate the trays of food and baskets of veggies.h

Had to try this place with friends from out of town since we've never tried anything that had a conveyer belt before. When you first walked in it smelled of soup and seafood. It was quite busy when we came, but there were empty tables so we were into our booth fairly quickly. Our server took quite awhile to come say hi and ask us for our drinks. I don't eat shabu shabu very often so I wanted him to explain what we were supposed to do. Instead, he just dismissed me and said go pick up your sauce and look at the menu and I'll come back. So the entire table went to get the sauces they wanted and came back. Then we ordered our soup base I guess that's what he called it. He suggested not to order the spicy if we couldn't handle it and so I just got one that wasn't spicy. 

 It took 4 times of asking to actually get our drinks and he never came back to ask us if we had any questions or if we were doing okay. That's one part of the reason they got a 2 Star rating from me. 

We had to figure out the whole conveyer belt thing on our own and asked several other workers what things were since our waiter was non existent. We managed to get through dinner without our waiter and the food was okay not the best shabu shabu I've had. 

When we were finally done our waiter showed up to give us the bill. We asked two split it between two people and evenly between two cards. Easy enough right? Boy was this wrong! We all were so confused and saw he charged my card twice for the same amount. We wanted to make sure he never charged our friends card before we left and let him know he made a mistake if indeed he didn't charge the card. 

So we waited for him and when he finally showed up he kept pestering me to take my card back so he could credit back what his mistake was and charge the other card instead. I at first kindly told him no that's fine. Then he kept insisting. That made me angry so I told him no again and said you might instead charge me a third time since you have already charged me twice and I don't want to deal with that hassle so let it be and just learn from your mistakes tonight. That's the second reason they got the two Star rating.
